column5: あ、また気絶した‥‥。
column6: Ah...She passed out again...

column5:
ちょっとメイ！\n
見てないで手伝ったらどうなの?!
column6:
Hey, May!\n
How about you _help_ instead of just watching!?

column5:
大丈夫、気絶してるだけよ。
それよりも、どうするの？\n
じきに雨がくるわよ。
column6:
It's all right[nbsp]-- she's only fainted.\n
More importantly, what should we do?\n
It's just about to rain.

column5:
そ、そうですね。\n
とりあえず‥洋館の中に入りません
か？
column6:
Th-that's right.\n
For now...why don't we go into the mansion?

column5:
おいおい、そう困らせないで
くれよ。
column6: Hey hey, don't make this any worse than it has to be.

し、メインスタッフ達が来るまでに
準備は済ませておきたいんだ。
column6: We're going to be filming in there anyways, and I want the setup over with before the main staff gets here.

ま、恐いんなら一人でバスに
残っててもいいんだがね。
column6: But hey, if you're scared, you can just stay in the bus by yourself.

column5:
じょ、冗談でしょ!!\n
恐いわけないじゃないっ！

Wh-what a joke!\n
As _if_ I'd be scared!

column6: Oh MAN, it feels _PERFECT_!

column5:
あ、あやか。\n
たたのしそうですね。

A-Ayaka.\n
You seem ha-happy.

あれ？\n
ナビちゃん、恐いの？\n
言葉につまってるよぉ。

Oh?\n
Navi, are you scared? You're stuttering.

column5:
いいえぇ。\n
そんなはずありませんです。

No.\n

column5:
ただ‥じょうずにはなせない
だけです。

column5:
ふ〜ん。\n
もっと勉強しなきゃね。
column6:
Hmm.\n
You've gotta study harder.

column5:
ねぇねぇメイちゃん。\n
ちょっと歩きまわってみようよ！
column6:
Hey, hey, May!\n
Let's walk around a little!

column5:
それじゃぁですね、メイ。\n
\c<$0B>十字キー\c<$0F>を押した方向に\c<$0B>歩けます\c<$0F>で
す。
column6:
Okay now then, May.\n
You can \c<$0B>walk\c<$0F> in the direction you push onto the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F>.

column5:
それから‥人に接触している
時に、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押せばですね。\n
その人に\c<$0B>話しかける\c<$0F>事ができます。
column6: Then...When you're touching someone, if you press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>? You can \c<$0B>talk to\c<$0F> that person.

思った時も、その場所の前に立って\c<$0B>
[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押してくださいです。
column6: When you think you want to \c<$0B>investigate\c<$0F> somewhere that interests you, stand in the front of it and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:

[II]ボタン\c<$0F>を押せば\c<$0B>コマンド\c<$0F>が表示さ
れます。

Um, uhh, and...\n
If you press the \c<$0B>II Button\c<$0F>, \c<$0B>commands\c<$0F> will be displayed.

さいです。

\s<$01>[2x]おい！[1x]\s<$02>\n
\n

かんなは気絶するし、雨は降りそう

女性の優子さんに、気絶した

うふふ、心配してくれてあり

column5:
私から言い出した事だし‥、
こう見えても力はあるのよ。
column6:

Despite my appearance, I have power.

column5:
うふふ、心配してくれてあり
がと。でも大丈夫。
column6: Heh-heh-heh...Thanks for the concern. But I'm fine.

column5:
私から言い出した事だし‥、
こう見えても力はあるのよ。

この屋敷で‥２０年前に何が

咽が乾いたら、いつでも言っ

咽が乾いたら、いつでも言っ

いいかげんな事を言って、か
んなを恐がらせないでよ。\n

青いラインが気に入らないけど‥。

考えすぎだよぉ。

c-clasp\s<$1E> \s<$02>gets\s<$0A> \s<$02>disconnecteded.

ん！\n

ううん、私は見てないわ‥。

す。

す。

column5:
ナビ\n
ＭＥＣ社から発売される人工知性体\n
この姿はホログラム映像なんだよ。
column6:
Navi\n
An artifical intelligence to be sold by MEC Corporation. This form is a holographic image.

column5:
立花　綾華（たちばな　あやか）\n
ボクと同じ事務所の女優。１４歳。\n
子供な所が、また可愛いんだよねぇ
column6:
Ayaka Tachibana\n
An actress with the same company as me. 14 years old. She's a bit childish, but cute too, huh?

column5:
三原　かんな（みはら　かんな）\n
１５歳。女優としては大人しすぎる\n
感じがするね。色気はあるけど。
column6:
Kanna Mihara\n
15 years old. Doesn't she seem too meek to be an actress? She's alluring, though.

column5:
柳　素子（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
１６歳の女優。すっごくキツイ性格\n
してる。ボクは好きじゃないなぁ。
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
A 16-year-old actress. She's got a REALLY uptight personality. I don't like her.

column5:
幻条　優子（げんじょう　ゆうこ）
２７歳の霊能タレント。霊能力の話
はともかく、きれいな人だよねぇ。
column6:
Yuuko Genjou\n
A 27-year-old celebrity psychic. Psychic power stuff aside, she sure is pretty.

column5:
沢田　重樹（さわだ　しげき）\n
カメラさん。これでも２７歳。\n
仕事にはキビしい人みたい。
column6:
Shigeki Sawada\n
A cameraman. Despite his looks, he's 27. Seems like a stickler when it comes to his job.
column7: NOTE: これでも is presumably referring to his portrait, displayed on the screen

column5:
笹木　忠雄（ささき　ただお）\n
雑務担当の２２歳。一流大学の黒ミ\n
サ同好会出身だってウワサ。
column6:
Tadao Sasaki\n
A 22-year-old handling routine duties. Rumors say he was in a group at an elite university that held a Black Mass.

column5:
白木　厚志（しらき　あつし）\n
２４歳のアシスタントディレクター\n
なんか、頼りない人だよねぇ。
column6:
Atsushi Shiraki\n
A 24-year-old assistant director. Doesn't seem like the world's most reliable guy.

column5:
篠田　正次（しのだ　しょうじ）\n
照明担当の２５歳。無口で、愛想の\n
悪い人だよねぇ…。
column6:
Shouji Shinoda\n
A 25-year-old in charge of lighting. Kind of a quiet and distant guy...

column5: 白の台本
column6: White Script[sp]<$4A>
column7:
NOTE: 台本 = "script", as in e.g. a movie script, to go with the actress theme.
the menu layout was ~unfortunately~ not designed for strings of this length, so i've adjusted the code to target a more uniform width instead of having a significantly wider third column. thus, we need an extra 8 pixels of spacing per option compared to the original game.

column5: 赤の台本
column6: Red Script[sp]<$94>

column5: 青の台本
column6: Blue Script[br3]
column7: NOTE: original game relies on auto-linewrap to generate a linebreak after this option; we have to do it manually

column5: 緑の台本
column6: Green Script[sp]<$4A>

column5: 黒の台本
column6: Black Script[sp]<$94>

column6: Don't save

column6: Unable to save.

column5: セき誘隼

これ、発電機だよね。\n
これが動けば、電灯がつくんじゃな
い？
column6:
This is a generator, right?\n
Maybe the lights will come on if it's running?

column5:
発電機を調べる\n
発電機を動かす\n
やめる
column6:
Investigate the generator\n
Turn on the generator\n
Quit

column5:
一応、動いてはいるけど‥。
なんか頼りないなぁ。
column6: Looks like it's running for now, but...it doesn't seem too reliable.

column5:
小型の発電機みたい。\n
燃料は‥‥、軽油を使ってるみたい
だね。
column6:
Looks like a small-scale generator.\n
It seems to run on...diesel oil.

column5:
これを動かせば、館の明りが
つくんじゃないかな？
column6: If I turn this on, maybe the mansion's lights will come on?

column5:
軽油をつかう小型発電機。\n
軽油はあるけど‥壊れてないといい
んだけどねぇ。
column6: A small generator that runs on diesel oil. I have the oil...but I'd hate to break it.

column5:
このヒモを引っ張れば動くみ
たい。\n
よっ、と！
column6:
It looks like it'll come on if I pull this cord.\n
Here goes!

column5:
ふぅ、動くわけないか。\n
燃料が入ってないんだもんね。
column6: (sigh)...Guess there's no way it'd work. After all, there's no fuel in it.

column5: 軽油を入れてっ、とぉ。\n
column6: In goes the oil...There.

column5: やったぁ!!
column6: All right!

column5: な、なに？今の音‥‥。
column6: Wh-what...was that sound...?

column5:
ろうかのおくに、なにかいま
す‥‥。
column6: There's something down the hall...
column7: NOTE: she calls it "nanika" = "something", but uses "imasu", indicating an animate/living thing, which is sort of leaning toward the idea of a ghost in a way that's hard to convey in english

column5: み、見ちゃったぁ‥‥。
column6: I...I saw it...

column5:
ちょっと何よ！\n
ノックもしないで人の部屋に入って\n
こないで！
column6:
Hey, what's your problem!?\n
Don't barge into someone's room without knocking!

column5:
あ、ごめん。\n
かんなと一緒じゃなかったの？
column6:
Oh, sorry.\n
Weren't you with Kanna?

column5:
かんなは下。\n
私は忘れ物を取りに来ただけなの！\n
column6:
Kanna's downstairs.\n
I just came back to get something I forgot!

column5:
ったく、がさつなんだから。
早く出ていきなさいよっ！
column6:
God, you're so uncivilized.\n
Get out of here already!

column5:
ねぇねぇ、かんなちゃん。\n
綾華ねぇ、ユーレイ見た‥‥んぐ。
column6:
Hey hey, Kanna!\n
Ayaka saw a gho--\n
MMPH.

column5:
しっ！また気絶しちゃうじゃ
ない。
column6: Shh! She'll faint again.

column5:
ねぇ、かんな。\n
素子と一緒じゃないの？
column6:
Hey, Kanna.\n
Weren't you with Motoko?

column5:
うん‥。\n
忘れ物を取りに行くって、さっき部
屋に戻っていったわ。
column6:
Yes...\n
She said she was going to get something she forgot and went back to the room earlier.

column5: なにか‥‥‥恐いわ‥。
column6: For some reason...I'm scared...

column5:
幽霊を見た？\n
[expr]<$01>は！寝ぼけてんじゃないわよっ！
column6:
You saw a ghost?\n
[expr]<$01>Ha! You were just daydreaming, weren't you!?

column5:
ったく、ほんと暗いわね。\n
ここは電気もつかないの？
column6:
Geez, it's so dark.\n
Don't the lights here come on?

column5:
へぇ。\n
ちゃんと電気もつくじゃない。
column6: Oh, so the lights work after all.

column5:
明るくなって良かった‥。\n
やっぱり明るいと安心するね。
column6:
Thank goodness it's brighter...\n
Having things lit up is calming, isn't it?

column5:
ふぅん。ダーツの的があるの
ね。\n
ちょっと‥やってみようかな。
column6:
Hmm...So there's a dartboard.\n
Maybe I should give it a try.

column5:
素子って、ダーツが得意な
の。
column6: Motoko is good at darts.

column5:
もとこ？？\n
‥‥なにしてるんでしょうか？
column6:
Motoko??\n
...What are you doing?

column5:
あらあら、このおちびさんは
ダーツも知らないのね。
column6: Oh, my, so the little shrimp doesn't know about darts?

column5:
この矢を、その的に当てるの
よ。\n
的の中央に当てれば高得点ってわけ
column6: You hit that board with these arrows. You get the most points if you hit the very middle.

column5:
素子ってすごいのよ！\n
ほとんど真中に当てるんだもん！
column6:
Motoko's amazing!\n
They're almost all hitting the center!

column5:
ほっほっほ、それほどでもな
いけどね。
column6: Ho-ho-ho! It's not that big a deal.

column5:
素子ってすごいのよ！\n
ほとんど真中に当てるんだもん！
column6:
Motoko's amazing!\n
They're almost all hitting the center!

column5:
ほっほっほ、それほどでもな
いけどね。
column6: Ho-ho-ho! It's not that big a deal.

column5:
素子ってすごいのよ！\n
ほとんど真中に当てるんだもん！
column6:
Motoko's amazing!\n
They're almost all hitting the center!

column5:
あれ、篠田さん。\n
お疲れさまです。
column6:
Oh, Shinoda.\n
Thanks for all that hard work.
...Yeah.

column5: ずいぶん広い居間ね。
column6: Such a large living room.

column5: ほんと、うらやましいっ!!
column6: Seriously! I'm SO jealous!

column5:
あ！ゆ、優子さん‥。そんな
ソファに座ったら、衣装が汚れます
よ。
column6: Oh! M-Miss Yuuko...If you sit on that sofa, you'll get your clothes dirty.

column5:
え？あ、あら、いやだ。\n
わたし、何てバカな事してるのかし\n
ら。
column6:
Huh? O-oh, dear me.\n
I've done quite the foolish thing, haven't I?

column5:
お風呂でもあればいいんだけ
ど‥探してみようかな。\n
それじゃね。
column6:
It'd be nice if there was a bathtub around...I think I'll look for one.\n
See you later.

column5:
優子さんって‥‥‥ヌケてる
よね。
column6: Miss Yuuko's sure absent-minded, huh?

column5:
あんたには、言われたくない
よ‥。
column6: I don't want to hear that coming from you...

column5: ずいぶん古いオルゴールだね
column6: What an old music box.

column5:
でも、きれいな音を出してた
でしょう？\n
なんか、懐かしいわよね。
column6:
But it was making a lovely sound, wasn't it?\n
It's somehow nostalgic.

column5:
ほこりだらけになっちゃった\n
わね。\n
ほんと、わたしってバカよね。
column6:
I've gotten all covered in dust.\n
What a fool I am.

column5:
シャワー室は見つけたんだけ
ど‥‥水が冷たいのよ。
column6: I found a shower room...but the water is cold.

column5:
はぁ、こんな古い館じゃ、お
湯が出ないのも当然かしらね。\n
仕方ないから、あきらめるわ。
column6: (sigh)...I suppose it's no surprise there'd be no hot water in an old mansion like this. There's not much I can do, so I'll just give up on it.

column5:
そっか。\n
ボイラーに火が入ってないから、お
湯が出ないんだ‥。
column6:
Oh, right.\n
Without a fire in the boiler, there wouldn't be any hot water...

column5:
‥‥‥やっぱり、この館には
霊がいたわ。
column6: ...As I thought, there was a spirit in this mansion.

column5:
ガガ〜ン!!\n
ゆ、優子さんも見たの?!
column6:
GYAAAGH!\n
M-Miss Yuuko, you saw it too!?

column5:
残念ながら、はっきりと見た
わけじゃないけど‥。
column6: Unfortunately, I couldn't see it clearly, but...

column5:
緑色っぽいモノが、二階の廊
下を横切っていったわ。
column6: A green sort of thing was crossing the second floor corridor.

column5:
鳥肌がたつくらい、強烈な霊
気を感じたし‥。
column6: I felt a mysterious presence, strong enough to give me goosebumps...

column5:
あぁ、かんなを‥いや、三原
さんを見なかった？
column6: Ah[nbsp]-- you seen Kanna...I mean, Mihara?

column5:
え？ええと、一階の応接室に
いたけど‥。
column6: Huh? Uh, she was in the parlor on the first floor...

column5: ‥そうか。
column6: ...I see.

column5:
なぁんか、不機嫌そうだった
ねぇ。
column6: He kinda seemed like he was in a bad mood.

column5:
‥どいてろ。\n
外に出てるんだ。
column6:
...Outta my way.\n
Get out.

column5:
ふん、幽霊なんて出ないじゃ\n
ないの。\n
こけおどしね！
column6: Hmph[nbsp]-- some ghost or whatever's not going to pop out. She's just bluffing!
column7: NOTE: talking to motoko after triggering the yuuko shower event, during the brief span of time where she and kanna are walking to/inside the dining room but before shinoda shows up

column5: メイ達は外に出ててよ。
column6: Get out of here, you two.

column5: なにか‥‥‥恐いわ‥。
column6: For some reason...I'm scared...

column5:
まったく、弱虫なんだから。\n
もう気絶しないでよね。
column6:
Geez, you're such a fraidy-cat.\n
Don't faint again, okay?

column5:
お願い‥‥わたし達だけに
して‥。
column6: Please...Leave us on our own...

column5:
あぁ、かんなを‥いや、三原
さんを見なかった？
column6: Ah[nbsp]-- you seen Kanna...I mean, Mihara?

column5:
え？ええと、１階のダイニン
グにいたけど‥。
column6: Huh? Uh, she was in the dining room on the first floor...
column7: NOTE: you'd almost certainly never see this if you weren't looking for it -- immediately after triggering the yuuko shower event, you have to dash down to the first floor interior and talk to kanna, then run to intercept shinoda before he can get into the dining room. the window of opportunity is only a few seconds. good on the writers for actually preparing dialogue for it, i guess.

column5: ‥そうか。
column6: ...I see.

column5:
いいかげんにしなさいよっ！
今度やったら、本気で怒るわよ!!
column6:
QUIT IT already!\n
Next time, I'm gonna be seriously pissed!
column7: NOTE: message for barging into motoko's room multiple times. this one is actually displayed after the next one for some reason.

column5:
ひょっとして、あなた‥。\n
わざとやってるんじゃないでしょう
ね！
column6:
Hey, wait a minute...\n
You're doing this on purpose, aren't you!?

column5:
素子、遅いわね‥。\n
何やってるのかしら。
column6:
Motoko's late...\n
What could she be doing?

column5: ちょっと待っ‥。
column6: Hang o--

column5: これ以上、つきまとうな。
column6: Quit following me around.
Wha--!?

column5:
つまらんものを見せたな。\n
忘れろ。
column6:
What you saw is nothing.\n
Forget about it.
column7: NOTE: this line is recycled verbatim for the art gallery, in the context of shinoda peeping on yuuko in the shower

column5:
かんな‥‥‥。\n
\s<$32>メ\s<$02>[expr]<$01>イ、お願いだから‥外に出てて。
column6:
Kanna...\n
\s<$32>M\s<$02>[expr]<$01>ay, please...Go away.

column5:
ご‥ごめんね‥‥変なとこ\n
見せちゃったね‥‥‥‥ぐすん。
column6: S...Sorry...I made you watch something weird...(sniff)

column5:
浴室かぁ‥。\n
う〜ん、シャワーでも浴びたい気分\n
だぞ。
column6:
A shower room...\n
Hmm, I think I could go for one now.

column5:
シャワーを浴びる\n
やめる
column6:
Take a shower\n
Quit

column5:
‥さすがにムリか。\n
水が出ないんだもんね。
column6:
...Not happening, of course.\n
The water's not coming out.

column5: お?!ちゃんと水が出るよ。
column6: Oh!? The water's coming out.

column5:
でもお湯は出ないんだね。こ
れじゃぁシャワーなんか浴びられな
いよ。風邪ひいちゃうもん！
column6: But the _hot_ water's not. You can't take a shower like this[nbsp]-- you'll catch a cold!

column5:
優子さんの言うとおりだね。\n
お湯が出ないよ。
column6:
It's like Miss Yuuko said.\n
There's no hot water.

column5:
これでシャワーなんか浴びた
ら、風邪ひいちゃうよ。
column6: If I take a shower like this, I'll catch a cold.

column5: 他の人達は？
column6: Where's everybody else?

column5:
スタッフはロケバスまで荷物
を取りに行ってます。
column6: The staff have gone to the bus to get the luggage.

column5:
他は‥すみません。\n
ぼくも知らないんです。
column6:
The others...Sorry.\n
I don't know about them.

column5:
え？幽霊を見たんですか？\n
[expr]<$01>しまったぁ‥僕も見たかったのに。
column6:
Huh? You saw a ghost?\n
[expr]<$01>Shoot...I wanted to see it too!

column5:
それにしても、メインスタッ
フ達は遅いですよね。
column6: You know, the main staff sure are late, aren't they?

column5:
いくら道に迷ったからって、
そろそろ到着してもよさそうなんで
すが‥。
column6: I hope they get here soon despite how lost they got, but...

column5:
うひゃぁ!!\n
真っ暗でな〜んも見えないよぉ！
column6:
HYAH!\n
It's pitch black and I can't see a thing!

column5:
ねぇねぇ、メイちゃん。\n
行くのやめようよぉ。
column6:
Hey, hey, May!\n
Let's not go in here.

column5:
引き返す\n
このまま進む
column6:
Turn back\n
Keep going

column5: げ〜、ほんとにぃ？
column6: Gah! Seriously?

column5:
綾華、メイちゃんの服につか
まってるからね。\n
お願いだから一人にしないでね。
column6: Ayaka's gonna cling to your shirt, May. Please, don't leave her alone.

column5:
しっかし、荒れはてた部屋だ
よねぇ。
column6: Well, this room's sure fallen apart.

column5:
何だか知らないけど、ジュウ
タンにも黒いシミが残ってるし‥。
column6: I can't tell what it is, but there's a black stain on the carpet...

column5: 優子‥さん？
column6: Miss...Yuuko?

column5: ここで‥事件が起こったのよ
column6: This is where...the incident happened.

column5: 事件？
column6: Incident?

column5: この床を、ごらんなさい。
column6: Look at the floor.

column5: まさか‥‥‥血？
column6: No way...Blood?

column5: そうよ。
column6: Indeed.

column5:
あなた達は、何も聞いてない
のね。\n
この館で起こったことを‥。
column6: So, you two haven't heard anything...about what took place in this mansion.

column5: 優子さんは、知ってるの？
column6: Miss Yuuko, do you know about it?

column5: ‥‥詳しくは、ないけどね。
column6: ...Well, not all the details.

column5:
またまたぁ。\n
あ、綾華、恐くなっちゃうよ。
column6:
Wait, wait, wait.\n
A-Ayaka's gonna get scared.

column5:
ふふふ‥。２０年も前の出来
事だけどね。
column6: Heh-heh-heh...Well, it was twenty long years ago.

column5:
ここは、怨霊の館‥。\n
あなたたちも気をつけた方がいいわ
よ。
column6: This is a mansion of vengeful spirits...You two should watch your step.

column5:
いまに‥良くないことが起こ
る‥‥‥。\n
私には、わかるのよ。
column6:
Before long...something terrible will happen...\n
I know it.

column5: うぅわぁ〜!!
column6: WHOOOA!

column5:
見て見て！\n
壁がこんなにボロボロになっちゃっ
てるよ！すっごいねぇ〜。
column6:
Look, look!\n
The walls are so busted up! Awesome!

column5: 綾華！
column6: Ayaka!

Ouuuuuch...[br3]
\s<$01>[2x]AAAAAAAHH!![1x]\s<$02>

column5:
ペ、ペンダント落としちゃっ
た!!\n
さ、探さなきゃ!!
column6:
I-I dropped my pendant!\n
G-gotta find it!

column5:
ふぅ、仕方ないなぁ。\n
手伝ってあげるよ。
column6:
(sigh)...Oh well.\n
I'll lend a hand.

column5:
あったあった。\n
ペンダントって、これでしょ？
column6:
There it is.\n
This is your pendant, right?

column5:
よかったぁぁ。\n
メイちゃん、ありがとうっ!!
column6:
Oh, great!\n
Thank you, May!

column5:
小さな写真だね。\n
綾華のお父さん？
column6:
It's got a little photo.\n
Is that your dad, Ayaka?

column5:
うん‥。\n
お仕事が忙しくって、あんまり会え\n
ないから‥。
column6:
Yeah...\n
He's busy with work and we don't get to see each other much, so...

column5: ね、メイちゃんのパパは？
column6: Hey, what about your papa, May?

column5:
刑事だったんだけどね。\n
‥５年前に、死んじゃった。
column6:
He was a detective, but...\n
...He died five years ago.

column5: あ‥ぅ、え〜と‥ごめんね‥
column6: Ah...um, uh...sorry...

column5:
何かが起こる予感がするわ。\s<$3C>
あ\s<$02>なた達も気をつけなさい。
column6:
I have a feeling something's going to happen.\n
\s<$3C>B\s<$02>e careful, you two.

column5:
これは‥血痕かな？\n
つまり‥あの事件は、この部屋で起
きたわけだ。
column6:
Are these...bloodstains?\n
So...that means the incident took place in this room.

column5:
ふ〜む‥‥どんな儀式をして
たんだろう‥。
column6: Hmm...Wonder what kind of ritual he was doing...

column5: 笹木さんって‥‥変。
column6: Sasaki's weird...

column5:
魔術師が住んでたって話なん
だけどな‥‥。
column6: So, there's a story about a black magician that lived here...
column7: NOTE: talking to sasaki during the very brief period where he moves from the ruined bedroom into the attached study

column5:
‥ダメです。\n
かんぜんにイッちゃってますよ。
column6:
...Nope.\n
He's totally nuts.

column5:
なぜだ‥魔術関係の本が１冊
もない！
column6: Why!? There's not a single book about magic here!

column5:
全部‥全部、自然学や動物学
関係の本ばかり！
column6: All of these...they're just science and biology books!

column5:
ちっくしょぉ‥‥！\n
楽しみにして来たのになぁ‥‥。
column6:
Damn it...!\n
I was _so_ looking forward to coming here...

column5:
あの事件の事を聞く\n
その場を立ち去る
column6:
Ask about the incident\n
Leave him

column5:
あのさ、笹木さん。\n
『あの事件』って‥２０年前の事件
を知ってるの？
column6:
Hey, Sasaki.\n
You said `the incident~...You know about the incident twenty years ago?

column5:
魔術師の事を聞く\n
その場を立ち去る
column6:
Ask about the magician\n
Leave him
column7: NOTE: again, talking to sasaki as he moves from the bedroom to the study, and you haven't heard his version of the magician story yet. how many people ever saw this?

column5:
『魔術師』って‥もしかして
２０年前にあった事件の犯人の事？
column6: This `magician~...Do you mean the culprit in the incident twenty years ago?

column5:
魔術の事を聞く\n
その場を立ち去る
column6:
Ask about magic\n
Leave him
column7: NOTE: talking to sasaki after he finishes moving from the bedroom to the study (which happens on a timer rather than a plot trigger)

column5:
『魔術』？何の事？\n
もしかして２０年前の事件に関係あ
るとか‥。
column6:
`Magic~? What do you mean?\n
Is this related to the incident twenty years ago...?

column5:
え？ええ‥。\n
２０年前まで、この屋敷には魔術師
が住んでたんです。
column6:
Huh? Yes...\n
Up until twenty years ago, a black magician lived in this mansion.

column5:
彼は‥不死の研究や悪魔の召
喚を何度も試みたそうなんですけど
ね。
column6: From what I've heard, he kept trying to research immortality and summon demons.

column5:
儀式に必要な血を得るために
多くの動物の命を奪い続けていたん
です。\s<$28>‥\s<$02>‥最初のうちはね。
column6: To acquire the blood he needed for his rituals, he would take the lives of animals.\s<$28> \s<$02>...At first.

column5: さ、最初のうち？
column6: A-at first?
\s<$01>[2x]That's right.[1x]\s<$02>
column7: NOTE: i feel like somebody was trying a bit too hard to show off the flashy text zoom feature...

column5:
いっこうに進まない研究に彼
はいらだち、その行為は、さらにお
ぞましくエスカレートしたんです。
column6: Frustrated that his research wasn't progressing at all, his acts escalated further into depravity.

column5: 人間の女性の命を‥‥。
column6: The lives of human women...

column5:
‥‥‥‥‥え〜、さて。\n
彼には、妻と幼い子供がいました。
column6:
...Right, so.\n
He had a wife and a young child.

column5:
長い間‥彼は家族から自分の
正体も、彼の続けてきた血の儀式の
事も、隠し通してきました‥‥。
column6: For a long time, he'd kept his true self and his ongoing bloody rituals secret from his family...

column5:
ところがある日、とうとう妻
にバレてしまったんですね。
column6: But then one day, his wife finally found him out.

column5:
泣き叫ぶ妻を縛りあげ、彼女
の血で、寝室に魔法陣を書き上げた
後で‥‥。
column6:
Tying up his screaming wife, he drew a magic circle on the floor of the bedroom with her blood.\n
And then...

column5:
\s<$01>[2x]うやぁっ!!\n
\n
\s<$02>[1x]もう聞きたくないよぉ！
column6:
\s<$01>[2x]YAAAAH!\s<$02>[1x][br3]
[br3]
I don't wanna hear any more!

column5:
そうですか？\n
ここからがイイところだったのに‥
残念だなぁ。
column6:
Oh, really?\n
I was just getting to the good part...\n
What a shame.

column5: 気分が悪くなってきたよ‥。
column6: I don't feel so good...

column5:
そ、それで‥結局、その魔術
師はどうなったの？
column6: S-so...What happened to the magician in the end?

column5: 死にました。
column6: He died.

column5: は？
column6: Huh?

column5:
妻が警察に電話してたんです
警察が駆けつけたとき、すでに妻は
殺されていましたけど‥。
column6: His wife had called the police. When they busted in, she'd already been killed, but...

column5:
その傍らで男も息絶えていた
らしいんですよ。
column6: At her side, he'd breathed his last as well, apparently.

column5:
警察の発表では、乱心した男
が、妻と無理心中を図ったって事に
なってますけど。
column6: According to the police report, the man, deranged, ended up plotting a forced double suicide with his wife.

column5: ふふふ‥‥はたして真実は？
column6: Heh-heh-heh...Is it really the truth?

column5:
さ、笹木さんって‥‥結構、
アブナイ人だったんだぁ。
column6: S-Sasaki's kind of a dangerous guy, huh...

column5:
大きなボイラーだぜ。\n
このかまなら、人間が１人ぐらいは
楽に入るんじゃないか？
column6:
That's a big boiler.\n
Could probably fit a person in the furnace no problem.

column5:
お願い‥ひとりにしてほし
いの‥‥。
column6: Please...I want to be alone...

column5: 素子‥‥？
column6: Motoko...?

column5:
何も聞かないで。\n
あなた達には関係ないことよ‥‥。
column6:
Don't ask anything.\n
It's got nothing to do with you...

column5:
ふぅんだ!!\n
せっかく心配してるのにぃ！
column6:
Hmph!\n
And here we are all worried about you!

column5:
大きなお世話よ！\n
綾華、あんたのそういう無神経さが
嫌いなのよっ!!
column6:
It's none of your business!\n
I can't STAND how insensitive you are, Ayaka!

column5:
べ〜っだ！\n
素子なんて死んじゃえばいいんだ！
column6:
THBTT!\n
I hope you die, Motoko!

column5: あ‥‥あぅ。
column6: Ah...ooh.

column5: どうしたんですか？あやか。
column6: What's the matter? Ayaka.

column5:
あ、綾華ね。え、その‥‥‥[expr]<$01>
ちょっと、トイレ行ってくる！
column6:
A-Ayaka...um, well...\n
[expr]<$01>I'm going to the bathroom for a sec!

column5: うにゃぁ!!
column6: UNYAAH!

column5: 綾華、大丈夫？
column6: Ayaka, are you okay?

column5:
トイレがきたな〜い！\n
イヤだよぉ‥‥‥。
column6:
The toilet's dirty!\n
It's awful...

column5:
うっひゃぁ！\n
あのトイレ、きたなすぎるの。\n
綾華、外へ行ってくるね。
column6:
Hyaah!\n
That toilet's too dirty.\n
Ayaka's going outside.

column5:
さっきも言ったでしょ?!\n
あなたには関係ないんだから、出て
いってちょうだい!!
column6:
Didn't I tell you before!?\n
It's got nothing to do with you, so GET OUT!

column5:
はぁ‥‥みっともないとこ
ろ見せちゃって‥ごめんね。\n
少し落ち着いたみたい。
column6:
(sigh)...I'm sorry I...made you see something so shameful.\n
I think I've calmed down a little.

column5:
あれ？白木さんに沢田さん‥
お疲れ様です。\n
準備は終ったんですか？
column6:
Oh? Shiraki and Sawada...\n
Thanks for all the hard work.\n
Are you done setting up?

column5: それどころじゃないんです！
column6: This is no time for that!

column5:
は？\n
何かあったんですか？
column6:
Huh?\n
Did something happen?

column5:
さっきメインスタッフから連
絡があった。
column6: We just got word from the main staff.

column5:
雨で崖崩れが発生し、道が通
れなくなってしまったらしい。
column6: The heavy rain triggered a landslide, and apparently the road's impassable.

column5:
だから、ここへ来ることがで
きなくなった。
column6: So, now they can't get here.

column5: と、いうことは‥‥。
column6: Which means...

column5: 撮影は中止だ。
column6: Filming's cancelled.

column5: それだけじゃありませんよ！
column6: It's not just that!

column5:
道が通れなくなったって事は
ぼくたちも、帰ることができないん
です！
column6: If the road's blocked, that means WE can't go back either!

column5: ち、また降ってきやがった。
column6: Tch. Here comes the damn rain again.
column7:
NOTE: based on the break in the script data here, i'm pretty sure they intended to play a thunderclap or rain sound effect between the previous line and this one, which sawada is supposed to be reacting to. (the rain stops when ayaka goes out, and starts back up again here.) but for whatever reason, they didn't put one in, so sawada just kind of says this out of the blue.

i originally translated this as "Just had to go and rain again", which is more accurate, but coming right after the previous line, it makes it sound like he's blaming the landslide on the rain. hopefully this phrasing clarifies things.

column5: あぶないっ！
column6: Look out!

column5: へっ？‥‥‥うわぁ?!
column6: Huh?...WAAH!?

column5:
ベッドは柔らかいね。\n
ほこりだらけだけど、キャンプに来
たと思えば、悪くないか。
column6:
The bed's soft.\n
It's covered in dust, but if I imagine we're camping here, I guess it's not bad.

column5:
すごい雨だねぇ。\n
当分、やまないんじゃなぁい？
column6:
What awful rain.\n
Is it just going to keep on like this?
column7: NOTE: inspecting the window in may's room

column5:
わぉ！\n
ギザギザの雷を見ちゃった。
column6:
Whoa!\n
I saw a cloud shoot lightning.
column7: NOTE: ayaka's response to the above

水は出るけど‥すごく冷たい
んだよね。
column6: There's water...but it's really cold.

column5:
これじゃあシャワーなんか浴
びれないよ。
column6: I can't take a shower like this.

column5: まっくろですね。
column6: It's pitched black.
column7:
NOTE: navi literally says that it's "pitch black" (makkuro) here. in an amusing linguistic coincidence, while this is a perfectly valid phrasing in english, it's incorrect in japanese, where this expression specifically describes the color black rather than an absence of light. thus, may corrects her to "pitch dark" (makkura) in the following line.
also, is this even used? i've never seen it in-game.

column5: 真っ暗だって‥‥‥。
column6: You mean `pitch black~...

column5: さっ、行くよナビ！
column6: Okay, let's go, Navi!

column5:
雨は、まだ降ってるね。\n
いつになったらやむんだろ。
column6:
It's still raining.\n
How long will it be before it stops?

column5: 気分が悪くなってきたよ‥。
column6: I don't feel so good...

column5:
トイレがきたな〜い！\n
イヤだよぉ‥‥‥。
column6:
The toilet's dirty!\n
It's awful...

column5:
何も聞かないで。\n
あなた達には関係ないことよ‥‥。
column6:
Don't ask anything.\n
It's got nothing to do with you...

column5: ‥つまり、こういう事だな。

お前さんとかんなは、地下室
から聴こえてくる物音に興味を持っ
て、地下へ下りた。
column6: You and Kanna heard sounds coming from the cellar that piqued your interest, and you went down to the basement.

ワイン庫に入ったとき、目の
前に緑色の幽霊が現れ、それが襲い
かかってきた。
column6: When you entered the wine cellar, a green ghost appeared right in front of you, and it rushed at you.

幽霊はかんなをら致し、そし
て彼女ともども姿を消した、と。\n
間違いないか？

The ghost kidnapped Kanna, and then the both of them vanished.\n
That all on the money?

え‥ええ、そうよ。\n
‥間違い無いわ。

Y...yes, it is.\n
...That's exactly right.

column5:
ふむ‥ま、何にせよ、かんな
が行方不明になったんなら探すしか
ないだろうな。

column5:
とりあえず、手分けして探そ
うじゃないか。

column5:
オレは地下のワイン庫から、
あたってみるとしよう。
column6: I'll check things out in the basement wine cellar.

column5: 白木。
column6: Shiraki.

column5:
お前は他の連中を探して、この事を
伝えてくるんだ。
column6: You go track down the rest of the bunch and tell 'em about this.

column5:
しかし、やっかいな事になっ
ちまったなぁ。
column6: Man, but this has turned into a bad time.

column5:
お前さんは部屋にいて、いい
んだぜ。\n
オレ達にまかせてくれていい。
column6:
You can go back to your room.\n
Leave this to us.

column5:
ああ‥‥。\n
何でこんな事になったんだろう‥。

Aah...\n
Why did this have to happen...?

column5:
‥いない。\n
篠田さんと笹木はどこに行ったんだ
ろう？

...They're not here.\n

column5:
‥優子さんも、いない。\n
どこ行ったんだ、みんな？
column6:
...Yuuko's gone too.\n
Where did everybody go?

column5: ホールにも人気はないし‥。
column6: No sign of anyone in the hall either...

column5: ここにも、いない‥。
column6: Not here either...

column5:
くそ、みんな何してるんだ?!
ぼくばっかり、こんな目にあって‥
column6:
Damn it, what're they all doing!?\n
Why does this always happen to me...?

column5:
ここにも、いないか‥‥‥？
あのシミはなんだろう。
column6:
Are they not here either...?\n
What's that stain?
column7: CHECK, not sure if he's looking for the others or kanna here

column5:
‥か、かんべんしてくれぇ。
こんな気味の悪いとこには、いたく
ないよ‥‥。
column6:
...F-forgive me!\n
I don't wanna be in this creepy place...

column5: こりゃ期待外れだったかな。
column6: This wasn't what I expected.

column5:
魔術師が住んでたって話だっ
たから、専門書のいくつかぐらい見
つかるかと思ってたんだけどな‥。
column6: I'd heard a black magician lived here, so I thought I'd be able to find some esoteric books...

column5:
さ、笹木さん！\n
何のんびりしてるの！

S-Sasaki!\n
How can you be so carefree!?

column5: え？あぁ、メイさん。
column6: Huh? Oh, May.

column5:
あぁじゃないよ‥。\n
大変な事になってるんだから。
column6:
Don't `oh~ me.\n
Something terrible's happened.

column5:
‥そりゃ、確かに大変だ！\n
こうしちゃいられないか‥ぼくも探
してみますよ。
column6:
That really is terrible!\n
Guess I can't carry on like this...I'll look too.

column5:
いや、まだかんなさんは見つ
かってませんよ。
column6: No, I haven't found Kanna yet.

column5:
もとこ、げんきがありません
ね‥。
column6: Motoko is unhappy...

column5: ‥気を落とさないでね。
column6: ...Don't feel down, okay?

\s<$28>H\s<$02>a! You're joking.

column5: ‥かわいくない性格だねぇ。
column6: ...You've got the most uncute personality.

column5: ふん、お互い様よ！
column6: Hmph. The feeling is mutual!

column5:
やっぱり、あなたとは気があ
いそうにないわ。
column6: I see we're not going to get along, just like I thought.

column5:
さっさとかんなを探しに行っ
たらどうなの!!
column6: How about you hurry up and go look for Kanna!?

column5:
綾華なら、まだ来てないわ。
心配しなくても、ちゃんと伝えてお
くわよ。\s<$28>[expr]<$01>‥\s<$02>来ればの話だけどね。
column6: If it's Ayaka you want, she's still not here. Don't worry, I'll explain things to her.\s<$28>[expr]<$01> \s<$02>...IF she comes, that is.

column5:
‥ダイニングルームでね、聞
こえたのよ。
column6: So, in the dining room, we heard something.

column5:
何か、そうね‥重い物を引き
ずっているような‥よく分かんない
けど、ズズズって感じなのがね。
column6: It was like...yeah, like a heavy thing being dragged...I don't know, kind of a `skffff~ or something.
column7: NOTE: this is supposed to be the sound of the secret door in the basement sliding open

column5: そ、それから？
column6: A-and then?

column5: それからって、それだけよ。
column6: And THEN, that was all.

column5:
ちょっと恐かったけど、誰か
いるのかと思ってね。\n
地下へ降りてみたわけ。
column6:
We got a little scared and wondered if someone was there, right?\n
So we went down to the basement.

column5:
最初の扉を開けた時、タルが
並んでるのが見えたわ。\n
たぶんワイン庫だと思うんだけど。
column6:
When I opened the first door, I could see barrels lined up.\n
I guess maybe that was the wine cellar.

column5: そのすぐ後に‥‥‥。
column6: Right after that...

column5: うんうん、そのすぐ後に？
column6: Yes, yes, right after that?

column5:
かんだかい‥叫び声の様な音
がして、目の前に緑色のモヤが見え
たのよ。
column6: There was a noise like a high-pitched...screech, and we saw this green mist right in front of us.

column5:
それが人の姿をしてるって気
がついた時には、さすがにびっくり
したわね。
column6: When we realized it was in the shape of a person, we were surprised, obviously.

column5:
かんななんか、その場で気絶
しちゃってさ。
column6: Kanna, she passed out then and there.

column5: え、そ、それでね。
column6: Uh, s-so, then...

column5:
き、気絶したかんなをほっと
くわけにもいかないから、か、かん
なを抱き起こそうとして‥。
column6: Th-there was no way I could leave Kanna alone and fainted, s-so I tried to lift her up...

column5: しゃがんだんだね。
column6: So you squatted down.

column5:
そう!!\n
そしたら幽霊が襲いかかってきて、
私を突き飛ばしてきたのよ。
column6:
RIGHT!\n
Then the ghost rushed at us and sent me flying.

column5:
おかげで、ほら。\n
こんなに汚れてしまったわ。
column6:
And so, look.\n
I got all dirty.

column5:
それからの事は、よく覚えて
ないわ。
column6: I don't really remember what happened after that.

column5:
頭を打ったみたいで‥。\n
気を失っていたのかもしれない。
column6:
It's like I hit my head...\n
I may have lost consciousness.

column5:
気がついたらかんなも幽霊も
姿を消していたわ。
column6: When I came to, Kanna and the ghost had both vanished.

column5:
ほら、あれよ。\n
黒板を引っ掻いたような音。
column6:
Like, you know.\n
A nails-on-a-chalkboard kind of sound.

column5:
‥う〜ん、あれより少し低め
の音だったかしらねぇ。
column6: ...Well, maybe a little lower-pitched than that, I guess.

column5:
ちょっとお願いがあるんだけ
ど‥。
column6: There's something I wanted to ask you...

column5: なに？
column6: What?

column5:
綾華が戻ってきたら、部屋で
待ってるように伝えてくれる？
column6: Could you tell Ayaka to wait in the room if she comes back?

column5:
‥‥あのバカもいなくなった
の？\n
いいわ、伝えてあげるわよ。
column6:
Is that idiot missing too?\n
Fine, I'll tell her.

column5:
それにしても、よく地下へ行
く気になったね。\n
真っ暗だったんじゃない？
column6:
You sure got interested in going to the basement.\n
Wasn't it pitch black?

column5:
明りも持たずに行くわけがな
いでしょ！
column6: As if I'd go in without a light!

column5:
私が懐中電灯を持ってたのよ
白木さんから借りたやつをね。
column6:
I had a flashlight.\n
I'd borrowed it from Shiraki.

column5: もとこ、きたな〜い！
column6: Motoko, you're diiirty!

column5:
突き飛ばされたって言ってる
じゃないっ!!
column6: I TOLD you I got knocked down, didn't I!?

column5:
へぇ〜。\n
最近の幽霊は人を突き飛ばすんだ。

‥うるさいわよ、あなたも。

...You shut up too.\n
What do you expect me to do about getting bowled over!?

突然、目の前に迫ってきて、
押し倒してきたんだから。

column6: ...Came right in front of you...?

column5:
その幽霊。素子の正面から、
こう‥肩を押して、倒してきたの？
column6: So, that ghost. It pushed your shoulders from the front, like this...and knocked you down?

そう、そうよ。\n
すごい勢いで肩を押されてね、倒さ
れたってわけ。
column6:
Right, right.\n
It shoved my shoulders with incredible force, see, and I got knocked down.
column7: NOTE: the voice acting here makes the start sound more like a stutter (since she's nervously lying), but the script writes it out more normally

column5:
その割には、汚れは正面につ
いてるね。
column6: That's strange, considering the dirt's on your front.

column5: へ？
column6: Huh?

column5:

正面から肩を押されたんなら、背中
から倒れるはずじゃない？
column6:
Like I said.\n
If you got pushed from the front, shouldn't you have gotten knocked onto your back?

column5:
それなのに、素子。\n
あなたの服は前の方が汚れてるよ。
column6:
And yet, Motoko...\n
It's the front of your clothes that's dirty.

column5:

倒された時のことなんか、覚えてる
わけないじゃない。
column6:
Th...I-I don't know!\n

どれどれ‥。

らね。懐中電灯がないと、歩くこと

モを張っておくわよ！

Ayaka isn't back.\n

column6: Ayaka never came back.

column5:
あんた達の部屋の扉にメモを
張っておいたから、戻ってくれば分
かるわよ。
column6: I left a note on the door to you two's room, so if she shows up, she'll understand.

column5:
綾華へ\n
　　　戻ってきたら、\n
　　　部屋で待っていること!!
column6:
Ayaka[nbsp]--\n
[sp]<$3D>If she comes back,\n
[sp]<$3D>WAIT IN THE ROOM!!
column7:
CHECK, this is phrased oddly. I *think* Motoko is being passive-aggressive by taking May's request overly literally and writing down her exact words instead of what she clearly intended (remember, she doesn't like may or ayaka!):
綾華が戻ってきたら、部屋で
待ってるように伝えてくれる？
綾華が「戻ってきたら、部屋で
待ってる」ように伝えてくれる？
with no other context, this seems to me like it would convey something more akin to "If [you] come back, [I'm] waiting in the room", though I'll admit I can't be sure of exactly how a native speaker would interpret it.

in any case, it's hard to make this work in a sensible way in english. see 433 for May's message, which this is intended to be a "literalization" of.

column7: NOTE: for whatever reason, may does not figure out that this is motoko's flashlight if she trips over it. if she finds it after coming in from the opposite entrance, or already has a flashlight, she does figure it out. none of this ever ends up mattering, though.

column5:
ナビ\n
ＭＥＣ社から発売される人工知性体\n
この姿はホログラム映像なんだよ。
column6:
Navi\n
An artifical intelligence to be sold by MEC Corporation. This form is a holographic image.

column5:
立花　綾華（たちばな　あやか）\n
ボクと同じ事務所の女優。１４歳。\n
子供な所が、また可愛いんだよねぇ
column6:
Ayaka Tachibana\n
An actress with the same company as me. 14 years old. She's a bit childish, but cute too, huh?

column5:
三原　かんな（みはら　かんな）\n
１５歳。女優としては大人しすぎる\n
感じがするね。色気はあるけど。
column6:
Kanna Mihara\n
15 years old. Doesn't she seem too meek to be an actress? She's alluring, though.

column5:
柳　素子（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
１６歳の女優。すっごくキツイ性格\n
してる。ボクは好きじゃないなぁ。
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
A 16-year-old actress. She's got a REALLY uptight personality. I don't like her.

column5:
幻条　優子（げんじょう　ゆうこ）
２７歳の霊能タレント。霊能力の話
はともかく、きれいな人だよねぇ。
column6:
Yuuko Genjou\n
A 27-year-old celebrity psychic. Psychic power stuff aside, she sure is pretty.

column5:
沢田　重樹（さわだ　しげき）\n
カメラさん。これでも２７歳。\n
仕事にはキビしい人みたい。
column6:
Shigeki Sawada\n
A cameraman. Despite his looks, he's 27. Seems like a stickler when it comes to his job.

column5:
笹木　忠雄（ささき　ただお）\n
雑務担当の２２歳。一流大学の黒ミ\n
サ同好会出身だってウワサ。
column6:
Tadao Sasaki\n
A 22-year-old handling routine duties. Rumors say he was in a group at an elite university that held a Black Mass.

column5:
白木　厚志（しらき　あつし）\n
２４歳のアシスタントディレクター\n
なんか、頼りない人だよねぇ。
column6:
Atsushi Shiraki\n
A 24-year-old assistant director. Doesn't seem like the world's most reliable guy.

column5:
篠田　正次（しのだ　しょうじ）\n
照明担当の２５歳。無口で、愛想の\n
悪い人だよねぇ…。
column6:
Shouji Shinoda\n
A 25-year-old in charge of lighting. Kind of a quiet and distant guy...

column7:
NOTE: text doesn't have the full conversation, but the audio is clear enough:

おれが大切なのは、お前
だけだって。
The only one that's precious to me is you.

信じられる[と?]でも思ってるの?!\n
かんなの次は私。私の次は綾華？\n
それとも、メイしらね?!
Do you think I can believe that!?\n
After Kanna, it's me. After me is Ayaka?\n
Or will it be May!?

also, because it's a little hard to follow this if you missed some of the hints earlier in the game: shinoda had, from before the start of the game, been carrying on some sort of "romantic" relationship with Kanna, but abruptly broke it off in an earlier scene. he's now turned around and started hitting on motoko, while she's in the shower. motoko's understandably pissed at him at this point. (also note that he's 25 and these actresses are all around 15)

It bothers me that Ayaka hasn't come back yet.

拠が何もない。
column6: But, well, even if somebody _is_ suspicious, there's no evidence to prove their crime.

とりあえず、この事はおれ達

の捜索を続けるしかないだろうな。
column6: For now, looks like all we can do is keep this to ourselves and go on with the search for Kanna.

column5:
結局、かんなに関係しそうな

column5:

だ。

A...Aya...ka...
column7: HACK: due to some sort of wackiness with the scripting here, this line is insta-printed and needs to remain so in the translation (otherwise the fade-in is delayed and the text color is messed up as the line prints). this would result in the line being printed with a vertical offset (as this mode is normally used for true three-line messages, which need to be properly centered in the box). as a last-minute fix, i've added logic so that a sequence of three [br3] commands will be treated as a toggle for the vertical offset behavior. these are encoded as raw <$13> commands so the text wrapper won't try to treat them as actual linebreaks.

て話でしたし、あの落ちてたのが、
素子のものかもしれませんよ？

に落ちてなかったのかしらね。

綾華さんは、玄関ホール二階

胸にダーツの一撃を受けた形
跡があります。

沢田さんと笹木さんと話して
るときだったよね。
column6: It was when I was talking with Sawada and Shiraki.

column5:
はい。\n
電灯が消えかかって‥。
column6:
Right.\n
The power went out, and...

column5:
綾華の叫び声が聞こえた‥。
綾華が、二階の廊下を走ってきて、
テラスの欄干にもたれる‥。
column6:
I heard Ayaka cry out...\n
She ran down the second-floor passage, and leaned on the terrace's handrail...

column5:
おびえてた綾華の表情‥忘れ
る事なんてできないよ‥‥。
column6: I can't forget it...Ayaka's expression of terror...

column5:
綾華が、泣きながら助けを呼
んで‥。
column6: Ayaka called for help, tears in her eyes...

column5:
振り向いた綾華さんが、小さ
く叫んでのけぞりました。
column6: After turning around, she gave a small cry and leaned backwards.

column5:
おそらく、この時にダーツを
胸に受けたんだと思います。
column6: I think this was probably when the dart hit her in the chest.

column5:
そして‥欄干がくずれて‥。
あ‥綾華は‥‥落ちた‥。
column6:
Then...the guardrail crumbled...\n
A...Ayaka...fell...

column5:
綾華さんが落ちる瞬間に、館
の電灯が消えました。
column6: At the instant Ayaka fell, the mansion's lights went out.

column5:
そうだったね。\n
[expr]<$01>‥あれ、でも今はついてるなぁ。
column6:
That's right.\n
[expr]<$01>Huh? But they're back on now...

column5:
なんか、幽霊のしわざにも思
えてきますねぇ。\n
あ！ごめんなさい、今のは冗談です
column6:
You'd almost think it was the work of a ghost.\n
Ah! I'm sorry, that was a joke just now.
column7: NOTE: wow, navi, not the time

column5: ‥‥分かればよろしい。
column6: ...Just don't do it again.
column7: CHECK, it's more literally "as long as [you] understand, it's fine", which i think is getting at the idea i've stated more explicitly here.

column5:
暗くなって、ふと上を見上げ
たら淡い緑色の‥人の姿をしたモノ
を見た‥‥。
column6: It went dark, and when I reflexively glanced up, I saw a pale green figure shaped like a person...

column5:
幽霊でしょうか？\n
素子達が見たのも緑色だったって話
ですけど‥。
column6:
Was it a ghost?\n
Motoko said the one they saw was green too, but...

column5:
共通点があるわけだ。\n
もしかしたら‥同じ人物のしわざか
も‥‥‥。
column6:
Then there's a common point.\n
Perhaps...it could have been the same person...

column5:
犯人なんて、まだ分からない
よ‥。綾華と仲が悪かったのは、素
子だけど‥。
column6:
We don't know the culprit yet...\n
The one with a bad relationship with Ayaka was Motoko, but...

column5:
決定できる証拠はありません
よ。でも、絶対に犯人じゃない人が
二人いますよね。
column6: We don't have decisive proof. But there are two people who absolutely can't be the culprit.

て、犯人じゃないと判断できると思

と一緒にいたんですから、犯人じゃ

でも、それなら沢田さんだっ
て、犯人じゃないと判断できると思
いますが。
column6: But in that case, I think we can declare that Sawada isn't the culprit either.

column5:
綾華を間接的に殺害した凶器
として、ダーツが見つかりましたね
column6: We discovered a dart to be the weapon that indirectly took Ayaka's life.

column5:
よ〜し！\n
考えるのはここまでにして、捜査を
開始するよ。ナビ！
column6:
All right!\n
Let's quit mulling things over and start investigating. Navi!

column5: は、はい！‥あの‥‥。
column6: Y-yes! Um...

column5: ？なに？
column6: ? What?

column5: 先程は、すみませんでした‥
column6: I'm sorry about earlier...

column5:
あの、メイの気持ちも考えず
に‥そのぉ‥無神経な事を言ってし
まって‥。
column6: Um, I said something insensitive without...umm...thinking about your feelings, May...

column5:
ナ、ナビは機械だから‥だか
ら、その‥悲しいとか、そういうの
が‥わかんなくて‥‥。
column6: N-Navi is a machine, so...so, well...she doesn't understand things like being sad...

column5:
ううん‥ボクも言いすぎたよ
どなったりしてゴメン。\n
‥ところでさ、ナビ。
column6:
No...I said too much too.\n
Sorry for yelling at you.\n
...By the way, Navi.

column5:
あなた‥いつの間にか、ずい
ぶん上手に話せるようになったね。
column6: You've gotten really good at talking all of a sudden, you know?

column5:
え？えへへ‥メイとケンカし
て‥でも嫌われたくない、どうしよ
うって、ずっと考えて‥。
column6: Huh? Eh-heh-heh...I had a fight with you, May, but...I spent a long time thinking about what I should do so you wouldn't hate me...

column5:
こんなに一生懸命に考えたの
は、ナビが造られてから初めてだっ
たんです。
column6: It's the first time since Navi was created that she thought as hard as she could like that.

column5: ナビ‥。
column6: Navi...

column5:
ずっと考えてたから‥だから
言葉も上達したんですよ、きっと。
column6: Because I thought about it so much...That's why my language improved, I'm sure of it.

column5:
ありがとう、ナビ。\n
なんだか、とってもうれしいよ。\n
column6:
Thank you, Navi.\n
For some reason, I'm really happy.

column5:
さて、と！\n
元気を出して、調査を始めようか！
column6:
All right then!\n
How about we cheer up and get investigating!

column5:
あのぉ‥ちゃんと真面目に考
えて下さいよぉ。
column6: Umm...please think about this seriously.

column5:
あのぉ‥。\n
優子さんは館の外にいたんですよ。
column6:
Umm...\n
Miss Yuuko was outside the mansion.

column5:
忘れちゃったんですか？\n
沢田さんは、メイと一緒にいたんで
すよ。
column6:
Did you forget?\n
Sawada was with you, May.

column5:
じゃぁね、綾華。\n
少しの間、一人にしちゃうけど‥‥
許してね。
column6:
Bye-bye, Ayaka.\n
I'm going to leave you on your own for a little while, so...forgive me.

column5:
必ず‥‥必ずあなたを殺した
奴を捕まえるから!!
column6: I'll definitely...I'll definitely catch the bastard that killed you!

column7:
NOTE: no need to put this on a separate line in the translation.
also, text speed gets reset to 2 here instead of the normal value of 3. whatever. the game isn't consistent with it (it's pretty apparently they changed the default speed in the middle of development and didn't fix up everything else to match) and i'm not inclined to try to fix it.

column5: ‥あ、ゴメ〜ン。
column6: ...Oh, sorry.

column5:
ご、ご、ご、ご、ご、ごめん
じゃないわよぉっ!!!!
column6: D-d-d-d-d-don't give me `sorry~!

G-get...get[br3]
\s<$01>[2x]OUT OF HERE![1x]\s<$01>

column5:
‥すまん。\n
助けられなかった‥‥‥。
column6:
...Sorry.\n
We couldn't save her...

column5: そんな‥ウソ‥‥‥‥。
column6: This can't...no...

column5:
動機も、証拠もないと思うん
ですけど‥。
column6: I don't think there's a motive, or evidence...

column5:
綾華、待っててね‥。\n
犯人を見つけ出したら、真っ先に綾
華に知らせに来るから‥。
column6:
Ayaka, wait for me...\n
Once I find the culprit, I'll let you know straight away...

column6: Huh?

たい。

[expr]<$01>どうだ？メイも飲むか？
column6:
Heh-heh, even I can't help myself, y'know?\n
[expr]<$01>Well? Wanna drink, May?

column5:
沢田さん!!\n
メイはまだ未成年です！
column6:
Sawada!\n
May's still a minor!

column5: おお〜、こわ。
column6: Ooh, scary.

column5:
明りが消えた理由が分かりま
したよ。
column6: I figured out why the lights went out.

column5:
さっき見てきたんですけど、
発電機が止まってたんです。燃料が
なくなって‥。
column6: I went to check out the generator a little while ago, and it had stopped. It was out of fuel...

column5:
ははぁ‥。\n
まあ、確かに軽油の缶は、予備用の
小さなものでしたからね。
column6:
Ha-ha...\n
Well, it definitely was a small diesel can meant as a spare, wasn't it?

column5:
あの時の幽霊の仕業かと思っ
たんですけど、どうも偶然だったみ
たいですね。
column6: I thought it was the work of that ghost from before, but apparently it was just a coincidence.

column5:
‥‥‥‥‥‥‥‥‥‥はぁ。
なんで、こんなことに‥‥‥。
column6:
...(sigh).\n
How has it come to this...?

column5:
ごめんなさい！\n
ごめんなさい!!
column6:
I'm sorry!\n
I'M SORRY!

column5: も、素子？
column6: M-Motoko?

column5:
わ‥私、ウソをついてたの！
それが、それがこんな事になっちゃ
うなんて‥‥。
column6:
I...I lied!\n
That's, that's why this happened...!

column5:
私、私恐くて！\n
もう、もうダメよっ!!
column6:
I...I'm scared!\n
No...NO MORE!

Motoko.[br3]
\s<$01>[2x]Calm down![1x]\s<$02>

column5:
ご、ごめんね。\n
取り乱しちゃって‥‥。
column6: S-sorry...for freaking out.

column5:
素子を見る\n
ウソについて聞く
column6:
Look at Motoko\n
Ask about the lie

column5:
素子の、こんな姿を見るなん
て‥‥‥意外だったなぁ。
column6: Seeing Motoko look like this...That's a surprise.

column5:

どういうこと？
column6: You said something about lying, right? What do you mean?

column5:
ふぅ‥。\n
わ、私とかんなが‥幽霊に襲われた
時ね‥。
column6:
(sigh)...\n
Wh-when me and Kanna were...attacked by the ghost...

私、かんなを助けようなんて
‥しなかったの‥‥。

column5:
ちょ、ちょっと待って！\n
それ、かんなが行方不明になった時
の事でしょ。
column6:
H-hang on!\n
You're talking about when Kanna went missing?

混乱しちゃうから、順番に教

column5:
ダイニングルームで‥かんな
が落ち着くまで、ずっといたんだけ
ど、かすかに音が聞こえたのよ。
column6: In the dining room...I'd been there the whole time until Kanna calmed down, and we heard a faint sound.

column5:
それは地下から聞こえてくる
みたいで‥重い物を引きずる様な、
そんな感じの音だったわ。
column6: It seemed like it was coming from the basement...It was a sound that kind of gave the impression of dragging a heavy object.

column5:
音に興味を覚えて‥[expr]<$01>これは本
当。かんなを元気づけようと思って
探険気分で降りたのよ。
column6:
Being interested in the sound...\n
[expr]<$01>That was true. Thinking it would cheer Kanna up, I went down there like we were going exploring.

column5: 階段を降りて、扉を開けた‥
column6: We went down the stairs and opened the door...

column5: ワイン庫に入ったんだよね？
column6: And entered the wine cellar?

column5:
そう。\n
タルがたくさん並んでたから、間違
いないわ。
column6:
Right.\n
There were a bunch of barrels lined up, so there was no mistaking it.

column5:
それで、部屋に入った直後に
かんだかい叫び声が聞こえて‥。
column6: Then, right after we went in the room, we heard a high-pitched screech...

column5:
目の前‥ううん、距離は離れ
ていたけど、正面に緑色の幽霊が見
えたのよ。
column6: Right in front of...no, it was a little ways off, but we could see a green ghost in front of us.

column5:
で、幽霊に襲われた時の事な
んだけど‥。
column6: So, about when you were attacked by the ghost...

column5: 襲われてないの。
column6: We weren't attacked.

column5:
襲われてなんかないのよ！\n
幽霊を見た時に、かんなが気絶して
‥私は‥‥‥逃げたの。
column6: We didn't get attacked or anything, okay!? When she saw the ghost, Kanna passed out, and...I...I ran away.

column5:
‥‥‥‥‥恐くて‥‥とって
も恐かったから‥。
column6: I was scared...so scared...

column5: ‥そ、それで？
column6: ...A-and then?

column5:
階段に向かって走って‥‥、
その手前で転んで、もう何がなんだ
か‥よく覚えてないわ。
column6: I turned towards the stairs and ran...Just in front of them, I fell down, and...I don't really have any memory of what happened.

column5:
服が汚れていたのは転んだ時
に汚れたから‥。
column6: My clothes were dirty because they got dirty when I fell...

column5:
‥逃げたから、よく分からな
いわ。
column6: ...I ran away, so I don't really know about it.

column5:
でも、そうね‥落ち着いて思
い出してみると、幽霊がかんなを抱
き上げてた様な気がするわ。
column6: But, that's right...Thinking about it calmly, I feel like I saw the ghost holding Kanna up.

column5: それから‥。
column6: And then...

column5: そ、それから？
column6: A-and then?

column5:
‥‥‥そう！また叫び声がし
て‥それからすぐ後に、扉が閉まる
音がしたんだわ。
column6: ...That's right! There was another screech...and then right afterwards, the sound of a door closing.

column5:
この缶に見覚えはない？\n
素子達が幽霊に会った場所に落ちて
たんだけど。
column6:
Do you remember this can?\n
It was on the ground at the place where you two ran into the ghost.

column5:
私が笹木さんにもらって‥か
んなにあげたんだけど‥。あの子、
ずぅっと持ってたのかしら？
column6: I got it from Sasaki...and gave it to Kanna...Was she holding it the whole time, I wonder?

column5:
たぶん、彼女が気絶したとき
に落ちたんじゃない？
column6: Maybe she could've dropped it when she passed out?

column5: かんだかい叫び声ってのは？
column6: What was the high-pitched screech?

column5:
う、う〜ん‥‥なんて、表現
すればいいのか‥‥。
column6: Uh, hmm...Kind of like, how do I put it...
\s<$01>[3x]Keeeeeeee![1x]\s<$02>

column5:
って感じで、ひどくゆっくり
聞こえたわ。
column6: ...It felt like that, and it sounded horribly slow.

column5:
逃げたのは、分かったけど。
どうして隠してたのよ？
column6: I get that you ran away...but why were you hiding it?

column5: ‥‥‥‥プライドの問題よ。
column6: ...It was a matter of pride.

column5:
メイには分からないのよっ!!
私だって恐いのに！\n
でもガマンして撮影に来たのに！
column6:
You wouldn't get it, May!\n
_I_ was scared, but! I grit my teeth and came on this shoot[nbsp]-- _but_!

column5:
あんな事になって‥‥言えな
いわよ!!\n
みっともないじゃない！
column6:
I can't...can't say that something like that happened!\n
It's a _disgrace_!

column5:
わぁ！ゴメン。今のはボクが
悪かった！\n
だ、だから落ち着いてぇ！
column6:
Wah! Sorry. That was my bad!\n
So please, calm down!

column5:
ところでさ。\n
階段を降りたところに、懐中電灯が
転がってたんだけど‥。
column6:
Hey, by the way.\n
There was a flashlight on the ground at the foot of the stairs...

column5:
？そういえば‥私の懐中電灯
がないけど‥。
column6: ? Now that you mention it, I don't have my flashlight...

column5:
転んだときに落としたのかも
‥その辺はよく覚えてないの。
column6: I may have dropped it when I fell...I don't really remember that part.

column5: メイ‥。
column6: May...

column5:
ありがとう‥。\n
私も、出来るだけ協力させてもらう
わ。
column6:
Thank you...\n
Let me help you out as much as I can.

column5: あのぉ‥沢田さん？
column6: Umm...Sawada?

column5:
カメラをまわしてるときは、
話しかけるんじゃねぇ！
column6: Don't talk to me when I'm behind the damn camera!

column5:
かんなさんのいる場所が、分
かったそうです！\n
彼女、生きてるそうですよ！
column6: She says she's figured out where Kanna is! She says she's alive!

column5:
いやぁ、それにしても優子さ
んってすごいなぁ。\n
どんな魔術をつかったんだろ？
column6: Man, Miss Yuuko's sure incredible. I wonder what kind of magic she used?

column5:
う〜ん、かんなさんの居場所
が分かったらしいんですけど‥‥、
ほんとかなぁ。
column6:
Hmm...Supposedly, she's found out where Kanna is, but...\n
Is it true?

column5: 本当ならいいんですが‥。
column6: It'd be good if it is, but...

column5:
カメラをまわしてる時の沢田
さんは、\s<$01>[2x]鬼[1x]\s<$02>なんです。
column6:
When he's behind the camera,[br3]
Sawada's a \s<$01>[2x]demon.[1x]\s<$02>

column5:
だから、近寄らない方がいい
ですよ。
column6: So, you'd better not get near him.

column5:
これで、おしまいか？\n
少しばかり驚かせてもらったが‥、
まぁ、こんなもんかな。
column6:
Is that all?\n
She surprised me a little, but...well, I guess this is it.

column5:
‥優子さん、がんばってくだ
さい！
column6: Miss Yuuko, please do your best!

column5:
あなたの双肩に‥魔術の存在
がかかってるんです！
column6: The existence of magic rests on your shoulders!

column5: ‥はぁ。
column6: ...(sigh).

column5: やっぱりダメですか‥‥。
column6: I guess it's no use after all...

column5:
霊の力で、かんなさんの居場
所をつきとめるなんて、出来っこな
いんでしょうかねぇ。
column6: There's no way we can find out where Kanna is with spiritual power, is there?

column5:
かんなが‥まだ目を覚まさな
いの。\n
心配だわ‥‥‥。
column6:
Kanna still isn't waking up.\n
I'm worried...

column5:
ふん‥‥何か気にかかるが、[expr]<$01>
まぁ、かんなが見つかってよかった
よ。
column6: Hmm...Something about it's bothering me, but...[expr]<$01>Eh, it's good we found Kanna.

column5:
いやぁ‥優子さん、すごかっ
たですねぇ！
column6: Man...Miss Yuuko was awesome!

column5:
とりあえず、一安心ってとこ
ですか。
column6: So we can have some peace of mind for now?

column5:
後は道が通れるようになれば
メインスタッフや警察が来ますよ。
column6: Now, if the road just becomes passable, the main staff and police will come.

column5:
あぁ、それにしても、優子さ
んってすごい人だったんですねぇ。
column6: Aah, but I have to say[nbsp]-- Miss Yuuko sure is amazing, isn't she?

column5:
ともかく、幽霊に扮するため
に使った服が見つかってません。\n
この部屋にあれば‥。
column6: All else aside, we haven't found the costume she used to dress up as a ghost. If it's in this room...

column5: ずいぶん古い写真ですねぇ。
column6: It's a very old photo.
column7: NOTE: dupe of 462 except written properly in kanji instead of hiragana to match with Navi's improved speech in the later part of the case

column5:
明りが消えた理由が分かりま
したよ。
column6: I figured out why the lights went out.

column5:
さっき見てきたんですけど、
発電機が止まってたんです。燃料が
なくなって‥。
column6: I went to check out the generator a little while ago, and it had stopped. It was out of fuel...

column5:
私が笹木さんにもらって‥か
んなにあげたんだけど‥。あの子、
ずぅっと持ってたのかしら？
column6: I got it from Sasaki...and gave it to Kanna...Was she holding it the whole time, I wonder?

column5:
たぶん、彼女が気絶したとき
に落ちたんじゃない？
column6: Maybe she could've dropped it when she passed out?

column5:
襲われてなんかないのよ！\n
幽霊を見た時に、かんなが気絶して
‥私は‥‥‥逃げたの。
column6: We didn't get attacked or anything, okay!? When she saw the ghost, Kanna passed out, and...I...I ran away.

column5:
階段に向かって走って‥‥、
その手前で転んで、もう何がなんだ
か‥よく覚えてないわ。
column6: I turned towards the stairs and ran...Just in front of them, I fell down, and...I don't really have any memory of what happened.

column5:
服が汚れていたのは転んだ時
に汚れたから‥。
column6: My clothes were dirty because they got dirty when I fell...

column5: 階段を降りて、扉を開けた‥
column6: We went down the stairs and opened the door...

column5:
それで、部屋に入った直後に
かんだかい叫び声が聞こえて‥。
column6: Then, right after we went in the room, we heard a high-pitched screech...

column5:
目の前‥ううん、距離は離れ
ていたけど、正面に緑色の幽霊が見
えたのよ。
column6: Right in front of...no, it was a little ways off, but we could see a green ghost in front of us.

column5: どうしました？
column6: What's wrong?

column5:
な〜んか、イヤな感じがする
よねぇ‥‥。
column6: Somehow, I've got a bad feeling about this...

column5:
ナビ\n
ＭＥＣ社から発売される人工知性体\n
この姿はホログラム映像なんだよ。
column6:
Navi\n
An artifical intelligence to be sold by MEC Corporation. This form is a holographic image.

column5:
立花　綾華（たちばな　あやか）\n
ボクと同じ事務所の女優。１４歳。\n
子供な所が、また可愛いんだよねぇ
column6:
Ayaka Tachibana\n
An actress with the same company as me. 14 years old. She's a bit childish, but cute too, huh?

column5:
三原　かんな（みはら　かんな）\n
１５歳。女優としては大人しすぎる\n
感じがするね。色気はあるけど。
column6:
Kanna Mihara\n
15 years old. Doesn't she seem too meek to be an actress? She's alluring, though.

column5:
柳　素子（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
１６歳の女優。すっごくキツイ性格\n
してる。ボクは好きじゃないなぁ。
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
A 16-year-old actress. She's got a REALLY uptight personality. I don't like her.

column5:
幻条　優子（げんじょう　ゆうこ）
２７歳の霊能タレント。霊能力の話
はともかく、きれいな人だよねぇ。
column6:
Yuuko Genjou\n
A 27-year-old celebrity psychic. Psychic power stuff aside, she sure is pretty.

column5:
沢田　重樹（さわだ　しげき）\n
カメラさん。これでも２７歳。\n
仕事にはキビしい人みたい。
column6:
Shigeki Sawada\n
A cameraman. Despite his looks, he's 27. Seems like a stickler when it comes to his job.

column5:
笹木　忠雄（ささき　ただお）\n
雑務担当の２２歳。一流大学の黒ミ\n
サ同好会出身だってウワサ。
column6:
Tadao Sasaki\n
A 22-year-old handling routine duties. Rumors say he was in a group at an elite university that held a Black Mass.

column5:
白木　厚志（しらき　あつし）\n
２４歳のアシスタントディレクター\n
なんか、頼りない人だよねぇ。
column6:
Atsushi Shiraki\n
A 24-year-old assistant director. Doesn't seem like the world's most reliable guy.

column5:
篠田　正次（しのだ　しょうじ）\n
照明担当の２５歳。無口で、愛想の\n
悪い人だよねぇ…。
column6:
Shouji Shinoda\n
A 25-year-old in charge of lighting. Kind of a quiet and distant guy...

column5:
‥‥‥‥そう。\n
かんなはこっちにいるのね‥‥‥。
column6:
...I see.\n
So Kanna is this way...

column5:
‥ゆ、優子さんがイッちゃっ
てるよぉ‥‥‥。
column6: M-Miss Yuuko's out of it...
column7: NOTE: line for talking to Yuuko as she's walking from the first ceremony site to the second

column5:
メイ！\n
お前が映ってどぉすんだ。優子から
離れろ！
column6:
May!\n
This ain't your shot. Get away from Yuuko!

column5: ‥なに、してるんですか？
column6: ...What're you doing?

column5: しっ！静かに‥。
column6: Shh! Quiet...

column5:
‥困ったわ‥‥‥何も感じな
くなってしまった‥。
column6: ...Troublesome...I can no longer sense anything...

column5: も、素子っ?!
column6: M-Motoko!?

column5: こいつが、おれを疑うからさ
column6: That's for suspecting me.

column5:
‥な、なんてことを。\n
篠田さん!!
column6:
Wh-what the--!?\n
Shinoda!

column5:
素子から聞いたぜ。\n
おれがかんなをさらったんだろうっ
てな。
column6:
I heard it from Motoko.\n
She's saying I kidnapped Kanna.

column5:
ふん。おまえも、そう思って
んだろ？\n
なら、証拠を出してみろよ。
column6: Hmph. You think so too, don't you? Then show me the proof.

column7: NOTE: fits on one line in translation, so no need for the linebreak

column5:
ふん、ガキのくせにおちょく
りやがって‥。\n
ええ、少しは反省したか?!
column6:
Hmph. The nerve of you goddamn brats, mocking me...\n
Well, feeling sorry now!?

column5: ‥見損なったわ、篠田さん。
column6: I'm disappointed in you, Shinoda.

column5:
な、何を!!\n
このガキどもが悪ぃんじゃねぇか！
column6:
Wh-what!?\n
It's all these stupid kids' fault!

column5:
篠田さん。\n
‥あなたが、かんなさんをさらった
犯人じゃないんですか？
column6:
Shinoda.\n
You're the culprit behind Kanna's kidnapping, aren't you?

column5:
お、おい！ま、まさか、みん
なしておれを疑ってるのか?!\n
ちょ、ちょっと待ってくれよ。
column6: H-hey! You all seriously think _I_ did this!? H-hold on a second!

column5:
さ、沢田さん。\n
沢田さんなら、おれを信じてくれる
だろ？
column6:
S-Sawada.\n
Sawada, don't _you_ believe me?

column5: く‥ちくしょう！
column6: Kh...Damn it!

column5:
‥‥大丈夫だ。\n
二人とも気絶してるだけだ。
column6:
...It's fine.\n
They're both just passed out.

column5:
とりあえず、二人を部屋に運
びましょう。
column6: Let's carry them to the rooms for now.

column5: あら、気がついたみたいね。
column6: Oh, looks like you're up.

column5: ここは‥？
column6: Where am I...?

column5:
私とかんなの部屋。\n
篠田に襲われて気絶した私達を、沢
田さん達が運んでくれたのよ。
column6:
Me and Kanna's room.\n
Sawada and the others brought us here after Shinoda attacked.

column5: そう‥。
column6: Oh...

column5:
篠田の事を聞く\n
優子達の事を聞く\n
捜査再開
column6:
Ask about Shinoda\n
Ask about Yuuko and the others\n
Resume investigating

column5:
篠田の事を聞く\n
優子達の事を聞く
column6:
Ask about Shinoda\n
Ask about Yuuko and the others

column5:
‥‥‥お互い、酷い目にあっ
たわね。
column6: ...We both ran into trouble, huh?

column5:
笹木さんから聞いたんだけど
篠田はあの後、ロケバスに乗って逃
げてしまったって。
column6: I heard from Sasaki that after that, Shinoda ran away in the studio bus.

column5: 逃げた？
column6: Ran away?

column5:
そう。\n
おかげで私達は正真正銘、館の虜っ
てわけ。
column6:
Right.\n
So now we really are prisoners in the mansion.

column5:
もっともバスがあったところ
で、道路が通れないんだから、どこ
にも行けないんだけどね。
column6: On the other hand, the road the bus was on is blocked, so he's not going anywhere either.

column5:
ところでさ、何であんな事に
なったの？
column6: By the way, how'd that end up happening?

column5:
この部屋の窓からね、ロケバ
スから降りてくる篠田が見えたのよ
column6: I saw Shinoda getting out of the bus from this room's window.

column5:
かんなが‥その、篠田とつき
あってたのは、分かってるわよね。
column6: You know Kanna had...well, a relationship with Shinoda, right?

column5:
もっとも、篠田の奴。最近は
かんなを邪魔者扱いして、私につき
まとってたんだけど‥。
column6: But that jerk Shinoda. Lately he'd started treating her like dirt, and following me around...

column5:
そんな事があったから‥、篠
田がかんなをさらったんだと思って
‥問い詰めたんだけど‥‥。
column6: Because that had happened...I thought Shinoda had kidnapped Kanna, and...questioned him...

column5: 返り討ちにあった。
column6: And he easily turned the tables.

column5:
ちょっと！\n
いくらなんでもヒドイ言いぐさじゃ
ない?![expr]<$02>‥‥事実だけどさ。
column6:
Hey!\n
That's a really awful way of putting it, you know![expr]<$02> ...But it's true.

column5:
かんなのいる場所を突き止め
るって、怪しい儀式をやってるわ。\s<$28>
っ\s<$02>たく、あのエセ霊能力者は‥。
column6: She's doing some fishy ritual she says is to figure out where Kanna is. \s<$28>G\s<$02>eez, that phony psychic...

column5: やけに、つっかかるねぇ。
column6: You're sure in a huff over her.

column5:
だって！\n
霊だの何だのって‥ウソに決まって
るじゃない。
column6:
C'mon!\n
All this `spirit~ stuff...She's obviously faking it.

column5:
だいたい、人気が落ちた理由
だって‥あのわざとらしい仕草のせ
いじゃない！
column6: I bet the reason her popularity's dropped is that whole pretentious act!

column5:
ちょ、ちょっとメイ！\n
一体どこ行くのよ。
column6:
H-hey, May!\n
Where do you think you're going?

column5:
どこって‥綾華を殺した奴を
見つけるのよ。
column6: Where?...To find the bastard that killed Ayaka.

column5: だって、篠田は‥。
column6: But Shinoda's...

column5:
綾華さんの事件については、
まだ何も分かってないに等しいんで
す。
column6: We still know practically nothing about the incident with Ayaka.

column5:
かんなさんの事件についても
本当に篠田さんが犯人かどうかは、
証拠がないんですから。
column6: Even regarding the incident with Kanna, there's no proof whether the culprit really was Shinoda.

column5:
確かにそうだけど‥。\n
\s<$28>そ\s<$02>れじゃ、私も一緒に行くわ！\n
協力してあげるから感謝しなさいよ
column6:
That IS true, but...\n
\s<$28>O\s<$02>kay then, I'll go with you! I'm going to be supporting you, so do be grateful.

column5: 綾華‥‥。
column6: Ayaka...

column5:
メイ‥お気持は分かりますが
感傷にひたるのは後にしましょう。
column6: May...I understand your feelings, but you can get sentimental later.

column5: どうしました？
column6: What's wrong?

column5: ソファの下に何かある‥。
column6: There's something under the sofa...

column5:
ソファの下に手を入れて取る\n
ソファを動かして取る\n
取らない
column6:
Reach under the sofa with your hand\n
Move the sofa and take it\n
Don't take it

column5:
うぅ‥‥ダメみたい。\n
隙間が小さくて、手が届かないよ。
column6:
Oof...Guess that won't work.\n
The gap is too small and my hand won't reach.

column5: ムリそうですねぇ。
column6: Looks like that won't be possible.

column5:
そりゃ、この大きさだもの。
もう１人いれば、何とか動かせそう
なんだけどなぁ。
column6:
It's because it's so big.\n
I think I'd be able to manage moving it if we had another person, though.

column5:
ねぇ、素子。\n
このソファを動かすのを手伝ってく
れる？
column6:
Hey, Motoko.\n
Will you help me move this sofa?

column5: ちょ、ちょっと、本気ぃ?!
column6: W-wait, seriously!?

column5:
いいから、いいから。\n
はい、そっち持って！
column6:
It's fine, it's fine.\n
Okay, grab it there!

column5:
ほら、なんとかなるもんじゃ
ない？
column6: See, we managed it, didn't we?

column5: ‥‥‥‥う、腕が痛いわ‥。
column6: ...M-my arms hurt...

column5: あっ！素子、足元！
column6: Ah! Motoko, by your foot!

column5:
鍵だわ‥。\n
でも‥‥なんだって、こんな所に落
ちてるのよ？
column6:
It's a key...\n
But...what's it doing lying around somewhere like this?

column5:
さぁね‥。\n
取りあえずボクが持ってくよ。
column6:
Well, who knows...\n
I'll hold on to it for now.

column5:
ここで、幽霊を見たのよ。\n
この扉を開けて‥‥。
column6:
This is where we saw the ghost.\n
I opened this door...

column5:

犯人は、綾華を追う際に部屋
にある手ごろな武器‥ダーツを用い
たのでしょう。
column6: The criminal made use of a handy weapon that was in the room as they chased Ayaka...the darts.

column5:
あれ？そんなモノを武器にし
てましたっけ？
column6: Huh? Did they use something like _that_ as a weapon?

column5:
さて、問題は犯人が誰か、と
いう事なんですが‥。
column6: So, the question now is who the culprit is...

column5:
応接室の壁、地下室の壁、そ
して拷問部屋の鉄の台に、赤い血文
字が浮かび上がりましたよね。
column6: Red blood writing appeared on the parlor wall, the basement wall, and the iron pedestal in the torture chamber.

column5:
幽霊の犯行だと思わせる為の
トリックだったんでしょうが、実際
その正体は‥‥？
column6: It was a trick to make us think it was a ghost's crime, but in reality, it was...?

column5: そうです。
column6: That's right.

column5:
犯人は、光に反応して赤く変
色するあの液体で、あらかじめ文字
を書いておいたんです。
column6: The culprit wrote the messages beforehand, in a liquid that turns red in response to light.

column5:
で、その後でライトをあてて
血文字が浮かび上がったかの様に、
見せかけたわけだ。
column6: So, when they shone light on them afterward, they pretended bloody letters had appeared.

column5:
そして、この事を知っていた
のは犯人だけ‥。
column6: And the only one that knew about it was the culprit...

column5:
う〜ん、血文字とは関係なさ
そうですよ。
column6: No, that doesn't seem related to the blood writing.

column5:
かんなさんの事、そして血文
字の事‥。
column6: Kanna, and the blood writing...

column5:
考えてみると怪しい人がいま
すよね。\n
さぁ、犯人の部屋に急ぎましょう!!
column6: Considering those, there's someone who's suspicious, isn't there? Now then, let's hurry to the culprit's room!

column5:
\n

column5: ふふふふふ‥‥‥お父さん。

column5:
あなたが‥自分の罪を知られ
て、お母さんを殺した様に‥‥、私
も一人殺したわ‥‥。
column6: As you slew Mother, who learned of your sins...I, too, have murdered...

column5:
ふふふ‥仕方なかったのよ。
あの子が‥見てはいけないものを見
てしまったんだもの。
column6:
Heh-heh-heh...I had no choice.\n
That girl...What she saw, I could not let her see.

column5: だから‥‥。
column6: So...

column5: だから、綾華を殺したんだね。
column6: So, you killed Ayaka.

column5:
優子さん‥あなたの罪は、全
て露見したよ。
column6: Miss Yuuko...I've uncovered all your crimes.

column5:
かんなを誘拐し、睡眠薬で眠
らせたうえで、誰も知らない拷問部
屋に監禁した。
column6: On top of kidnapping Kanna and putting her to sleep with pills, you confined her in a torture chamber no one knew of.

column5:
なぜ、あなたが拷問部屋の事
を知っていたのか？その訳も、さっ
きの優子さんの言葉で分かったよ‥
column6: How did _you_ know about the chamber? I learned the reason from your words just now, Miss Yuuko...

column5:
２０年前、この館で殺人事件
が起こった時に、子供が一人、難を
逃れている。
column6: Twenty years ago, when a murder occurred in this mansion, a child alone escaped harm.

column5:
その子供こそ‥優子さんだっ
たんだ。
column6: That child...was you, Miss Yuuko.

column5:
かんながいないと騒ぎになっ
たところで、霊の力を借りると称し
て、彼女を助け出す。
column6: When there was an uproar over Kanna's disappearance, you proclaimed you were using the spirits' power and saved her.

column5:
それをカメラに収めておけば
あなたは一躍注目をあびる事になる
‥。
column6: By capturing it on camera, you would instantly be a sensation again...

column5:
たかが人気を取り戻すために
たいそうな計画をたてたものだね。
でも、計算違いがあったんだ。
column6: You concocted quite the scheme just to bring back your popularity, didn't you? But you made a miscalculation.

column5: ひっ!!

かんなを拷問部屋に監禁した
ところまではよかったのに、それを
綾華に見られてしまったんだ。
column6: Though everything had gone fine until you shut Kanna in the torture chamber, Ayaka saw you at it.

column5:
計画は、誰にも知られてはい
けなかった‥。
column6: No one could learn of your plan...

column5:
知られたら‥あなたは犯罪者
として注目をあびる事になってしま
うから。
column6: If they found out, you'd be a sensation...as a criminal.

column5:
だから‥だから、綾華を殺し
たんだ！
column6: So...So, you killed Ayaka!

column5:
ウ、ウソよっ!!\n
デタラメだわ！
column6:
Y-you lie!\n
This is nonsense!

column5:
答えなさい！\n
あなたは、一体だれなのっ?!
column6:
Answer me!\n
Who are you!?

column5:
みんなは、あなたの芝居にだ
まされたけど、ボクはだまされない
よ。
column6: The others may have been fooled by your drama, but I will not be.

column5: 優子さん。
column6: Miss Yuuko.

column5: ボクは、
あなたを‥‥
column6: ...will not...

column5: メ、メイ!!？
column6: M-May!?

column5:
ほ、ほほほ‥‥ほ〜ほっほ！
お、驚いたわ、ほほほ‥。\n
まさに迫真の演技だったわね。
column6:
Hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh...\n
HOH-HOH-HOH! Y-you surprised me, hoh-hoh-hoh...A performance true to life indeed.

column5:
さすが女優の卵ってところか
しら。\n
でも、大人をからかうのは‥‥。
column6:
Perhaps to be expected of an actress in the making.\n
But I'm afraid teasing the adults is...

‥‥メイ。\n
あなたもバカな子ね。

...May.\n
You are a foolish girl.
column7: NOTE: no arguments here, this was pretty much the dumbest plan imaginable

column5:
だまっていれば、長生きでき
たものを‥。
column6: Had you kept quiet, perhaps you'd have enjoyed a long life...

column5:
メ、メイ！襲ってきます！\n
避けてくださいっ!!
column6:
M-May! She's going to attack!\n
Get out of the way!

column6: OW!

column5:
あらあら、ごめんなさいねぇ
長年手入れされてないから、切れが
鈍くなってるみたいなの。

Dear, dear, my apologies.\n
It hasn't been maintained in many years, so it seems its edge has dulled.

せめて苦しまずにと思ったけ
ど‥ムリかしらねぇ。\n
ふふふ‥‥おほほほほほ！

OH-HOH-HOH-HOH-HOH-HOH!

よ、避けましたけど‥壁際に
追い詰められましたぁ！

column5:
‥‥せっかく苦しまないよう
に、一息に殺してあげようとおもっ
たのに。
column6: And here I thought to cut you down in a heartbeat so you wouldn't suffer.

column5:
ムダなあがきは、よしなさい
な。
column6: Cease your useless struggles.

column5:
よく避けたものね。\n
でも逃がさないわよ‥。
column6:
Expertly dodged.\n
But I won't let you get away...

column5:
綾華と同じ様に、あなたを生
かしておくわけにはいかないの!!
column6: Just like Ayaka, there's not a chance I'll leave you alive!

column5: っ‥くぅ‥‥！

ほほほほほほほ！\n
とっさにかわしたようだけど、まぐ
れは続かないわよ。
column6:
Hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh!\n
You may have managed to dodge at the last second, but your luck won't hold out.

に、逃げましょう！\n
早く、早く部屋の外へ!!

Hurry! Get out of the room!

column5: あぐぅっ!!

あぁ‥‥も‥ダメ‥だぁ‥‥
気が‥遠くなっ‥てきた‥‥‥‥‥

A-Ayaka, I'm...sor...ry...

くぅ！すばしっこいガキね。

Kh! Such a nimble brat.\n
Go obediently to Ayaka's side!

冗談じゃないよっ!!\n
ほんっとに、しつこいんだから！
column6:
This is no joke!\n
She's seriously persistent!

ま、まったく‥すごい執念‥
‥ええっ?!

...HUH!?

おほほほほ‥これで終りね。
あなたさえ死ねば、私の事を知る者

column6: Oh-hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh...This is the end. If I just kill you, none will be left who know of me.

column5:
夜が明ければ、みんなが私を
注目する‥。

column5:
人気が出れば‥あの人だって
きっと私を見てくれるわ‥。
column6: If I'm popular...he'll surely gaze upon me too...

column5: ぜ、絶体絶命ぇ〜。

死んでおしまい！\n

You'll die, the end![br3]

信じたくなかったが‥‥やは
り優子、お前が‥やったんだな。
column6:
I didn't want to believe it...\n
but it was you after all, Yuuko.

私‥‥あなたが、好きだった
のよ‥。

でも、あなたは私を見てくれ
なかった‥。

あなたが見ていたのは‥いつ
も、カメラの中の女優だけ‥‥。

人気さえ‥人気さえあれば、あなた

So I thought.\n
If I...if I was just popular, I could get you to look at me.

column5:
たとえ、例えカメラの中だけ
でも、あなたに注目してもらえる‥
‥‥。
column6: Even if...even if it was just through the camera, I could get you to pay attention to me...

‥‥‥でも、おしまいよね。
‥‥‥あなたに知られたから‥‥。

...But it's over, isn't it?\n

column5:
ナビ\n
ＭＥＣ社から発売される人工知性体\n
この姿はホログラム映像なんだよ。
column6:
Navi\n
An artifical intelligence to be sold by MEC Corporation. This form is a holographic image.

column5:
立花　綾華（たちばな　あやか）\n
ボクと同じ事務所の女優。１４歳。\n
子供な所が、また可愛いんだよねぇ
column6:
Ayaka Tachibana\n
An actress with the same company as me. 14 years old. She's a bit childish, but cute too, huh?

column5:
三原　かんな（みはら　かんな）\n
１５歳。女優としては大人しすぎる\n
感じがするね。色気はあるけど。
column6:
Kanna Mihara\n
15 years old. Doesn't she seem too meek to be an actress? She's alluring, though.

column5:
柳　素子（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
１６歳の女優。すっごくキツイ性格\n
してる。ボクは好きじゃないなぁ。
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
A 16-year-old actress. She's got a REALLY uptight personality. I don't like her.

column5:
幻条　優子（げんじょう　ゆうこ）\n
２７歳の霊能者タレント。霊能力の\n
話はともかく、キレイな人だよねぇ
column6:
Yuuko Genjou\n
A 27-year-old celebrity psychic. Psychic power stuff aside, she sure is pretty.
column7: NOTE: these descriptions aren't used (there's no opportunity to open the pause menu during this part of the game) and a few of them differ slightly from the versions seen in other chapters. it doesn't matter, so i'm just duplicating them.

column5:
沢田　重樹（さわだ　しげき）\n
カメラさん。これでも２７歳。\n
仕事にはキビしい人みたい。
column6:
Shigeki Sawada\n
A cameraman. Despite his looks, he's 27. Seems like a stickler when it comes to his job.

column5:
笹木　忠雄（ささき　ただお）\n
雑用担当の２２歳。一流大学の黒ミ\n
サ同行会出身だってウワサ。
column6:
Tadao Sasaki\n
A 22-year-old handling routine duties. Rumors say he was in a group at an elite university that held a Black Mass.

column5:
白木　厚志（しらき　あつし）\n
２４歳のアシスタントディレクター\n
なんか、頼りない人だよね。
column6:
Atsushi Shiraki\n
A 24-year-old assistant director. Doesn't seem like the world's most reliable guy.

column5:
篠田　正次（しのだ　しょうじ）\n
照明担当の２５歳。無口で、愛想\n
の悪い人だよねぇ‥。
column6:
Shouji Shinoda\n
A 25-year-old in charge of lighting. Kind of a quiet and distant guy...

column5:
とところで、どこへいくんで
すか？
column6: Bye-bye the way, where are we going to?
column7: NOTE: as noted in the dialogue, Navi's speech throughout the early part of the game is full of mistakes. anything that's obviously wrong or sounds weird in the translation is (probably) intentional

column5:
仕事だよ、し・ご・と！\n
こう見えても女優なんだからね。
column6:
Work, W-O-R-K!\n
I'm an actress, even if I don't look like it.

column5:
今日は怪奇特集番組の収録。
タイトルは、『怨霊の館に挑む！』
だって。
column6: Today's the filming for a horror special. The title is {Take On the Mansion of Vengeful Spirits!}.

column5:
なんていうか‥Ｂ級映画みた
いなタイトルだよねぇ。
column6: I dunno...Sounds kind of B-movie-ish, doesn't it?

column5:
ロケ地には、もうすぐ到着し
ますから。
column6: We'll be arriving at the shooting site soon.

column5:
ナビはＭＥＣ社から発売され
る人工知性体。\n
商品名は『ＯＲＵＫＡ』
column6:
Navi is an artificial intelligence that'll be sold by MEC Corporation.\n
The actual product is called {Oruka.}

column5:
次世代のマルチメディアイン
ターフェースとして、あらゆる情報
を提供。
column6: She provides comprehensive information as a next-generation multimedia interface.

column5:
と同時に、完全なインタラク
ティブ性を備えたパートナー。
column6: Simultaneously, she's a partner equipped with full interactivity.

column5:
なんて説明をメーカーさんか
ら聞いたけど‥。\n
はっきり言って理解できないよね。
column6:
...That's the explanation the maker gave me, but...\n
To be honest, I really don't get it.

column5:
ボクが、そのＣＭに出演した
事がきっかけで、メーカーさんから
もらったのがナビなんだけど‥。
column6: I ended up receiving Navi from them thanks to appearing in that commercial, though.

column5:
最初は、ロクに会話もできな
かったよね。
column6: At first, she really couldn't talk right at all.

column5:
でも、最近ではギャグも覚え
てきて、けっこう楽しいんだな、こ
れが。
column6: But lately, she's started learning jokes, and she's gotten pretty fun.

column5:
ナビはＭＥＣ社から発売予定
の人工知性体。\n
そのＣＭにボクが出演してるんだ。
column6:
Navi is an artificial intelligence that'll be sold by MEC Corporation.\n
I appear in her commercials.
column7: NOTE: the manual describes may as the "commercial image girl" for oruka, so presumably she's in other ads too and not just the one we see in the intro

column5:
ボクと同じプロダクションに
所属してる子役女優が綾華。
column6: That's a child actress that belongs to the same production company as me, Ayaka.

column5:
なんていうか‥ちょっとヌケ
ている所があって、けっこう世話が
かかるんだけど‥。
column6: How do I put this...She's kind of absent-minded, and can be a bit of a bother...

column5:
ま、それが綾華のいいところ
なんだよね。
column6: But, well, that's what's nice about her, you know?

column5:
‥きれいな人だよねぇ。優子
さんは霊能力者‥自称してるだけだ
と思うけどね。
column6: ...She sure is pretty, huh? Miss Yuuko is a psychic medium...though I think that's just something she calls herself.

column5:
やっぱり怪奇番組に霊能力者
は欠かせないってところかな。
column6: I guess you just can't have a horror show without a psychic.

column5:
自称、霊能力者の優子さん。
きれいな人なんだけど、普段の言動
からして、結構アヤシイ。
column6: Miss Yuuko, the self-proclaimed psychic. She's pretty, but the way she acts...So suspicious.

column5:
素子とは、以前に１度共演し
たことがあるけど‥。
column6: I appeared with Motoko one time before, but...

column5:
気が強くて、いま一つウマが
あわないんだよなぁ。
column6: She's pushy, and I wouldn't call us a match made in heaven.

column5:
素子と同じプロダクションの
子らしいけど‥会うのは初めて。
column6: Apparently, she's with the same production company as Motoko, but it's my first time meeting her.

column5:
性格は、素子と実に対照的。
怪談が苦手らしいけど‥まさか気絶
するとは思わなかった。
column6: Her personality's a stark contrast to Motoko's. I'd heard she's bad with ghost stories...but I'd never have thought she'd actually faint.

column5:
ときどき篠田さんの方を見つ
めてる‥。\n
あの二人、何か関係あるのかなぁ？
column6: She glances toward Shinoda from time to time...Maybe they have some kind of relationship?

column5:
ロケバスを運転しているのが
アシスタントディレクターの白木さ
ん。

Could something have happened?

ずかしい顔をして、ほとんどしゃべ
らない。‥よく分からない人だよ。

るぞ。
column6: ...but I've also heard a rumor he held a Black Mass in an occult group at a top-ranking university.

Sawada's the cameraman.\n
I hate to say this, but he sure looks old for a guy who's 27!

ディレクターを始めとするメ
インのスタッフは、もう一台のバス
で先にロケ地に行ってるんだよね。

撮影が遅れるわね。

遅れるんなら仕方ないだろう。

It's two stories, made from wood.\n
It seems like a really old building, but it doesn't have the crumbling look you'd expect.

かな？

て。

う、うん。\n

いねぇ。\n

Rituals of blood, held in a secret chamber none knew of...\n
Many lives were taken.

column6: But what might surprise you is that he concealed these acts from his family's eyes.

column5:
男は家族の前では、自然を愛する良
き夫を演じ続けてきたの。

column5:
でも‥それもいつまでも続かなかっ
た‥‥‥。

column5:
全てを知った妻が、警察に連絡し、
夫に罪を償うべきだと説得したの。
column6: His wife, discovering everything, called the police, and convinced her husband he should atone for his sins.
column7: CHECK, i'm pretty sure this is unambiguously saying that his wife "convinced him" rather than "tried to convince him [and failed]", but that's hard to reconcile with him turning around and killing her. is the idea here "she convinced him to atone, and because of his sociopathy, he decided to do so by killing her?"

column5:
だけど、男に罪の意識なんてあるは
ずがなかったのよ。
column6: But the man could never have comprehended the concept of sin.
column7: CHECK, i think i understand the meaning of this line but it's hard to get it across well in english

\s<$1E>こ\s<$02>の下に、なにかあるのかしらね？
column6:
There's an arrow drawn here.\n
\s<$1E>C\s<$02>ould there be something beneath it?

column5: ＳＯＲＲＹ‥？
column6: SORRY...?

column5:
ふふふ‥霊が謝ってるのかし
らね。
column6: Heh-heh-heh...Are the spirits apologizing?

column5:
さ、こんな気味の悪いところ
に、いつまでもいたくないわ。
column6: Well, I'd rather not remain around in this ghastly place.

column5:
早くかんなちゃんを、部屋に
運びましょう。
column6: Let's carry Kanna back to her room, quickly.

column5:
かんなが横たわっていた台で
すよ。血文字は、かんなの頭の横あ
たりに浮かびあがりました。
column6: It's the pedestal Kanna was lying on. Blood writing appeared in the area next to her head.

column5:
‥‥‥あれ？\n
何か、丸い物が落ちていますね。
column6:
...Huh?\n
Some round thing has been dropped here.

column5:
文字が浮かびあがった所は、
はっきりと見ましたよ。
column6: We clearly saw the letters appearing.

column5:
誰も手を使ってませんでした
本当に‥霊のメッセージなんでしょ
うか？
column6:
Nobody used their hands.\n
Is it truly a message from a spirit?

column5: なに？薬みたいだけど‥。
column6: What? It looks like medicine...

column5:
あ、それ知ってます！\n
ナビを造った人が、よく飲んでまし
た。
column6:
Oh, I know what that is!\n
The person who created Navi took them a lot.
column7: NOTE: almost a dupe of 1044, except the exclamation mark and period are switched between sentences.

column5: で、なんなの？
column6: So what are they?

column5:
睡眠薬ですよ。\n
結構、強力なやつでして、一粒飲め
ば、もうぐっすり。
column6:
They're sleeping pills.\n
They're quite powerful, and if someone takes one, they'll be sound asleep.

column5:
蹴ろうが、殴ろうが起きませ
んよ。
column6: They won't wake up even if you punch or kick them.

column5:
ちょっと待ってよ！\n
これが、かんなの側で見つかったん
だよ？
column6:
Wait a minute!\n
We found this next to Kanna, right?

column5:
重要な手がかりですね。\n
つまり、かんなは睡眠薬で眠らされ
たのではないかと。
column6:
It's an important clue.\n
This means Kanna may have been put to sleep with sleeping pills.

column7: NOTE: just for posterity, here's a scene that you'd probably never see without looking for it: if you leave the torture chamber before picking up Ayaka's glasses and go back to May's room, Yuuko will be there, and when you get close, she'll leave, look back and forth down the hallway VERY SUSPICIOUSLY, and then go back to her own room. honestly, i don't know what the significance of this is supposed to be; she apparently doesn't try to hide any evidence or anything.

column5: どうしました？
column6: What's wrong?

column5: これは‥‥。
column6: These are...

column5: ダーツですね。
column6: They're darts.

column5:
綾華に刺さってたダーツと同
じ型だよ。
column6: They're the same shape as the dart that was in Ayaka.

column5:
綾華を殺した奴は‥‥この部
屋に入った事があるんだ‥。
column6: Ayaka's killer...came into this room...

column5: ！‥‥綾華の眼鏡だ!!
column6: !...Ayaka's glasses!

column5:
そういえば‥綾華の眼鏡が、
ありませんでしたね。
column6: Come to think of it...Ayaka's glasses were gone, weren't they?

column5:
綾華が、ここに来たんだ‥。
そして、犯人に襲われる事になった
‥‥。
column6:
Ayaka came here...\n
and got attacked by the culprit...

column5:
凶器となったダーツもありま
すし、そう考えるのが自然でしょう
column6: The murder weapon was a dart, so it's natural to think so.

DUPE: F1388
