column5: 順を追って説明しますね。
column6: I'll explain in order.

column5:
１：書き込む\c<$0C>地名\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で羽根を動かし、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を
押します。
column6: 1: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>place name\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
２：書き込む\c<$0C>場所\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で地図上の羽根を動かして、\c<$0B>
[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押します。
column6: 2: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>area\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
３：書き込みを\c<$0C>中止\c<$0F>する時は、\c<$0B>終了\c<$0F>
に羽根を合わせて\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押すか\c<$0B>
[II]ボタン\c<$0F>を押して下さい。
column6: 3: To \c<$0C>stop\c<$0F> filling in, move the feather to \c<$0B>Done\c<$0F> and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>, or press the \c<$0B>II Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
画面の下に表示される地名の
色は、次のような意味を持っていま
す。
column6: The place names displayed at the bottom of the screen have the following meanings.

column5: \c<$09>黄色\c<$0F>‥地名を書き込んでいない。
column6: \c<$09>Yellow:\c<$0F> You haven't filled in the place name.

column5:
\c<$08>緑色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ後。\n
正しいか否かが確認できていない。
column6: \c<$08>Green:\c<$0F> Filled in. Whether it's correct or not is unconfirmed.

column5:
\c<$0A>赤色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が、間違って
いる。
column6: \c<$0A>Red:\c<$0F> The location you filled in is incorrect.

column5: \c<$0F>白色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が正しかった
column6: \c<$0F>White:\c<$0F> The location you filled in was correct.

column5:
外に出た時に、ナビが地図を
表示します。
column6: When you leave, Navi will display the map.

column5:
画面上の羽根を、行きたい場
所にあわせて、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押してく
ださい。
column6: Move the on-screen feather to the place you want to go and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
四角形の\c<$0C>１辺は５００メート
ル\c<$0F>です。
column6: \c<$0C>One square\c<$0F> on the grid is \c<$0C>500 meters\c<$0F>.

column5:
柳　素子　（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
一時はどうなる事かと思ったけど、
疑いも晴らせて、本当によかったよ
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
I wasn't sure what was going to happen for a minute there. Thank goodness we got her cleared of suspicion.

column5:
立花　次郎　（たちばな　じろう）
刑事さん。実は綾華のお父さんだっ
たんだよね‥。
column6:
Jirou Tachibana\n
A police detective. So he was actually Ayaka's father...

column5:
朝霧　正臣　（あさぎり　まさみ）
温子さんの夫。新婚旅行で２つもの
事件に巻き込まれた不運の人。
column6:
Masami Aasagiri\n
Atsuko's husband. An unlucky man who's gotten caught up in two incidents on his honeymoon.

column5:
朝霧　温子　（あさぎり　あつこ）
正臣さんの奥さん。せっかくの新婚
旅行だったのに‥不幸な人だよね。
column6:
Atsuko Asagiri\n
Masami's wife. She'd finally gotten to go on her honeymoon, but now...What an unfortunate woman.

column5:
木原　尚子　（きはら　なおこ）\n
ハ虫類研究者。児島にいる珍種のヘ
ビを捕まえるのが目的なんだって。
column6:
Naoko Kihara\n
A reptile researcher. Says her goal is to capture rare snake species that are on Kojima.

column5:
渡部　吟次　（わたべ　ぎんじ）\n
児島の駐在さん。人当りのいい温厚
そうなおじいさん。
column6:
Ginji Watabe\n
Kojima's resident officer. Seems like an affable, mild-mannered old man.

column5:
老婆\n
鎌を振り回す、謎のお婆さん。あま
りお近付きにはなりたくないなぁ。
column6:
Old Woman\n
A mysterious old woman brandishing a sickle. I'd rather not get too close to her...

column5:
武藤　孝弘　（むとう　たかひろ）
被害者。立花さんの亡くなられた同
僚の、息子さんだったんだって。
column6:
Takahiro Mutou\n
The victim. Apparently, he was the son of Mr. Tachibana's deceased colleague.

column5:
榊　弘司　（さかき　こうじ）\n
児島ホテルのオーナー。\n
礼儀正しい紳士さん。
column6:
Kouji Sakaki\n
The owner of the Kojima Hotel.\n
A well-mannered gentleman.

column7:
NOTE: this message erroneously lacks a [clear] command after the [wait]. we have to add one to avoid noticeable display errors as the game reloads the menu afterwards. similar errors are present here and there; we'll see if i care enough to try to fix them all.

also note that it uses [noinsta] at the end to turn off insta-printing...which it never actually turns on in the first place. (which on further inspection seems to be the real issue)

column5: ‥こっちは裏ですって。

column5:
やこうどう）\n
夜光ゴケが自生する洞窟です。
column6:
Noctilucent Cave\n
A cave where noctilucent moss grows natively.

column5:
夜光ゴケはセン類に属するコケ植物
であり、発光する性質を持っている
珍しい植物です。
column6: Noctilucent moss is a bryophyte with the unusual property of emitting light.

column5:
発光のために微量元素を必要とする
ため、自生域は限られています。
column6: Because it requires micronutrients for the emission of light, its native range is limited.

column5:
夜光洞では、洞窟の奥に備えられた
スイッチで照明を消すことができま
す。
column6: In Noctilucent Cave, you can turn off the lights using the switch installed within the cave.

column5:
夜光ゴケと岩石に含まれる鉱物が闇
に放つ光が、幻想的な世界をつくり
あげます。
column6: The light given off by the noctilucent moss and the minerals in the rocks creates a fantastic world.

column5:
←照明用スイッチ\n
消した後は、必ずつけるようにして
ください。
column6:
[<-] Light Switch\n
After turning off, please be sure to turn back on.

column5:
へぇ、こんな所に浜辺があっ
たんだ。
column6: Ooh...So there's a beach somewhere like this.

column5:
周囲が岩場に囲まれてますか
ら、ちょっと見ただけでは分かりま
せんね。
column6: The surrounding area is enclosed by rocks, so you wouldn't know it at a glance.

column5:
この岩場の向こうが、港だよ
ね？
column6: So the harbor's on the other side of these rocks?

column5:
そうですよ。\n
‥とは言っても、この険しい岩場の
５００メートル先ですけどね。
column6:
That's right.\n
...Though it's 500 meters away over steep rock.

column5:
ロープですか？\n
海から流れ着いたんでしょうか。
column6:
Is that a rope?\n
Maybe it washed in from the sea.

column5:
ロープの端が岩場に結び付け
られてるからね。\n
誰かが結んだのは間違いないよ。
column6: The rope's end is attached to the rocks. Someone definitely tied it there.

column5:
ま、たいして意味はないだろ
うけどね。
column6: Oh well, I doubt there's really any significance to it.

column5:
ご用がございましたら
承ります。
column6: Should you need anything, I'll be right with you.

column5:
ご用がございましたら
承ります。
column6: Should you need anything, I'll be right with you.

\n

column5:
よし、着いたぜ。\n
それにしても、うかない顔してるな
column6:
Arright, we're here.\n
But you sure got a long face.

column5:
洞窟で何があったか、なんて
聞かねぇけどよぉ‥。\n
あまりムチャは、しねぇ方がいいぜ
column6: I ain't gonna ask what happened in the cave, but hey...don'tcha go doin' anything reckless, now.

column5:
‥そうだね、気を付けるよ。
ありがとう！船頭さん。
column6: ...Right, I'll be careful. Thank you, Mr. Ferryman!

column5:
いかんいかん！\n
もう大島へ渡し船を出す時間だぜ。
column6:
Nope, nope!\n
'S already time to send out the ferry to Ohshima.

column5:
‥‥なんだったんだろうな。
あの婆さん‥。
column6:
...The heck was that?\n
That old lady...

column5:
そろそろ出港しなくちゃなん
ねぇな。\n
嬢ちゃんは、島に残るんだろ？
column6: Gonna hafta set out soon. Yer stayin' on the island, right, missy?

column5: あ、あら、お客様！
column6: O-oh my, ma'am!

column5:
あなたは、ホテルのフロント
の‥‥。
column6: You're the hotel's receptionist...?

column5:
はい。\n
でも今日はお休みを頂いておりまし
て、大島まで‥。
column6: Yes. But today I'll be taking the day off and going to Ohshima...

column5:
見ておれ！\n
必ず\c<$0C>復讐\c<$0F>してやるでな!!
column6: Look you here! I WILL have my \c<$0C>revenge\c<$0F>!

column5:
お嬢ちゃんや。\n
確かに、鎌は返してもらったぞ。
column6:
Girl.\n
I see you've returned my sickle to me.

column5:
ぃ‥いった〜い‥。\n
何で、何で、わたしがこんな目にあ
うの?!
column6:
O...ouuuuuch...\n
Why...why did...this happen to me!?

column5:
まさか‥あの、お婆さ
んの言うことを本気にしてるの？\n
んもぅ！信じらんないっ!!
column6: You can't possibly be taking what that old lady says SERIOUSLY, can you? God! I don't BELIEVE you!

column5:
知りませんよ、そんな
事！
column6: I don't know anything about that!

column5:
『復讐』のことを聞く\n
鎌のことを聞く\n
立ち去る
column6:
Ask about the {revenge}\n
Ask about the sickle\n
Leave

column5:
申し訳ないのですが、
ここは、お通しできません。
column6: I'm very sorry, but I'm afraid coming back here isn't permitted.

column5:
なんとか、中を捜索できない
んですか？
column6: Can't we search inside somehow?

column5:
捜査令状もないのにか？\n
そりゃムリだ。
column6: Without a warrant? Not happening.

column5:
今回は、あまり目立つわけに
はいかない事は分かるだろう？
column6: You understand we can't stick out too much this time, right?
column7: CHECK, not sure quite what he means -- is this going back to the "we can't trust the police" thing?

フロント嬢の事　老婆の事\n
浜辺の事　　　　立ち去る

The receptionist
\n

\n

column5:
出かけたきり帰ってき
てませんね。
column6: He left and hasn't returned since.

column5:
‥ところでですね。\n
昨日の夜、支配人は\c<$0C>全身びしょ濡れ
で帰ってきた\c<$0F>んですよ。
column6:
...Oh, and by the way.\n
Yesterday evening, the manager \c<$0C>came back here soaked head to toe\c<$0F>.

column5: そ、それ本当ですか?!
column6: I-is that true!?

column5:
え、ええ。支配人に口
止めされてたんですけど‥。
column6: Y-yes. He made me keep quiet about it, but...

column5:
雨も降らなかったし、
昨日の事件の事もありましてね。\n
気になってたんですよ。
column6: It didn't rain, and there was that incident yesterday, too. It's been bothering me.

column5:
いや、急に休暇をとっ
たみたいでしてね。
column6: Well, apparently, she abruptly took time off.

column5:
私が、突然フロントに
入る事になってしまったんですよ。
column6: I ended up having to suddenly take over the front desk.

column5:
老婆？\n
誰の事です？
column6: Old woman? Who do you mean?

column5:
ただ今、外出しており
ます。
column6: He went out just now.

column5:
申し訳ありませんが、
行き先は存じておりません。
column6: I'm terribly sorry, but I don't know where he went.

column5:
ああ、彼女でしたら、
今日は休暇を頂いております。
column6: Oh, her? She's taken the day off.

column5:
は？‥‥老婆？\n
いえ、私は知りませんが‥‥？
column6:
Huh?...Old woman?\n
No, I don't know of her...?

column5:
児島の西岸は、絶好の
海水浴場でございます。\n
きれいな浜辺が続いてますよ。
column6: Kojima's west coast is an ideal swimming spot. The beautiful beaches stretch on and on.

column5:
ご、ごめんなさ〜いっ！\n
ちょ、ちょっと、今は手が離せない
の!!
column6:
S-SORRY!\n
I-I've kinda got my hands full!

column5:
ああ、メイさん。\n
どうしたんです？
column6:
Oh, May.\n
What is it?

column5:
朝霧夫妻の事　　浜辺の事\n
立ち去る
column6:

\n

\n

Beach

column5:
え？そういえば‥、ホテルに
帰ってきてからは支配人さんの姿を
見てませんね。
column6: Huh? Well, now that you mention it...I haven't seen the hotel's manager since we got back.

column5: いやぁ、参りました。
column6: Ah, I'm beat.

column5:
妻と天狗岩まで行ってきたん
ですがね、帰りに道に迷ってしまい
まして。
column6: My wife and I went to Tengu Rock, but on the way back, we got lost.

column5:
さんざん歩いたあげく、古い
寺の様な所に出たんですよ。
column6: After some miserable hiking, we ended up at a place that looked like an old temple.

column5:
それでもやっぱり場所が分か
らなくて、もう‥ひたすら歩き続け
ましたよ。
column6: Of course, we still didn't know where we were, so we just doggedly walked on.

column5:
先ほど、ようやく戻ってきた
んですが、妻なんか、疲れ果てて眠
り込んでしまう有様ですよ。
column6: We finally got back just a little while ago, but she's all tired out and sound asleep.

column5:
いや、とにかく歩きっぱなし
で。しかも、山の中ですからね。\n
本当に疲れましたよ。
column6: Ah, man, we just kept on walking and walking. And it was in the mountains, too. I really am exhausted.

column5:
いや、お誘いしておきながら
本当に申し訳ないんですが。
column6: Ah, I'd lead you there, but...I really am sorry.
column7: NOTE: used if you didn't ask them about the beach near the start of the case, and atsuko instead offered to take you there later on

column5:
妻が倒れ込んでしまったので
今日は行けそうにないんですよ。
column6: My wife's fallen over exhausted, so it seems we can't go today.

column5:
ぼくらが行ってきた浜辺なら\c<$0C>
港の側\c<$0F>にありましたよ。
column6: If you mean the beach we went to, it's \c<$0C>next to the harbor\c<$0F>.

column5:
岩場に囲まれている場所です
から、ちょっと分かりにくいかも知
れませんが。
column6: It's an area surrounded by rocks, so it may be a little hard to spot, though.

column5:
昨日の夜‥榊さんが、全身び
しょ濡れで帰ってきた‥。
column6: Yesterday evening, Mr. Sakaki came back soaked head to toe...

column5:
ホテルマンさんの言う事が真
実なら‥武藤さんを殺した犯人は‥
column6: If what the hotel worker said is true, then the culprit behind Mutou's killing is...

column5:
榊さん?!‥それが本当なら、
例の倉庫にあった密輸品も、全て榊
さんの仕業って事になるんだよ?!
column6: Mr. Sakaki!? If that's right, then it means...the smuggled goods in that warehouse were all Mr. Sakaki's doing too!?

column5:
でも、その榊さん自身が、何
者かに殺された。
column6: But Mr. Sakaki himself was killed by someone.

column5:
はぁ‥‥何がなんだか、分か
らなくなってきたよ。
column6: (sigh)...I don't get what's going on at all anymore.

column5:
ああ、メイくんか‥。\n
すまんが、調べ物があるでの。\n
用は後にしてくれんかの。
column6:
Ahh, Miss May...\n
Sorry, but I got something I'm lookin' into. Wait a spell for whatever you need, will ya?

column5:
メイくんじゃろ？\n
すまんが、用は後にしてくれんかの
column6:
Miss May?\n
Sorry, but wait a spell for whatever you need, will ya?

column5: ちょっと‥何があったの?!
column6: Hey...What happened!?

column5:
み、見てください!!\n
看板には血の跡までついてますよ！
column6:
L-look!\n
There are bloodstains on the sign!

column5: 間違いなく、血の跡ですよ。
column6: Those are definitely bloodstains.

column5:
出血量までは分かりませんが
‥血のついた手を、看板に叩きつけ
たような感じですね。
column6: I can't tell how much bleeding there was, but...I get the sense that someone slapped a bloody hand against the sign.

column5:
かなり大きい手形だね。\n
と、すると‥男性の、つまり榊さん
の手の跡かな‥？
column6:
It's a pretty big handprint.\n
So...it's a mark from a man's hand...Mr. Sakaki's...?

column5:
男物の普通の革靴ですね。\n
‥片方だけですが。
column6: It's an ordinary men's shoe. Just one, though.

column5: 柵も壊れてるね。
column6: The fence is broken, too.

column5:
何かの理由で柵が壊れて、バ
ランスを崩して落下‥‥。靴もその
時に脱げたんじゃないかな？
column6: For some reason, the fence broke, and someone lost his balance and fell...Maybe his shoe come off then, too?

column5:
男物の普通の革靴ですね。\n
‥片方だけしかありませんけど、こ
れも‥榊さんのでしょうか？
column6: It's an ordinary men's shoe. There's only one, but...is this Mr. Sakaki's too?

column5:
たぶん、ね。\n
ここの柵も壊れてるし‥‥。
column6:
That could be.\n
The fence here is broken, too...

column5:
バランスを崩して落下した時
に、脱げたとも考えられるね。
column6: It's conceivable that when he lost his balance and fell, the shoe came off.

column5: これは‥‥‥？
column6: What's this...?

column5:
スーツじゃないですか。\n
鋭利な刃物で、ずたずたに裂かれて
ますけど。
column6:
It's a suit, isn't it?\n
But it's been cut to pieces with a sharp blade.

column5:
そんな事は分かるよ。\n
ボクが気になったのは、これ！
column6:
I know that.\n
What was bothering me was this!

column5:
し、支配人の榊さんじゃない
ですか！
column6: I-isn't that Mr. Sakaki, the manager's!?

column5:
状況から見れば、好ましくな
い事件に巻き込まれた可能性が‥。
column6: From the look of things, he may have gotten wrapped up in a nasty incident...

column5: ‥‥二人目の犠牲者、か。
column6: ...A second victim, huh.

column5:
ほんとに‥榊さんが、犠牲者
なんでしょうか‥‥‥。
column6: Is Mr. Sakaki really the victim...?

column5:
柵が壊れてる‥。\n
やっぱり、誰か落ちたのかな？
column6:
The fence is broken...\n
Did someone fall?

column5:
柵が壊れてる‥。\n
榊さん‥ここから、落ちちゃったの
かな‥‥‥。
column6:
The fence is broken...\n
Did Mr. Sakaki...fall from here...?

column5:
ああ、メイくんか‥。\n
どうしたんじゃね？\n
そんなに血相を変えて。
column6:
Ahh, Miss May...\n
What's the matter? You're looking mighty flustered.

column5:
そんな、のんきな事を言って
る場合じゃありません！
column6: This is no time to be making idle chatter!

column5:
榊さんが‥榊さんが、誰かに
襲われたかもしれないんですよ！
column6: Mr. Sakaki...Mr. Sakaki may have been attacked by someone!

column5: [3x]\s<$01>なんじゃと？
column6: [3x]\s<$01>What in the--?[1x]

column5:
天狗岩に、傷害事件の痕跡が
あったんです。
column6: There were signs of an incident resulting in injury at Tengu Rock.

column5:
遺留品を調査した結果‥どう
も、榊さんが被害者の様なんです。
column6: From investigating the articles left there...it seems that Mr. Sakaki was the victim.

column5:
そんな、のんきな事を言って
る場合じゃありません！
column6: This is no time to be making idle chatter!

column5:
天狗岩に、傷害事件の痕跡が
あったんですよ！
column6: There were signs of an incident resulting in injury at Tengu Rock!

column5:
まだ被害者の身元は分かって
いませんが、現場には遺留品も残さ
れてました。
column6: We don't know the victim's identity yet, but there were articles left behind at the scene.

column5: 現場は、天狗岩じゃな?!
column6: This happened at Tengu Rock!?
column7: NOTE: dialogue for talking to watabe as he runs off after the above conversation. pretty much no one would see this without trying; he runs off at your normal movement speed, so if you want to catch him, you have to start moving right away.

column5:
メイくんの言うとおり‥事件
があった様じゃの。
column6: As you say, Miss May...it looks like there's been an incident.

column5:
尋ねる\n
話す\n
立ち去る
column6:
Ask\n
Talk\n
Leave

column5:
被害者のこと\n
犯人のこと\n
尋ねない
column6:
About the victim\n
About the culprit\n
Don't ask

column5:
倉庫のこと\n
話さない
column6:
About the warehouse\n
Don't talk

column5:
倉庫のこと\n
ずぶ濡れで戻った榊のこと\n
話さない
column6:
About the warehouse\n
About Sakaki coming back soaked\n
Don't talk

column5:
被害者は、おそらく榊くんに
まちがいないじゃろう。
column6: I can't deny Sakaki's probably the victim here.

column5:
犯人と争った末に、足場が崩
れて崖下に落下したとしか考えられ
ん‥‥。
column6: Only thing that makes sense is that after he tussled with the culprit, he lost his footing and fell to the bottom of the cliff...

column5: こ、ここから落ちたなら‥。
column6: I-if he fell from here...

column5:
‥生きておるはずがないじゃ
ろうな。\n
遺体の捜索も難しい‥‥。
column6: ...There's no way he'd've survived. Tracking down the body'll be tough...

column5: メイくんが言うとおりじゃ。
column6: Just like you said, Miss May.

column5:
血の手形は分からんとしても
他の遺留品は、間違いなく榊くんの
ものじゃ‥なぜ‥‥。
column6: Even if I can't recognize the bloody handprint, the other items are all Sakaki's, no doubt about it...Why...?

column5:
どういうことじゃ‥？\n
被害者は榊くんじゃ!!
column6: What's the meaning of this...? The victim is Sakaki!

column5: まさか?!
column6: No way...!?

column5:
遺留品の服に、彼の名札がつ
いておったんじゃ。
column6: These discarded clothes got his name tag on 'em.

column5:
それに‥この靴も、間違いな
く榊くんのもの‥‥じゃが、なぜ‥
column6: What's more...this shoe is unquestionably Sakaki's. But why...?

column5:
遺留品と状況からでは、犯人
についての手がかりはないのぉ。
column6: There's no clues 'bout the attacker from the situation or the items left here.

column5:
‥‥‥なるほどの。\n
三本岬にそんな洞窟があったんじゃ
の。
column6:
...I see.\n
So there's a cave like that in Threewood Cape, is there?

column5:
拳銃に麻薬とくれば、非合法
な取り引きと相場が決まっとるから
の‥。
column6: If it's handguns and drugs we're looking at here, anybody'd tell you there's unlawful dealings involved...

column5:
メイくんの言うとおり、武藤
くんは『組織』の秘密を知ったため
に、殺されたんじゃろう‥‥。
column6: As you say, Miss May, young Mutou mighta been killed for learning the secrets of a `syndicate~...
column7: NOTE: i'd just like to note that the syndicate doesn't seem to have a proper name; everyone always refers to it as "soshiki" ("[criminal] syndicate") in quotation marks, the first instance being here. at first the references are generic in nature, like here -- "a syndicate", "a big syndicate" -- but by the time case 3 rolls around, we're clearly talking about a specific organization, "the Syndicate". though there's no change in the term used in the original language, I'll probably start capitalizing it for case 3 if not sooner.

column5: 組織‥ですか？
column6: A...syndicate?

column5:
倉庫には、かなりの量の拳銃
や麻薬があったんじゃろ？
column6: There were pistols and drugs aplenty in the warehouse, weren't there?

column5:
そこまでの事をするには個人
の力ではムリじゃよ。
column6: There'd be no pulling that off under just one person's power.

column5:
間違いなく‥大きな『組織』
の力が関わっておるはずじゃ‥‥。
column6: No doubt about it...there musta been a mighty syndicate's force behind it...

column5:
わしのカンじゃが‥立花くん
は、その『組織』を調べるために、
この島に来たんじゃないかの。
column6: I got a feeling...I think Tachibana's showed up on this island to investigate that syndicate.

column5:
わしに会いに来たわけでは、
なかろうて‥‥。
column6: So he didn't come to see me...

column5:
そこまで調べあげたのか！\n
さすが、あの草薙の娘ごじゃの。\n
たいしたモンじゃ！
column6: So you even looked into that! I shoulda figured, you being Kusanagi's girl and all. Excellent work!

column5:
ほ‥‥もはや、わしの出る幕
はなさそうじゃ‥。
column6: Whew...Sounds like there's no place for me in this anymore...

column5:
あとの調査は、お前さんや立
花くんにまかせた方が良さそうじゃ
よ‥‥。
column6: Think I'd best leave the rest of the investigating up to you and Tachibana...

column5:
わしは、少しだけ気になる事
があるのでな。\n
もうしばらく、ここにおるよ。
column6: I've got something's been bothering me a little. I'll stick around here for a spell.

column5:
立花くんが帰ってきたら、あ
とは任せると伝えておいてくれるか
の。
column6: When he gets back, wouldja tell Tachibana I'm leaving the rest to him?

column5: いや、参った参った。
column6: Ah, geez, I give.

column5:
あの刑事さんが、かなり強引
でな。
column6: That's one pushy detective.

column5:
まだ出港の時間でもなかった
のに『児島に戻れ！』だもんな。\n
むりやり出港させられたぜ。
column6: Wasn't even time to set out yet and there he is, goin' `Back to Kojima!~. Forced me right outta the port.
[2x]\s<$01>Mr. Tachibana![1x]

column5:
メイ！\n
一体、どこに行っていたんだ。\n
ずいぶん探したぞ。
column6:
May!\n
Where the heck did you go? We searched all over.

column7: NOTE: how many times have we done this dramatic それどころじゃない transition now? 4?

column5: ‥‥‥なるほどな。
column6: ...Got it.

column5:
密輸品の倉庫に榊の死‥ね。
まったくムチャしやがって。
column6: A warehouse of smuggled goods, and Sakaki's death...Good grief, what happened to not doing anything stupid?

column5:
‥が、よくやったぞ。\n
これで確実な証拠が見つかったわけ
だ。
column6:
...But you did good.\n
This means we've got surefire proof now.

column5: 証拠？どういう事です？
column6: Proof? What do you mean?

column5:
そうだな‥。\n
何から話したものかな。
column6:
Right...\n
Where do I start with this?

column5:
もう１０年にもなるかな。\n
ある『組織』の存在が明らかになっ
た。
column6: Has it been ten years now? It became clear that a certain `syndicate~ existed.

column5:
武器や麻薬、盗掘品を主とす
る非合法な取り引きで、莫大な利益
を得ている組織でな。
column6: They're a syndicate reaping vast profits from unlawful dealings centered on weapons, drugs, and stolen artifacts.

column5:
何度も捜査が行われたが‥。
残念ながら、何も分からなかった。
column6: Investigations have been carried out over and over...but unfortunately, they've never turned anything up.

column5:
だが先日、この島に『組織』
に関係する何かがある事が分かって
な。
column6: But a few days ago, I learned that there's something related to the syndicate on this island.

column5:
おれは、それを調べるために
来たって訳だ。
column6: So, I came here to investigate it.

column5:
武器や麻薬などの非合法な取
り引きで、利益を得ている『組織』
がある。
column6: There's a syndicate reaping profits from unlawful dealings in weapons, drugs, and the like.
column7: NOTE: for some reason, every option in this conversation has a "long" version used the first time it's picked and a short "summary" version used if it's selected again. why they bothered, i don't know.

column5:
その調査をするために、この
島に来たわけだ。
column6: So, I came to this island to investigate them.

column5:
これまでの捜査で捕まったの
は、全て雑魚ばかりでな。\n
ほとんど分かっていないのが実情だ
column6: Up to now, the investigation's caught nothing but grunts. As things stand, we barely know anything.

column5:
だが、メイの見つけた倉庫が
状況を大きく前進させるかもしれん
ほんとうに、よくやったぞ。
column6: But May, the warehouse you found could push the situation way forward. Seriously, you did good.

column5:
ほとんど何も分かってないの
が実情だが、メイの見つけた倉庫が
状況を大きく前進させるかもしれん
column6: As things stand, we barely know anything, but the warehouse you found could push the situation way forward.

column5:
以前に、『警察はあてにでき
ない』って言ってましたよね。
column6: Earlier, you told us, `We can't rely on the police,~ right?

column5:
‥あまり、言いたくなかった
んだがな。
column6: ...Well, I didn't really want to say it.

column5:
殺された青年の父である武藤
刑事。
column6: The murdered man's father, Detective Mutou...

column5:
それからメイ、お前の父であ
る草薙刑事も、『組織』の調査中に
命を落としている。
column6: And May, your father, Detective Kusanagi, too[nbsp]-- they both lost their lives investigating the syndicate.

column5:
え？\n
‥で、でも‥お父さんは自殺‥。
column6:
Huh?\n
...B-but...my father committed suicide...

column5: どうだかな‥。
column6: A likely tale, that...

column5:
とにかく、武藤刑事の例を見
る限り、『組織』に対する捜査状況
が漏れている様子でな。
column6: In any event, as far as I can tell from the case of Detective Mutou, the state of the investigation into the syndicate is being leaked.

column5:
おそらく警察内部に『組織』
に関わっている者がいるんだろう。
column6: There's probably someone inside the police who's connected to the syndicate.

column5:
７年前‥武藤刑事は『組織』
の連中に撃たれた。
column6: Seven years ago...Detective Mutou was attacked by members of the syndicate.

column5:
その時の状況から見ても、武
藤の捜査状況が『組織』に漏れてい
た事は明らかなんだ。
column6: The situation at that time alone makes it clear that the state of Mutou's investigation was leaked to the syndicate.

column5:
つまり‥警察内部に『組織』
に関わっている者がいる事になる。
column6: In other words...that means there's someone in the police with connections to the syndicate.

column5:
殺された武藤くんの父が、７
年前に『組織』に殺された事は理解
してるな？
column6: You understand that the father of Mutou, the murder victim, was killed by the syndicate seven years ago, right?

column5:
大島で彼の家を調べてみたん
だが、面白いことに『組織』の調査
レポートが見つかったんだ。
column6: I took a look into his house on Ohshima, and interestingly, I turned up an investigation report on the syndicate.

column5:
何かのきっかけで、父の死の
原因を知り‥、復讐のために独自に
調査を続けてきたんだろう‥‥。
column6: Probably, some sort of impetus led him to learn the cause of his father's death...and he continued the investigation himself, seeking revenge.

column5:
大島の彼の家を調べてきたん
だが、独自に調べたらしい『組織』
の調査レポートが発見されたんだ。
column6: I looked into his house on Ohshima, and found an investigation report on the syndicate that seems to show he investigated them himself.

column5:
おそらく、父が『組織』に殺
された事を知って、復讐を果たそう
としていたんだろう‥‥。
column6: Most likely, he learned his father had been killed by the syndicate and was trying to get revenge...

column5:
老婆の事で分かったのは１つ
だけだ。
column6: I only found out one thing about the old woman.

column5:
殺された武藤くんは、４カ月
前に初めて大島に来た。
column6: Mutou, the murdered man, first came to Ohshima four months ago.

column5:
その時に背の低い老婆と一緒
だったらしい。
column6: It seems he was accompanied by a short old woman at the time.

column5:
二人で児島に渡り、武藤くん
だけが戻ってきて、大島で暮らして
いたらしい。
column6: They crossed over to Kojima together, and Mutou alone returned, dwelling on Ohshima.

column5:
４カ月前‥それじゃお婆さん
は、この島で暮らしてるって事じゃ
ないですか?!
column6: Four months ago...Then doesn't that mean the old woman has been living on this island!?

column5:
武藤くんが大島に来たのは、
４カ月前だ。\n
その時に老婆と一緒だったらしい。
column6: Mutou came to Ohshima four months ago. It seems he was accompanied by the old woman at the time.

column5:
そして二人で児島に渡った後
大島に戻ってきたのは、武藤くんだ
けだ。
column6: Then, after the two of them crossed over to Kojima, the only one to return to Ohshima was Mutou.

column5:
今後の捜査のポイントは、榊
と老婆だろうな。
column6: The points to investigate from here on out are most likely Sakaki and the old woman.

column5:
物証はないが、榊がずぶ濡れ
で戻ってきたという話が本当なら、
武藤くんを殺したのは、榊だろう。
column6: There's no material evidence, but if it's true that Sakaki came back soaking wet, the one that killed Mutou was probably him.

column5:
あとは、老婆と事件の関係が
分かればな。
column6: What's left is to find out what the old woman has to do with the case.

column5:
なるほどね。\n
あの洞窟が『組織』の倉庫になって
いるのか‥‥。
column6:
I see.\n
So that cave is a warehouse for the syndicate...
[3x]\s<$01>WATABE![1x]

column5: ど、どうして‥。
column6: Wh-why...?

column5:
まだ息があります！\n
急いで手当てをすれば、助かるかも
しれません！
column6:
He's still breathing!\n
He might make it if he gets medical attention!

column5:
わ、わたし、船頭さんを呼ん
でくる！
column6: I...I'll call the ferryman!

column5:
警部！\n
しっかりしてください！
column6: Inspector! Pull yourself together!

column5:
意識を失ってます。\n
あまり動かさないで下さい。
column6:
He's lost consciousness.\n
Don't move him too much.

column5:
周囲　　　　　　立花の様子\n
渡部の様子　　　渡部の傷
column6:
Surroundings
[sp]<$70>
Tachibana
\n

Watabe
[sp]<$70>
Watabe's wound

渡部の様子　　　渡部の傷\n
封筒

Surroundings
[sp]<$70>

\n

Watabe
[sp]<$70>
Watabe's wound
\n

Envelope

column5:
凶器が見あたりませんね。\n
犯人の手がかりになりそうなものも
見つかりません。
column6: There's no weapon to be found. There doesn't seem to be anything that would be a clue as to the culprit, either.

column5:
‥この状況では自殺か他殺か
もハッキリしませんね。
column6: It's not clear from the situation whether it's a suicide or a murder.

column5:
かなり動転してる。\n
いつもの立花さんらしくないけど‥
‥ムリないか。
column6: He's pretty shaken. That's not like Mr. Tachibana...but it's understandable.

column5:
ボクたちと別れてから、そん
なに時間がたってないのに‥。
column6: It hadn't even been that long since we left him...

column5:
事件とは、突然おこるもので
すよ。
column6: So the incident occurred suddenly.

column5:
ところで、渡部さん‥何か手
に持っていませんか？
column6: By the way...isn't Mr. Watabe holding something in his hand?

column5:
鋭利な刃物で一突きですね。
傷は深いですが、致命傷ではありま
せん。
column6: There's one stab from a sharp blade. The wound is deep, but it's not a fatal injury.

column5:
他殺だとしたら、犯人は何故
とどめをささなかったのでしょう？
column6: If it's a murder, why didn't the killer deliver the finishing blow?

column5:
‥‥自殺ならば、凶器はどこ
にある？
column6: ...And if it's a suicide, where's the weapon?

column5:
海に投げ捨てる余裕があるな
ら、ここまで深い傷はつくれん‥。
column6: You can't make a wound this deep and have enough left in you to throw it in the ocean...

column5:
壊れた信号の中には、\n
必ず意味がある。\n
　　　　　　　　　　渡部
column6:
In the broken signal, you will surely find meaning.\n
#SETPADANDCENTER(112, 112)
Watabe
#DISABLEPADANDCENTER()
column7: NOTE: this letter is insta-printed, even though the previous one was not. don't ask me why.

column5: 達筆ですね。
column6: What skillful penmanship.

column5:
ナ、ナビ‥‥。\n
こんな時に緊張感をそがないで‥。
column6: N-Navi...Don't lower the tension at a time like this...

column5:
あ、いえ、そんなつもりじゃ
なかったんです。
column6: Ah, no, I didn't mean it like that.

column5:
しかし‥メイあてになってま
すけど、心あたりあります？
column6: But...he's relying on you, May, so do you have any idea about this?

column5:
ないよ！\n
何かの‥暗号だと思うけど‥‥。
column6: No! I think it's...some kind of code, but...

[2x]\s<$01>WHOA!![1x][br3]
[br3]
That ain't good.

column5:
大島の病院まで頼む。\n
すまんが、素子も一緒に行ってくれ
おれとメイで捜査を続ける。
column6: Get him to the hospital in Ohshima. Sorry, but you go with him, Motoko. Me and May will continue the investigation.

column5:
‥‥立花さんも、行かなくて
よかったの？
column6: ...Mr. Tachibana, is it really okay for you not to go?

column5:
おれは刑事だ。\n
‥どんな時も、事件解決を第一に目
指せ。あの人は‥そう教えてくれた
column6:
I'm a detective.\n
...Work toward solving the case at all times. That man...that's what he taught me.

column5:
さ、行くぞ。\n
渡部警部の残した暗号が、大きなカ
ギになっているはずだ。
column6:
Okay, let's go.\n
The code Inspector Watabe left should be a crucial key.

column5:
\c<$0C>壊れた信号\c<$0F>‥って、まさか‥
この無線機の事？
column6: The \c<$0C>broken signal\c<$0F>...Could he mean...this radio transceiver?

column5:
渡部さんが、この中に何かを
隠したんでしょうか？
column6: Could Mr. Watabe have hidden something in this?

column5: 開けてみるよ。
column6: I'll try opening it.

column5: 手紙‥ですね。
column6: It's...a letter.

column5:
この無線機に何かが隠されて
るの？
column6: Is something hidden in this radio transceiver?
column7: NOTE: alternate version of scene, shown if you keep selecting the "view code" option until navi gets fed up and just tells you the answer

column5: そう思いますよ。
column6: That's what I think.

column5:
\c<$0C>港のすぐ西\c<$0F>の浜辺が穴
場ですよ。
column6: The beach \c<$0C>just west of the harbor\c<$0F> is a hidden gem.

column5:
岩場で囲まれてまして
ちょっと分かりにくい所にあります
けど。
column6: It's surrounded by rocks and a little hard to spot, though.

column5:
三本岬ですか‥なるほどです
ねぇ。
column6: Threewood Cape...I see now.

column5:
どうやったら、こんなに奇妙
な形に育つんでしょう。
column6: I wonder what happened to make them grow in this bizarre shape?
column7: NOTE: dupe of 2971 except with period instead of question mark

column5: 順を追って説明しますね。
column6: I'll explain in order.

column5:
１：書き込む\c<$0C>地名\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で羽根を動かし、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を
押します。
column6: 1: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>place name\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
２：書き込む\c<$0C>場所\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で地図上の羽根を動かして、\c<$0B>
[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押します。
column6: 2: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>area\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
３：書き込みを\c<$0C>中止\c<$0F>する時は、\c<$0B>終了\c<$0F>
に羽根を合わせて\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押すか\c<$0B>
[II]ボタン\c<$0F>を押して下さい。
column6: 3: To \c<$0C>stop\c<$0F> filling in, move the feather to \c<$0B>Done\c<$0F> and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>, or press the \c<$0B>II Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
画面の下に表示される地名の
色は、次のような意味を持っていま
す。
column6: The place names displayed at the bottom of the screen have the following meanings.

column5: \c<$09>黄色\c<$0F>‥地名を書き込んでいない。
column6: \c<$09>Yellow:\c<$0F> You haven't filled in the place name.

column5:
\c<$08>緑色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ後。\n
正しいか否かが確認できていない。
column6: \c<$08>Green:\c<$0F> Filled in. Whether it's correct or not is unconfirmed.

column5:
\c<$0A>赤色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が、間違って
いる。
column6: \c<$0A>Red:\c<$0F> The location you filled in is incorrect.

column5: \c<$0F>白色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が正しかった
column6: \c<$0F>White:\c<$0F> The location you filled in was correct.

column5:
外に出た時に、ナビが地図を
表示します。
column6: When you leave, Navi will display the map.

column5:
画面上の羽根を、行きたい場
所にあわせて、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押してく
ださい。
column6: Move the on-screen feather to the place you want to go and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
四角形の\c<$0C>１辺は５００メート
ル\c<$0F>です。
column6: \c<$0C>One square\c<$0F> on the grid is \c<$0C>500 meters\c<$0F>.

column5:
柳　素子　（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
一時はどうなる事かと思ったけど、
疑いも晴らせて、本当によかったよ
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
I wasn't sure what was going to happen for a minute there. Thank goodness we got her cleared of suspicion.

column5:
立花　次郎　（たちばな　じろう）
刑事さん。実は綾華のお父さんだっ
たんだよね‥。
column6:
Jirou Tachibana\n
A police detective. So he was actually Ayaka's father...

column5:
朝霧　正臣　（あさぎり　まさみ）
温子さんの夫。新婚旅行で２つもの
事件に巻き込まれた不運の人。
column6:
Masami Aasagiri\n
Atsuko's husband. An unlucky man who's gotten caught up in two incidents on his honeymoon.

column5:
朝霧　温子　（あさぎり　あつこ）
正臣さんの奥さん。せっかくの新婚
旅行だったのに‥不幸な人だよね。
column6:
Atsuko Asagiri\n
Masami's wife. She'd finally gotten to go on her honeymoon, but now...What an unfortunate woman.

column5:
木原　尚子　（きはら　なおこ）\n
ハ虫類研究者。児島にいる珍種のヘ
ビを捕まえるのが目的なんだって。
column6:
Naoko Kihara\n
A reptile researcher. Says her goal is to capture rare snake species that are on Kojima.

column5:
渡部　吟次　（わたべ　ぎんじ）\n
児島の駐在さん。人当りのいい温厚
そうなおじいさん。
column6:
Ginji Watabe\n
Kojima's resident officer. Seems like an affable, mild-mannered old man.

column5:
老婆\n
鎌を振り回す、謎のお婆さん。あま
りお近付きにはなりたくないなぁ。
column6:
Old Woman\n
A mysterious old woman brandishing a sickle. I'd rather not get too close to her...

column5:
武藤　孝弘　（むとう　たかひろ）
被害者。立花さんの亡くなられた同
僚の、息子さんだったんだって。
column6:
Takahiro Mutou\n
The victim. Apparently, he was the son of Mr. Tachibana's deceased colleague.

column5:
榊　弘司　（さかき　こうじ）\n
児島ホテルのオーナー。\n
礼儀正しい紳士さん。
column6:
Kouji Sakaki\n
The owner of the Kojima Hotel.\n
A well-mannered gentleman.

column5:
\c<$0C>壊れた信号には、必ず意味が
ある\c<$0F>ですか‥。
column6: \c<$0C>In the broken signal, you will surely find meaning\c<$0F>, huh...

column5:
署名の部分には、意味なんて
ないと思いますよ。
column6: I don't think there's any significance to the signature part of it.

column5:
\c<$0C>壊れた信号\c<$0F>と\c<$0C>意味がある\c<$0F>に分
けられますね。
column6: We could split it up into \c<$0C>the broken signal\c<$0F> and \c<$0C>find meaning\c<$0F>, couldn't we?

column5:
\c<$0C>意味がある\c<$0F>。\n
つまり\c<$0C>壊れた信号に何か隠されてい
る\c<$0F>って事でしょう？
column6:
\c<$0C>Find meaning\c<$0F>.\n
In other words, it means \c<$0C>there's something hidden in a broken signal\c<$0F>, right?

column5: 問題は\c<$0C>壊れた信号\c<$0F>ですよね。
column6: The problem is the \c<$0C>broken signal\c<$0F>, isn't it?

column5:
\c<$0C>壊れた\c<$0F>が、文字どおりの意味
だとすると‥\c<$0C>信号\c<$0F>は？
column6: If we take `\c<$0C>broken\c<$0F>~ literally, then...the \c<$0C>signal\c<$0F> would be...?

てんぐいわ）\n
花コウ岩でできた巨岩塔。
column6:
Tengu Rock\n
An enormous rock tower made of granite.

column5:
海上からの高さは、１１．４ｍにも
達します。
column6: It extends 11.4 meters above sea level.

column5:
その昔、児島の天狗と大島の天狗が
力を競い合った時に、児島天狗が投
げた岩であると伝えられています。
岬の先端から、眺めることができま
す。
column6:
Legend tells that in ancient times, when the tengu of Kojima had a contest of might with the tengu of Ohshima, the Kojima tengu threw this rock.
[wait][clear]

You can look out upon it from the tip of the cape.

column5: ‥こっちは裏ですって。
column6: ...Hey, this is the back.

column5:
やこうどう）\n
夜光ゴケが自生する洞窟です。
column6:
Noctilucent Cave\n
A cave where noctilucent moss grows natively.

column5:
夜光ゴケはセン類に属するコケ植物
であり、発光する性質を持っている
珍しい植物です。
column6: Noctilucent moss is a bryophyte with the unusual property of emitting light.

column5:
発光のために微量元素を必要とする
ため、自生域は限られています。
column6: Because it requires micronutrients for the emission of light, its native range is limited.

column5:
夜光洞では、洞窟の奥に備えられた
スイッチで照明を消すことができま
す。
column6: In Noctilucent Cave, you can turn off the lights using the switch installed within the cave.

column5:
夜光ゴケと岩石に含まれる鉱物が闇
に放つ光が、幻想的な世界をつくり
あげます。
column6: The light given off by the noctilucent moss and the minerals in the rocks creates a fantastic world.

column5:
←照明用スイッチ\n
消した後は、必ずつけるようにして
ください。
column6:
[<-] Light Switch\n
After turning off, please be sure to turn back on.

column5:
へぇ、こんな所に浜辺があっ
たんだ。
column6: Ooh...So there's a beach somewhere like this.

column5:
周囲が岩場に囲まれてますか
ら、ちょっと見ただけでは分かりま
せんね。
column6: The surrounding area is enclosed by rocks, so you wouldn't know it at a glance.

column5:
この岩場の向こうが、港だよ
ね？
column6: So the harbor's on the other side of these rocks?

column5:
そうですよ。\n
‥とは言っても、この険しい岩場の
５００メートル先ですけどね。
column6:
That's right.\n
...Though it's 500 meters away over steep rock.

column5:
ロープですか？\n
海から流れ着いたんでしょうか。
column6:
Is that a rope?\n
Maybe it washed in from the sea.

column5:
ロープの端が岩場に結び付け
られてるからね。\n
誰かが結んだのは間違いないよ。
column6: The rope's end is attached to the rocks. Someone definitely tied it there.

column5:
ま、たいして意味はないだろ
うけどね。
column6: Oh well, I doubt there's really any significance to it.

column5:
ご用がございましたら
承ります。
column6: Should you need anything, I'll be right with you.

column5:
ご用がございましたら
承ります。
column6: Should you need anything, I'll be right with you.

column5:
\n
　　　　　ＣＬＯＳＥ
column6:
\n
#SETPADANDCENTER(0, 224)
CLOSED
#DISABLEPADANDCENTER()

column5:
古寺ですか？\n
いや、聞いたことがありませんね。
column6:
An old temple?\n
No, I've never heard of that.

column5:
‥でも、\c<$0C>山頂\c<$0F>からなら
児島が見渡せますからね。
column6: ...But you can look out over the entirety of Kojima from the \c<$0C>mountaintop\c<$0F>, you know.

column5:
もしかしたら、古寺が
見えるかもしれませんよ。
column6: Perhaps you'd be able to see this old temple.

column5:
山中の古寺でございま
すか。
column6: An old temple in the mountains?

column5:
申し訳ございませんが
私は存じておりません。
column6: I'm terribly sorry, but I don't know of that.

column5:
\c<$0C>東方の山の頂上\c<$0F>からな
らば、その場所も見えるのではない
でしょうか。
column6: You might be able to see it if you look from \c<$0C>the summit of the eastern mountain\c<$0F>.

column5:
いやぁ、場所を聞かれても‥
なにしろ道に迷っていた訳ですから
ね。
column6: Ah, even if you ask me where it was...I was lost at the time, you see.
column7: NOTE: here's an odd bug i turned up: for some reason, the script that this message is associated with resets the flag that indicates that you've had the encounter with sakaki at the old temple. so, after going through the raft minigame and arriving at the harbor, if you run to the fifth floor of the hotel, ask masami about the old temple, and then go back to the temple, the whole event with sakaki attacking the old woman will play out again. but since tachibana's no longer in your "party", the game will hang at the point where he's supposed to chase after sakaki (unless the timer runs out  before it happens, in which case you get the normal game over). not surprised they missed this one, considering how out of your way you have to go for it.

column5:
残念ながら、古寺の場所まで
は分からないんですよ。
column6: I'm sorry, but I don't actually know where the old temple is.

column5:
‥‥いや、そういえば‥\c<$0C>寺の
側に川\c<$0F>がありましたね。
column6: ...But come to think of it...there was \c<$0C>a river to the side of the temple\c<$0F>.

column5:
\c<$0C>港のすぐ西\c<$0F>の浜辺が穴
場ですよ。
column6: The beach \c<$0C>just west of the harbor\c<$0F> is a hidden gem.

column5:
岩場で囲まれてまして
ちょっと分かりにくい所にあります
けど。
column6: It's surrounded by rocks and a little hard to spot, though.

column5:
三本岬ですか‥なるほどです
ねぇ。
column6: Threewood Cape...I see now.

column5:
どうやったら、こんなに奇妙
な形に育つんでしょう。
column6: I wonder what happened to make them grow in this bizarre shape?

column5:
申し訳ないのですが、
ここは、お通しできません。
column6: I'm very sorry, but I'm afraid coming back here isn't permitted.

column5:
なんとか、中を捜索できない
んですか？
column6: Can't we search inside somehow?

column5:
捜査令状もないのにか？\n
そりゃムリだ。
column6: Without a warrant? Not happening.

column5:
今回は、あまり目立つわけに
はいかない事は分かるだろう？
column6: You understand we can't stick out too much this time, right?

column5:
古寺の事　　　　榊の事\n
フロント嬢の事　老婆の事\n
浜辺の事　　　　立ち去る
column6:
Old temple
[sp]<$70>
Sakaki
\n

The receptionist
[sp]<$70>
The old woman
\n

Beach
[sp]<$70>
Leave

column5:
出かけたきり帰ってき
てませんね。
column6: He left and hasn't returned since.

column5:
‥ところでですね。\n
昨日の夜、支配人は\c<$0C>全身びしょ濡れ
で帰ってきた\c<$0F>んですよ。
column6:
...Oh, and by the way.\n
Yesterday evening, the manager \c<$0C>came back here soaked head to toe\c<$0F>.

column5: そ、それ本当ですか?!
column6: I-is that true!?

column5:
え、ええ。支配人に口
止めされてたんですけど‥。
column6: Y-yes. He made me keep quiet about it, but...

column5:
雨も降らなかったし、
昨日の事件の事もありましてね。\n
気になってたんですよ。
column6: It didn't rain, and there was that incident yesterday, too. It's been bothering me.

column5:
いや、急に休暇をとっ
たみたいでしてね。
column6: Well, apparently, she abruptly took time off.

column5:
私が、突然フロントに
入る事になってしまったんですよ。
column6: I ended up having to suddenly take over the front desk.

column5:
老婆？\n
誰の事です？
column6: Old woman? Who do you mean?

column5:
ただ今、外出しており
ます。
column6: He went out just now.

column5:
申し訳ありませんが、
行き先は存じておりません。
column6: I'm terribly sorry, but I don't know where he went.

column5:
ああ、彼女でしたら、
今日は休暇を頂いております。
column6: Oh, her? She's taken the day off.

column5:
は？‥‥老婆？\n
いや、私は知りませんが‥‥？
column6:
Huh?...Old woman?\n
No, I don't know of her...?
column7: NOTE: almost dupe of F3101, except with いえ changed to いや

column5:
児島の西岸は、絶好の
海水浴場でございます。\n
きれいな浜辺が続いてますよ。
column6: Kojima's west coast is an ideal swimming spot. The beautiful beaches stretch on and on.

column5:
ご、ごめんなさ〜いっ！\n
ちょ、ちょっと、今は手が離せない
の!!
column6:
S-SORRY!\n
I-I've kinda got my hands full!

column5:
ああ、メイさん。\n
どうしたんです？
column6:
Oh, May.\n
What is it?

column5:
古寺の事　　　　榊の事\n
朝霧夫妻の事　　浜辺の事\n
立ち去る
column6:
Old temple
[sp]<$70>
Sakaki
\n

The Asagiris
[sp]<$70>
Beach
\n

Leave

column5:
榊の事　　　　　朝霧夫妻の事\n
浜辺の事　　　　立ち去る
column6:
Sakaki
[sp]<$70>
The Asagiris
\n

Beach
[sp]<$70>
Leave

column5:
え？そういえば‥、ホテルに
帰ってきてからは支配人さんの姿を
見てませんね。
column6: Huh? Well, now that you mention it...I haven't seen the hotel's manager since we got back.

column5: いやぁ、参りました。
column6: Ah, I'm beat.

column5:
妻と天狗岩まで行ってきたん
ですがね、帰りに道に迷ってしまい
まして。
column6: My wife and I went to Tengu Rock, but on the way back, we got lost.

column5:
さんざん歩いたあげく、古い
寺の様な所に出たんですよ。
column6: After some miserable hiking, we ended up at a place that looked like an old temple.

column5:
それでもやっぱり場所が分か
らなくて、もう‥ひたすら歩き続け
ましたよ。
column6: Of course, we still didn't know where we were, so we just doggedly walked on.

column5:
先ほど、ようやく戻ってきた
んですが、妻なんか、疲れ果てて眠
り込んでしまう有様ですよ。
column6: We finally got back just a little while ago, but she's all tired out and sound asleep.

column5:
いや、とにかく歩きっぱなし
で。しかも、山の中ですからね。\n
本当に疲れましたよ。
column6: Ah, man, we just kept on walking and walking. And it was in the mountains, too. I really am exhausted.

column5:
いや、お誘いしておきながら
本当に申し訳ないんですが。
column6: Ah, I'd lead you there, but...I really am sorry.

column5:
妻が倒れ込んでしまったので
今日は行けそうにないんですよ。
column6: My wife's fallen over exhausted, so it seems we can't go today.

column5:
ぼくらが行ってきた浜辺なら\c<$0C>
港の側\c<$0F>にありましたよ。
column6: If you mean the beach we went to, it's \c<$0C>next to the harbor\c<$0F>.

column5:
岩場に囲まれている場所です
から、ちょっと分かりにくいかも知
れませんが。
column6: It's an area surrounded by rocks, so it may be a little hard to spot, though.

column5:
謹啓\n
きみ達がこの手紙を目にしている時
には、私はこの世にいないでしょう
column6:
To whom it may concern,\n
If you are reading this letter, I have probably departed this world.

column5:
既に察しているかもしれませんが、
私も、榊も、『組織』の一員です。
column6: Perhaps you have already guessed, but both Sakaki and I are members of the Syndicate.

column5:
メイくんに教えた三本岬の洞窟は、
『組織』が今後の取り引きに用いる
品を保管しておく為の倉庫。
column6: The cave in Threewood Cape, which I told Miss May of, is a warehouse which the Syndicate uses to store goods for future dealings.

column5:
保管されているのは、警察が押収し
横流しされた品がほとんどです。
column6: The stored items are almost all articles seized by the police that have been diverted into unlawful channels.

column5:
私も‥警察にいた頃は、『組織』の
一員として押収された麻薬や拳銃な
どを横流ししていたのです。
column6: When I was in the police, I, too...I illegally diverted confiscated drugs and guns as a member of the Syndicate.
column7: NOTE: i always love these video game letters where the writer apparently took the time to write in dramatic ellipses for effect

column5: そして７年前。
column6: And seven years ago...

column5:
当時、私の部下であった武藤刑事が
殺されたのも私が情報を流したのが
‥原因です。
column6: The cause of my subordinate Detective Mutou's murder then was...information that I leaked.

column5:
その事件以後は、榊と共に保管され
ている物資を監視する役目につき、
島の駐在として暮らしてきました。
column6: Since that incident, I, together with Sakaki, have served as a guard for the stored goods, living as the island's resident officer.

column5:
しかし‥その生活も、今日で終りに
します。
column6: However...I end that life today.

column5:
殺された村野くんこそが‥。\n
７年前、私が殺した武藤刑事の実の
息子であると知った時‥。
column6: When I learned that the murdered young Murano was actually the son of Detective Mutou, whom I killed seven years ago...

column5:
そして、あの老婆こそが武藤刑事の
母親であると悟った時‥。
column6: And when I realized that that old woman was Detective Mutou's mother...

column5:
自分の死を迎える時がきたのだと‥
そう感じたのです。
column6: I sensed that the time had come...to face my own death.

column5:
最後に‥勝手な願いとは思いますが
老婆を助けてあげて欲しいのです。
column6: Lastly...Though it may be a selfish request, I want you to help the old woman.

column5:
彼女は、以前『組織』の倉庫であっ
た山中の古寺に隠れ住んでいる事が
分かっております。
column6: I have learned that she is secretly living in the old temple in the mountains, which was formerly a Syndicate warehouse.

column5:
『組織』は老婆の命も狙うでしょう
せめて‥せめて、これ以上の犠牲者
が出ないように。
column6: The Syndicate will probably target her life as well. At least...at least try to prevent there from being any more victims.

column5:
お願い致します。\n
　　　　　　　　敬白\n
　　　　　　　　　　　渡部　吟次
column6:
I humbly ask this of you.\n
#SETPADANDCENTER(88, 112)
Sincerely,\n
#SETPADANDCENTER(136, 72)
Ginji Watabe
#DISABLEPADANDCENTER()

column5: なんてこった‥‥‥。
column6: Good god...

column5:
‥‥複雑な事件ですね。\n
とにかく、お婆さんのいる場所が分
かったんです。
column6:
...What a complicated case.\n
In any event, we've found out where the old woman is.

column5:
今は放心している場合じゃあ
りませんよ！
column6: This is no time to let our minds wander!

column5:
ふぅ‥そうだね。\n
古寺の場所を突き止めなくちゃね。
column6:
Whew...Right.\n
We have to work out where the old temple is.

column5:
それから、事件の内容をナビ
なりにまとめてみました。
column6: To that end, Navi has made her own summary of the facts of the case.

column5:
\c<$0B>事件整理\c<$0F>のコマンドを実行し
てみて下さいね。
column6: Try using the \c<$0B>Case Summary\c<$0F> command.
column7: NOTE: literally more like "case organization" or "case [with the facts] sorted" -- there's not a great english word for the idea being expressed

column5:
銃器、麻薬、情報、盗掘品な
どの不当な取り引きで利益を得てい
る『組織』です。
column6: There is a `Syndicate~ reaping profits from unlawful dealings in guns, drugs, information, stolen artifacts, and so on.
column7:
NOTE: "information" has not actually been specifically mentioned as part of the syndicate's trade before now. i guess this is an assumption from finding the oruka data in the warehouse.

also, i have no idea what the purpose of this summary is; there is nothing here that will actually help you progress through what little remains of the scenario.

column5:
今回の一連の事件に、常に何
らかの形で関わっていました。
column6: This series of incidents has constantly been connected to it.

column5:
また警察内部に『組織』に関
与する者がいる事も、見逃せない事
実です。
column6: It's also an inescapable fact that there are people within the police who are active in the Syndicate.

column5:
昨夜、夜光洞にて青年の死体
が発見されました。\n
第一発見者は、素子です。
column6: Yesterday evening, the body of a young man was found in the Noctilucent Cave. The initial discoverer was Motoko.

column5:
被害者の名前は、武藤孝弘。
１９才でした。
column6: The victim's name was Takahiro Mutou. He was 19 years old.

column5:
死因は、腹部に受けた傷害か
ら出血多量によるショック死とされ
ています。
column6: The cause of death is believed to be shock resulting from major blood loss due to a wound in the abdomen.

column5:
７年前に『組織』に殺された
武藤刑事の息子さんです。
column6: He was the son of Detective Mutou, who was killed by the Syndicate seven years ago.

column5:
復讐を果たすために、独自に
『組織』を調査していました。
column6: He was independently investigating the Syndicate in order to take revenge.

column5:
犯人は、榊弘司と判明してい
ます。
column6: We've established that the culprit was Kouji Sakaki.

column5:
児島ホテルの支配人であり、
同時に『組織』の一員でもありまし
た。
column6: He was both the manager of the Kojima Hotel and a member of the Syndicate.

column5:
『組織』の事を調査していた
武藤青年の存在を知り、彼を殺害し
たものと思われます。
column6: We think that he learned of the existence of the younger Mutou, who was investigating the Syndicate, and murdered him.

column5:
本日、天狗岩にて、なんらか
の事件の痕跡が見つかりました。
column6: Today, at Tengu Rock, signs of some sort of incident were discovered.

column5:
被害者は、なんらかの傷害を
受けた上、崖下に転落したと思われ
ます。
column6: We believe that the victim, in addition to receiving a wound of some description, fell to the bottom of a cliff.

column5:
また現場には、被害者のもの
と思われる遺留品が残されていまし
た。
column6: We also discovered that personal effects which we think to be the victim's were left at the crime scene.

column5:
遺留品から、被害者は榊弘司
と推測されます。
column6: From his effects, we've hypothesized that the victim was Kouji Sakaki.

column5:
死体は発見されていません。
従って死因も判明していません。
column6: The body hasn't been found. Thus, the cause of death has yet to be determined either.

column5:
榊は、武藤青年を殺害した犯
人でもあります。
column6: Sakaki is also the culprit behind the murder of the younger Mutou.

column5:
犯人に関する手がかりは、一
切ありません。
column6: We have no clues relating to the culprit whatsoever.

column5:
本日、天狗岩にて、渡部元警
部が傷害を受けて、倒れているのが
発見されました。
column6: Today, at Tengu Rock, former inspector Ginji Watabe was found collapsed with an abdominal wound.

column5:
意識はありませんでしたが、
渡部元警部の傷は、幸いにも致命傷
を免れていました。
column6: Though he was unconscious, former inspector Watabe's wound was fortunately not so severe as to be fatal.

column5:
現在、大島の病院にて治療中
です。
column6: At present, he is being treated at the hospital on Ohshima.

column5:
また、渡部元警部が『組織』
の一員であった事。
column6: Additionally, former inspector Watabe was a member of the Syndicate.

column5:
そして７年前に、部下だった
武藤刑事を殺害するために、情報を
流していた事も判明しています。
column6: Furthermore, we have established that seven years ago, he leaked information in order to murder his subordinate Detective Mutou.

column5:
凶器など一切の証拠がなく、
また、自殺か他殺かも判明しており
ません。
column6: We have no proof as to the weapon or the like, and we have not established whether it was suicide or murder.

column5:
老婆が、７年前に殉職した武
藤刑事の母親である事。
column6: The old woman is the mother of Detective Mutou, who was murdered seven years ago.

column5:
すなわち、夜光洞で殺害され
た武藤青年の祖母である事が判明し
ています。
column6: That is, we have established her to be the grandmother of the younger Mutou, who was murdered at the Noctilucent Cave.

column5:
孫の武藤青年と共に『組織』
を調査していたと考えられます。
column6: We believe that she was investigating the Syndicate together with the younger Mutou, her grandson.

column5:
現在は、児島の古寺にて、密
かに暮らしている事が分かっていま
す。
column6: We have learned that at present, she is living in an old temple on Kojima in secret.

column5: よ、ようやく着きましたね‥
column6: W-we're finally here...

column5:
着いたのはいいんだけどね。
‥‥周りは木ばっかりで、何にも見
えないよ。
column6: I'm glad we made it and all...but there's a ton of trees around, and I can't see anything.

column5:
ひときわ高い木があるじゃな
いか。
column6: There's a particularly tall tree over there, isn't there?

column5:
あれに登れば、天国の様に美
しい景色をおがめるぞ。
column6: Climb that, and you'll be able to look out over the beautiful scenery as if from heaven.

column5:
‥‥ほんとの天国に行くのは
イヤなんだけどなぁ。
column6: Hey, I'd rather not go to heaven for real here...

column5:
それじゃ、メイ。気をつけて
登るんだぞ。
column6: Well, May, good luck climbing that thing.

column5:
ちょ、ちょっと！\n
立花さん、男でしょ?!
column6:
H-hey!\n
Mr. Tachibana, aren't you a man!?

column5:
なんでボクが登らなくちゃい
けないの！
column6: Why do _I_ have to climb it!?

column5:
自慢じゃないが、子供の頃か
ら木登りはダメでな。\n
すまんが、よろしく頼むぜ。
column6: Hate to say it, but I've been a rotten tree climber since I was a kid. Sorry, but it's up to you.
...Seriously?
[3x]\s<$01>GAAAAAAH![1x]

column5: な、なに?!
column6: Wh-what!?

column5: く、もう来たのですか。
column6: Kh...You're here already?

column5:
おやおや、何故そのような恐い
顔をなさるのですかな？お客様。
column6: Oh, dear, why are you making such a ferocious face...my honored guests?

column5:
そう‥。\n
そういう事だったんだ‥。
column6:
So...\n
So that's how it was...

column5:
『組織』の秘密を守るために
武藤さんを殺し‥。
column6: You killed Mutou to protect the Syndicate's secrets...

column5:
ボク達の捜査をかわすために
自分が死んだように見せかける。
column6: To escape our investigation, you made it look like you'd died.

column5:
天狗岩にあった遺留品は全て
ありもしない事件を演出するための
ものだったんだ‥。
column6: The remains at Tengu Rock were all there to stage a nonexistent incident...

column5:
やれやれ、『組織』の事まで、
よく調べましたね。
column6: Good grief, so you've even found out about the Syndicate.

column5:
やはり渡部を殺しそこねたのが
失敗でしたかね。
column6: How remiss I was in failing to finish off Watabe.

column5:
きさまか！\n
きさまが、渡部警部を‥‥‥！
column6:
YOU!\n
You attacked Inspector Watabe...!

column5:
あなたも妙な人ですね。\n
渡部こそ、あなた達を裏切っていた
当人なんですよ。
column6: Such a strange man you are. Watabe was the one that betrayed you.

column5:
感謝されてもいいと思っている
のですがね。
column6: I'd think a little gratitude would be in order.

column5:
さて、こんな所で時間をつぶし
ているヒマはないのです。
column6: Now then, I haven't the time to while away the hours here.

column5:
『組織』にとっては、この島の
倉庫が見つかったところで、たいし
た痛手にはなりません。
column6: That the warehouse on this island was discovered is no great loss to the Syndicate.

column5:
私は、逃げる事にさせていただ
きますよ。
column6: I'll be making my escape now, if you don't mind.

column5: 逃がすか!!
column6: _LIKE HELL!_

column5: メイ、お婆さんを頼む！
column6: May, help the old woman!

column5: ‥む、無念じゃ。
column6: A-alas...

column5:
息子の‥息子の仇もとれず‥
ま、孫の命まで失ってしもうた‥。
column6: My son...without taking revenge for my son...e-even my grandson has lost his life...

column5:
わ、わしも‥ここで、朽ち果
てるのが‥運命か‥‥。
column6: I-is it my fate, too...to rot away here...?

column5:
ちょ、\n
冗談じゃないよ！
column6: Hey, don't joke around!

column5:
こんな所で力つきるわけ?!\n
武藤刑事もお孫さんが殺されたのも
みんな『組織』が悪いんじゃない！
column6: Are you going to give up NOW!? Detective Mutou and your grandson's deaths were all because of the Syndicate, weren't they!?

column5:
渡部さんに償わせるんじゃな
かったの?!\n
榊を逃がしてもいいの?!!!
column6: Aren't you going to make Mr. Watabe atone!? Are you fine with letting Sakaki get away!?

column5:
そ、そうじゃ‥な。\n
このままでは死にきれんわ！
column6:
Y-you're...right.\n
I can't go dying like this!

column5:
榊めは、この辺りの地理に、
よう通じとる。
column6: That damn Sakaki knows the terrain 'round here.

column5:
残念じゃが、立花とやらは榊
に追い付けんじゃろう。
column6: Sadly, this Tachibana fellow's not gonna be able to catch him.

column5: そ、それでは‥‥。
column6: Th-then...

column5:
心配はいらん。\n
こんな事もあろうかとな、裏にイカ
ダを用意してある。
column6:
Don't you worry.\n
I thought this might happen, so I've readied a raft.
column7: NOTE: こんな事もあろうかと is a rather notorious line and memetic line associated with the cliche of e.g. the "professor" character on a sci-fi show suddenly pulling out a new weapon that serves to perfectly counteract the enemy's evil scheme for the episode. this was already an established joke by at least the early-mid '90s, so its use here is almost certainly deliberate.

column5:
イカダで川を下れば、港まで
はすぐじゃ。\n
さ、さ、ぐずぐずしておれんぞ！
column6: If we float the raft on the river, we'll go straight to the harbor. Come, come[nbsp]-- can't be dawdling, now!

column5:
もう、立花さんの姿も見えま
せん。\n
とうてい追い付けませんね。
column6: I can't even see Mr. Tachibana now. There's no way we'll be able to catch up to him, is there?

column5:
そ、外に出るんですか?!\n
とうてい追い付けませんから、榊が
逃げちゃいますよ！
column6:
A-are you LEAVING!?\n
We'll never be able to catch up, and Sakaki will get away!
column7:
NOTE: attempting to leave the old temple the way you came in.
and oh wow, they actually let you do it if you want, and there's even a game over sequence for it! with dialogue! more work for me!

column5:
さて、それでは行くぞ！\n
ちと手伝ってくれい。
column6: Okay, let's go! Lend me a hand.

column5:
な、何やってるんですか!!\n
イカダが流されちゃったじゃないで
すかぁ！
column6:
Wh-what're you doing!?\n
The raft's been swept away!

column5:
っ‥うむぐぅ‥‥こ、腰を傷
めてしもうた。\n
もう、ダメじゃ‥‥。
column6: Gh...mghhh...I've gone and hurt my back. It's all over...

column5:
そんな‥そんな事ないよ!!\n
まだ手はあるはずだよ。\n
お婆ちゃんは、ここで待ってて！
column6:
No...No it's not!\n
There should still be a way. Wait here, please!

column5:
まだ速度が出ていません。\n
川沿いに走れば、イカダに追い付け
るかもしれません。
column6: It hasn't picked up speed yet. If you run along the river, you may be able to catch the raft.

column5:
あ、ああああ!!\n
イカダが行っちゃったぁ。\n
もぅ、間に合わないよぉ！
column6:
Ah, aaaaaah!\n
The raft got away. We'll never make it in time now!

column5:
着いた‥‥けど、誰もいない
よぉ？
column6: We made it...but no one's here?

column5:
距離から考えても、まだ児島
の外には逃げてないはずです。
column6: Thinking purely in terms of distance, he shouldn't have been able to make it off Kojima yet.

column5:
という事は、港以外の所から
逃げるつもりかな？
column6: So he's planning to escape from somewhere other than the harbor?

column5:
ともかく、そんなに時間はな
いはずです。
column6: Whatever the case, we probably don't have very much time.

column5:
榊が、どこから逃げようとし
てるのか‥。\n
その場所に急ぎましょう！
column6: Where is Sakaki going to try to make his getaway...? Let's hurry to that place!
[3x]\s<$01>SAKAKI![1x]

column5:
これは、これは。\n
よく追いつけたものですね。
column6: Oh me, oh my. How remarkable of you to be able to chase me down.

column5:
ですが、この私を捕まえる事が
出来ますかね？
column6: But can you catch _me_, I wonder?

column5: 捕まえてみせるっ！
column6: I damn well can!

column5:
ははは、私の優秀な秘書を、ご
紹介いたしますよ。\n
射撃の腕も抜群な秘書をね。
column6: Ha-ha-ha! Allow me to introduce my esteemed secretary. Her marksmanship is quite excellent, isn't it?

column5:
このボートを手配したのも、彼
女なんですよ。
column6: She was the one who prepared this boat, too.

column5: そんな‥まさか！
column6: No...No way!

column5:
ふふ、ずいぶん驚いて
いる様子だけど、そんなに意外だっ
たかしらね？
column6: Heh-heh. You seem so surprised, but was it really that unexpected?

column5:
さて、動かないでね。
そうすれば、苦しまないようにして
あげるから。
column6: Now then, hold still, won't you? If you do, I'll try to make sure you don't suffer.

column5: バイバイ。
column6: Bye-bye.

column5: メイ！逃げてください!!
column6: May! GET AWAY!!

column5: 間にあった様だな。
column6: Looks like I made it in time.

column5:
ぐ‥‥って、あれ？\n
[expr]<$01>痛くない？
column6:
Gh...uh, huh?\n
[expr]<$01>It doesn't hurt?
column7:
NOTE: dodging in this scene is actually meaningless; tachibana shoots the receptionist and may comes out fine regardless of your actions, though you get this extra message if you don't do anything.

also, by accident or design, this line doesn't turn on lip flaps.

column5:
セーブ　　　　　人物\n
設定　　　　　　地図\n
事件整理　　　　コマンド終了

column6: Saved.

\n

Voices

column5: 白の台本
column6: White Script[sp]<$4A>

column5: 赤の台本
column6: Red Script[sp]<$94>

column6: Blue Script[br3]

column6: Green Script[sp]<$4A>

column5: 黒の台本
column6: Black Script[sp]<$94>

column5: セーブしない
column6: Don't save

column5: セーブできませんでした。
column6: Unable to save.

地名を書き込む\n
説明を聞く\n

\n

\n

書き込み方法　　地名の色について
移動方法　　　　地図の縮尺\n
戻る
column6:
How to fill in
[sp]<$70>
About name color
\n

How to move
[sp]<$70>
Map scale
\n

Back

column5: 順を追って説明しますね。
column6: I'll explain in order.

column5:
１：書き込む\c<$0C>地名\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で羽根を動かし、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を
押します。
column6: 1: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>place name\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
２：書き込む\c<$0C>場所\c<$0F>を指すように、\c<$0B>十
字キー\c<$0F>で地図上の羽根を動かして、\c<$0B>
[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押します。
column6: 2: Use the \c<$0B>D-Pad\c<$0F> to move the feather so it points to the \c<$0C>area\c<$0F> to fill in, and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
３：書き込みを\c<$0C>中止\c<$0F>する時は、\c<$0B>終了\c<$0F>
に羽根を合わせて\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押すか\c<$0B>
[II]ボタン\c<$0F>を押して下さい。
column6: 3: To \c<$0C>stop\c<$0F> filling in, move the feather to \c<$0B>Done\c<$0F> and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>, or press the \c<$0B>II Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
画面の下に表示される地名の
色は、次のような意味を持っていま
す。
column6: The place names displayed at the bottom of the screen have the following meanings.

column5: \c<$09>黄色\c<$0F>‥地名を書き込んでいない。
column6: \c<$09>Yellow:\c<$0F> You haven't filled in the place name.

column5:
\c<$08>緑色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ後。\n
正しいか否かが確認できていない。
column6: \c<$08>Green:\c<$0F> Filled in. Whether it's correct or not is unconfirmed.

column5:
\c<$0A>赤色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が、間違って
いる。
column6: \c<$0A>Red:\c<$0F> The location you filled in is incorrect.

column5: \c<$0F>白色\c<$0F>‥書き込んだ場所が正しかった
column6: \c<$0F>White:\c<$0F> The location you filled in was correct.

column5:
外に出た時に、ナビが地図を
表示します。
column6: When you leave, Navi will display the map.

column5:
画面上の羽根を、行きたい場
所にあわせて、\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押してく
ださい。
column6: Move the on-screen feather to the place you want to go and press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
四角形の\c<$0C>１辺は５００メート
ル\c<$0F>です。
column6: \c<$0C>One square\c<$0F> on the grid is \c<$0C>500 meters\c<$0F>.

column5:
柳　素子　（やなぎ　もとこ）\n
一時はどうなる事かと思ったけど、
疑いも晴らせて、本当によかったよ
column6:
Motoko Yanagi\n
I wasn't sure what was going to happen for a minute there. Thank goodness we got her cleared of suspicion.

column5:
立花　次郎　（たちばな　じろう）
刑事さん。実は綾華のお父さんだっ
たんだよね‥。
column6:
Jirou Tachibana\n
A police detective. So he was actually Ayaka's father...

column5:
朝霧　正臣　（あさぎり　まさみ）
温子さんの夫。新婚旅行で２つもの
事件に巻き込まれた不運の人。
column6:
Masami Aasagiri\n
Atsuko's husband. An unlucky man who's gotten caught up in two incidents on his honeymoon.

column5:
朝霧　温子　（あさぎり　あつこ）
正臣さんの奥さん。せっかくの新婚
旅行だったのに‥不幸な人だよね。
column6:
Atsuko Asagiri\n
Masami's wife. She'd finally gotten to go on her honeymoon, but now...What an unfortunate woman.

column5:
木原　尚子　（きはら　なおこ）\n
ハ虫類研究者。児島にいる珍種のヘ
ビを捕まえるのが目的なんだって。
column6:
Naoko Kihara\n
A reptile researcher. Says her goal is to capture rare snake species that are on Kojima.

column5:
渡部　吟次　（わたべ　ぎんじ）\n
児島の駐在さん。人当りのいい温厚
そうなおじいさん。
column6:
Ginji Watabe\n
Kojima's resident officer. Seems like an affable, mild-mannered old man.

column5:
武藤　ミネ　（むとう　みね）\n
鎌婆さんの正体は、亡くなった武藤
青年のお婆さんだったんだよね。
column6:
Mine Mutou\n
So the sickle woman's true identity was the grandmother of the deceased younger Mutou.
column7: NOTE: her name isn't actually given at any point in the dialogue, so i guess may is just psychic

column5:
武藤　孝弘　（むとう　たかひろ）
被害者。立花さんの亡くなられた同
僚の、息子さんだったんだって。
column6:
Takahiro Mutou\n
The victim. Apparently, he was the son of Mr. Tachibana's deceased colleague.

column5:
榊　弘司　（さかき　こうじ）\n
児島ホテルのオーナー。‥で、武藤
さんを殺した犯人。
column6:
Kouji Sakaki\n
The owner of the Kojima hotel. ...And the criminal who murdered Mutou.

column5:
手紙を見る　　　組織について\n
青年の事件　　　榊の事件\n
渡部の事件　　　老婆について
column6:
Look at the letter
[sp]<$70>
About the Syndicate
\n

Young man incident
[sp]<$70>
Sakaki incident
\n

Watabe incident
[sp]<$70>
About the old woman

column5:
事件の概要　　　被害者について\n
犯人について　　やめる

Case outline
[sp]<$70>
About the victim
\n

About the culprit
[sp]<$70>
Quit

column5:
素子　　　立花　　　正臣\n
温子　　　木原　　　老婆\n
渡部　　　青年　　　榊
column6:
Motoko
[sp]<$4A>
Tachibana
[sp]<$94>
Masami
\n

Atsuko
[sp]<$4A>
Kihara
[sp]<$94>
Old Woman
\n

Watabe
[sp]<$4A>
Young Man
[sp]<$94>
Sakaki

column5: マどルど。ど[3x]な

な、なんか‥とんでもない場
所に来てしまいましたね。\n
まるで迷路ですよ。
column6: S-somehow...we've ended up in a pretty wacky place. It's like a maze.

column5:
かと言って、今さら引き返せ
ないよ。
column6: Still, there's no turning back now.

column5:
とりあえず、\c<$0C>右手奥\c<$0F>に見える\c<$0C>
イカダ\c<$0F>まで行ってみようよ。
column6: For now, why don't we head for that \c<$0C>raft\c<$0F> we can see on \c<$0C>the far right-hand side\c<$0F>?

column5:
はぁ‥そうですね。\n
でも、海に落ちないように慎重に行
動して下さいよ。
column6:
(sigh)...Right.\n
But please move carefully so you don't fall in the ocean.

column5:
どうにもならなくなったら、\c<$0C>
海に飛び込んで\c<$0F>頭を冷やすのもいい
かもしれませんけど。
column6: Though if things get hopeless, maybe \c<$0C>jumping in the sea\c<$0F> to cool your head would be a good idea.

column5:
う‥\n
\s<$01>[2x]わあぁぁぁ?!
column6:
Uh...[br3]
\s<$01>[2x]WAAAAUGH!?[1x]

column5:
びっくりしたぁ。\n
気をつけてくださいね。間違って海
に落ちる危険もありますよ。
column6:
You gave me a fright.\n
Please be careful. You could mess up and fall in the ocean.

column5:
なるほど‥イカダは\c<$0C>進行方向
にまっすぐ\c<$0F>進むんですね。
column6: Ah-ha...So the rafts will keep going \c<$0C>straight along the direction of movement\c<$0F>.

column5:
方向も変えられないし、戻る
事もできないみたいです。
column6: It looks like you can't change the direction or make them go back.

column5:
あ、危なかったぁ。\n
もう少しで落ちるとこだったよ。
column6:
Ah! That was close.\n
I almost fell in.

column5:
ハスは軽いんですよ。\n
乗る前に、向こう岸まで流れていっ
てしまいますね。
column6:
The lotuses are light.\n
They'll float away to the opposite bank before you can climb on them.
column7: NOTE: the text says "lotus", though i'm sure any english speaker playing the game would call them "lilypads"

column5:
ふ〜ん‥ハスが流れない様に\c<$0C>
障害物\c<$0F>でもあれば、乗れるかもしれ
ないね。
column6: Hmm...If there was an \c<$0C>obstacle\c<$0F> there so they wouldn't move, I might be able to get on top of them.

column5: ‥‥大丈夫みたいだね。
column6: ...Looks like it's all right.
column7: NOTE: message you get if the first time you step onto a lotus is done in such a way that it won't float off

column5:
そっかぁ‥。\n
この方法じゃ行けそうにないねぇ。
column6:
Oh...\n
It doesn't look like we'll be able to get there by doing that.
column7: NOTE: if you mess up, it was all just may's imagination. if you get it right, she was doing it for real. perfectly sensible! also, what's the point? can may not swim or something?

column5:
想像でよかったですよね。\n
本番だったら、今ごろはずぶ濡れで
すよ。
column6: Good thing it was just your imagination. If you'd done it for real, you'd be soaked now.

column5: ぐ‥まだ、あるのね。
column6: Gah...So there's more.

column5:
もう１回ぐらい覚悟しておい
た方がいいような気がします。
column6: I have a feeling you should brace yourself for another round or so of this.

column5:
とにかく、\c<$0C>右手奥の通路\c<$0F>を目
指しましょう。
column6: Anyway, let's aim for \c<$0C>the passage on the far right-hand side\c<$0F>.

column5:
うぅ‥。船頭さん、待ってて
くれてるかなぁ‥‥。
column6: Ooh...I wonder if the ferryman's waiting for me...

column5:
メイ、何を弱気になってるん
ですか。\n
さ、\c<$0C>奥の通路\c<$0F>をめざしますよ。
column6: May, why are you getting so subdued? All right, head for the \c<$0C>inner passage\c<$0F>.

column5: あっれぇ？
column6: Huuuh?

column5:
‥道に迷いましたかね。\n
既に戻ろうにも戻れませんよ。
column6:
...Gotten lost, have you?\n
It's too late to turn back now.

column5:
う〜、このまま先に進むしか
ないか。
column6: Ugh...So forging on ahead is our only option.

column5:
かなり深い穴だね‥。\n
どうやって降りようか？
column6:
That's a pretty deep hole...\n
I wonder what I could do to get down it?

column5:
この穴には、丈夫そうな\c<$0C>ツル\c<$0F>
が、かかってますからね。\n
それをつたって降りましょう。
column6: There's a tough-looking \c<$0C>vine\c<$0F> hanging from the hole. Climb down along that.

column5:
このツルを、他の穴にかけれ
ば、その穴も\c<$0C>上り下りができる\c<$0F>よう
になるね。
column6: If we hung this vine from another hole, we'd \c<$0C>be able to climb up and down\c<$0F> that hole too, right?

column5:
そうですねぇ‥。\n
\c<$0B>[I]ボタンでツルを取ったり、かけた
り\c<$0F>しましょうか。
column6:
That's right...\n
Why don't you \c<$0B>use the I Button to take and leave them\c<$0F>?

column5:
メイ、気をつけてください！
落し穴に落ちたら、死んじゃいます
よ！
column6:
May, watch out!\n
You'll die if you fall in a pit!
column7: NOTE: you can't actually fall in a hole and die. what do you think this is, a sierra game?

column5:
欲ばっちゃいけませんよ。\n
もうツルを持ってるじゃないですか
column6:
Don't be greedy.\n
You're already holding a vine, aren't you?

column5:
ナビのホログラム装置を使っ
て、地図を映像化してみました。\n
現在地にはメイ人形を表示します。
column6: Navi has digitized the map using her hologram equipment. I am displaying a May doll at our current location.

column5:
今は港しか表示されてません
が、他の\c<$0C>地名を書き込む\c<$0F>事で、その
場所に移動できるようになります。
column6: Right now, only the harbor is shown, but by \c<$0C>filling in\c<$0F> other \c<$0C>place names\c<$0F>, you'll become able to travel to those locations.

column5:
それじゃ、駐在所を地図に書
き込んでみましょうか。
column6: Well then, why don't I try filling in the police substation on the map?

column5:
その地名は、正しい場所に書
き込まれていますよ。
column6: That place name is already filled in in the correct location.

column5:
いくらなんでも、海の上には
行けませんよぉ‥。
column6: No matter how hard you try, we can't go on top of the ocean...

column5:
まず地名を選びましょう。\n
\c<$0B>十字キー\c<$0F>で羽根を動かして、地名に
合わせます。\n

黄色の地名は、まだ地図に書
き込んでいない事を示しているんで
す。
column6: A yellow name indicates that you haven't filled that place in on the map yet.

column5:
ここで\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押すと、羽
根が地図上に表示されます。
column6: If you press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F> here, the feather will be displayed on the map.

column5:
次に地図を区切っている四角
形の中から、地名を書き込みたい場
所を選びます。\n
column6:
Next, choose the location on the grid dividing the map that you want to fill in with the place name.
}[wait][clear]

column5:
四角形の\c<$0C>１辺は５００メート
ル\c<$0F>です。\n
\n
column6:
\c<$0C>One square\c<$0F> on the grid is \c<$0C>500 meters\c<$0F>.
}[wait][clear]

column5:
つまり、今羽根が指している
場所は、港から南に５００メートル
の場所って事になります。\n
column6:
In other words, that means the location the feather currently points to is 500 meters south of the harbor.
}[wait][clear]

column5: ここで\c<$0B>[I]ボタン\c<$0F>を押すと‥。
column6: If we press the \c<$0B>I Button\c<$0F> here...

column5:
ほら、これで駐在所が地図に
書き込まれました。
column6: Look: The substation has now been filled in on the map.

column5:
それじゃ、がんばって正しい
地図を完成させて下さいね。
column6: Now then, do your best to complete an accurate map.

column5:
あっれぇ？\n
駐在所の位置が間違ってたかなぁ？
column6:
Huuunh?\n
Did we get the substation's location wrong?

column5:
‥‥メイ。\n
ホテルなんてないじゃない!!
column6:
...May.\n
Does this look like a hotel!?

column5:
はぁぁ‥仕方ないですねぇ。
駐在所に戻って場所を確認しましょ
う。
column6:
(sigh)...Oh well.\n
Let's go back to the substation and check where it is.

column5:
へぇ、ゴミ一つ落ちてないわ
ねぇ。
column6: Ooh, there's not a single bit of litter around.

column5:
でも‥教えてもらった場所と
は違うみたいですけど？
column6: But...isn't this a different place from the one we heard about?

column5:
なに言ってんのよ!!\n
ここまで来て、泳がないなんてバチ
があたるってものよ！
column6:
What're you saying!?\n
It'd be a darned shame not to swim after hiking all the way out here!

column5: 確かに浜辺だけど‥。
column6: It's definitely _a_ beach, but...

column5:
この浜辺には、これといって
注目すべき物はなさそうです。
column6: This beach doesn't seem to have anything worth paying attention to on it.

column5:
夜光洞らしき所なんて、ない
ですよ。
column6: This doesn't seem to be any kind of noctilucent cave.

column5:
おっかしいなぁ。\n
場所を聞き間違えたかな？
column6:
That's funny.\n
Did I mishear the location?

column5:
天狗岩らしきものは、見えま
せんね。
column6: I don't see anything that looks like a `tengu rock.~

column5: あれ、場所を間違えたかな？
column6: Huh? Did I mishear the location?

column5: 三本岬って‥どれ？
column6: Threewood Cape...Where is it?

column5:
場所が違ってるんじゃないで
しょうか？
column6: Maybe you got the location wrong?

column5: ここが山頂‥‥？
column6: Is this the summit...?

column5:
そんなはずないじゃないです
か。場所を間違えてるんですよ！
column6: It certainly doesn't seem to be, does it? You've gotten the location wrong!

column5: ふ、古寺は?!
column6: Wh-where's the old temple!?

column5:
‥‥‥見あたりませんね。\n
この場所ではなさそうですよ。
column6:
...Nowhere to be seen.\n
It doesn't seem to be here.

column5:
どう見ても浜辺じゃないです
よ‥。
column6: That's not a beach by any stretch of the imagination...

column5:
あ、あはは‥‥。\n
間違えたみたい。
column6:
Ah, aha-ha...\n
Looks like I got it wrong.

column5:
お父さんは、草薙英二って名
前でね。\n
一応、刑事だったんだよ。
column6: My father's name was Eiji Kusanagi. He was a detective...

column5:
でも捜査に行き詰まったのか
‥ノイローゼだったのか。
column6: But he apparently hit a dead end on an investigation...and he had a nervous breakdown.

column5:
５年前に、睡眠薬を飲んで自
殺しちゃったんだ。
column6: Five years ago, he committed suicide by taking sleeping pills.

column5:
青い空に広い海‥ほんとに、
きれいだよねぇ。
column6:
Blue skies and open seas...\n
It's so pretty.

column5:
くすくす‥。\n
メイって表現が稚拙ですよねぇ。
column6: Hee-hee...Your phrasing is so childish, May.

column5:
もっとこう‥冴え渡る青空に
燦然と輝く澄んだ海、って感じとか
ですね。
column6: I think it's more like...placid azure skies and tranquil, radiantly sparkling seas.

column5:
むぅ。\n
ナビって妙なところで細かいんだよ
ね‥。
column6:
Mnn.\n
You've picked a weird time to get detailed...

column5: 素子って、元気ですよねぇ。
column6: Motoko sure is lively.

column5:
きれいな泉ですね。\n
この地下水が海に流れ込んでいくん
ですね‥。
column6:
What a pretty spring.\n
So this underground water flows off into the sea...

column5:
あれま。\n
ずいぶん感傷的だねぇ。\n
誰かにフられたの？
column6: Dear me, you sound almost sentimental. Did somebody dump you?

column5:
ナビに、恋愛感情なんてあり
ません！
column6: Navi has no concept of romantic feelings!

column5:
さ、のんびり眺めている様な
状況じゃないですよ！
column6: And this is no time to be standing around chit-chatting!

column5:
しっかし思い切った事する犯
人だよね。\n
普通、泉に隠れようなんて思う？
column6: The culprit sure took drastic measures. What normal person would think to hide in a spring?

column5:
犯人はこんな所に隠れておっ
たのか‥。\n
冷たかろうに、たいした奴じゃのぉ
column6: So the culprit went and hid 'round here...Looks mighty cold. What a bold fella.

column5:
おれと‥お前の親父、草薙英
二が同期だってのは話したな。
column6: I told you that me and...your old man, Eiji Kusanagi, were in the same year.

column5:
同じ時期に、おれ達の部署に
配属された刑事がいた。\n
名前は‥武藤洋。
column6: During that same time, there was a detective who got assigned to our department. His name was...Hiroshi Mutou.
column7: NOTE: 洋 is read as ひろし, per the voice acting -- i don't think this is actually given explicitly anywhere in the text

column5:
３人とも若くてな。\n
ムチャをしては、上司に怒鳴られて
いたよ。
column6: We were all so young[nbsp]-- always doing reckless stuff and getting chewed out by our boss.

column5:
もっとも今思えば、充実した
日々だったな。
column6: And yet when I think back now, those were the best days of my life.

column5:
だが‥７年前に、そんな毎日
も終ってしまった。
column6: But...seven years ago, that time came to an end.

column5:
ある事件を担当していた武藤
が‥捜査の最中に銃弾をうけて命を
落としたんだ。
column6: Mutou, who'd been working a certain case, took a bullet and lost his life.

column5:
犯人は逃亡、捜査は打ち切り
おれ達の上司も責任を取らされて、
左遷、退職だ。
column6: The culprit got away, and the investigation was aborted. Our boss was forced to take responsibility and got demoted[nbsp]-- he resigned.
column7: CHECK: "demoted" and "resigned" are simply separated by a comma here, so this isn't totally clear on its own; i guess this is indicating watabe was demoted and subsequently resigned? he's still an officer, so perhaps the idea is that he quit and joined a police force elsewhere.

column5:
おれも草薙も、友人を失って
からの数日間は、ろくに仕事が出来
なかった‥。
column6: Me and Kusanagi couldn't work right for days after we'd lost our friend...

column5: おはようございます、メイ。
column6: Good morning, May.
column7: NOTE: this is an unused and unfinished in-engine, text-only version of the cutscene of may waking up. it was ultimately made into an out-of-engine cutscene. loading it up reveals a placeholder sky background with a crude cartoon sun drawn on top, with this dialogue shown over it. the dialogue also seems to be an early draft of what appears in the finished scene.

column5: おはよう。
column6: Morning.

column5:
ん〜っ!!\n
気持ちのいい朝だねぇ。
column6:
Mmm!\n
What a wonderful morning, huh?

column5: もう昼近いですって。
column6: Hey, it's almost afternoon now.

column5:
でも‥こんなにきれいな島で
人が殺されたなんて‥なんか、信じ
られませんよね。
column6: But...A person getting killed in pretty scenery like this...Somehow, I just can't believe it.

column5: そうだね‥‥。
column6: Yeah...

column5:
こいつぁ、驚れぇたな。\n
こんな所に洞窟があったなんて‥、
おれも知らなかったぜ。
column6:
Just fulla surprises, ain'tcha?\n
Even I didn't know there's a place like this around.

column5:
それで、おれは嬢ちゃんの帰
りを、ここで待てばいいんだな？
column6: Want me to wait here till ya get back, missy?

column5:
うん。\n
なるべく早く帰るようにするから、
少し待っててね。じゃ！
column6: Yeah. I'll try to be back as soon as possible, so hold on for a bit. Bye!

column5: ううっ‥さっむ〜い！
column6: Ooh...It's COLD!

column5:
寒いはずです。\n
気温は１０℃をきってますから。
column6:
As well it should be.\n
The air temperature is under 10 degrees Celsius.

column5: こ‥これは？
column6: Th...this is...?

column5:
ここが、メモにあった倉庫で
しょうか‥‥。
column6: Is this the warehouse from the note...?

column5: 周りを見る
column6: Look around

column5:
周りを見る\n
調べる
column6:
Look around\n
Investigate

column5:
周りを見る\n
調べる\n
立ち去る
column6:
Look around\n
Investigate\n
Leave

column5:
木箱　　　　　　麻の袋\n
棚の中　　　　　彫像\n
除湿機　　　　　調べない
column6:
Wooden crates
[sp]<$70>
Sacks
\n

Shelves
[sp]<$70>
Statue
\n

Dehumidifier
[sp]<$70>
Don't check

column5:
箱やら袋やら‥ずいぶんたく
さんありますね。\n
まさに倉庫って感じですよ。
column6: Boxes and sacks...There are so many of them. It really does feel like a warehouse.

column5:
‥‥‥秘密の倉庫、ね。\n
メモが、重大な秘密みたいに、鎌の
中に隠されてた。
column6:
...A hidden warehouse, huh.\n
The note was hidden in the sickle like it was a major secret.

column5:
そして、その鎌を手にした武
藤さんは、殺された‥‥。
column6: And Mutou, who'd gotten his hands on the sickle, was killed...

column5:
『偶然』だなんて、ちょっと
思えないよね。\n
‥中を調べてみよう。
column6: It's hard to imagine it's just a coincidence. ...Let's check the inside.

column5:
照明がついてるって事は、ど
こかに発電機を備えてますね。
column6: The fact that the lights are on means there's a generator installed somewhere.

column5:
それにしても、一体‥誰が、
こんな倉庫を作ったんでしょう？
column6: But really...I wonder who on earth built a warehouse like this?

column5:
たくさんありますねぇ。\n
ほら、実弾の箱もありますよ。
column6:
There sure are a lot of them.\n
Look, there are boxes of ammunition too.

column5:
同じ箱が、まだあります。\n
みんな銃が入ってるとしたら‥とん
でもない量になりますよ。
column6: There are more of the same boxes. If all of them have guns in them...it would be an absurd quantity.

column5:
白い粉と‥紙が入ってるね。
ＣＫって書いてあるけど‥‥。\n
まさか?!
column6:
There's a white powder, and...paper inside. It says `CK~ on it...\n
Could this be...!?

column5:
予想通りだと思いますよ。\n
ＣＫとはコカインの事です。\n
コークとも呼ばれる麻薬ですよ。
column6:
I think it's as you imagine.\n
CK refers to cocaine. It's a drug that's also known as coke.

column5:
ＣＫとはコカインの事です。
コークとも呼ばれる麻薬ですよ。
column6: CK refers to cocaine. It's a drug that's also known as coke.

column5:
書類と‥‥光磁気ディスクが
入ってるよ。\n
何の書類だろ‥？
column6: There are papers and...magneto-optical disks inside. What are these documents...?
column7: NOTE: i'd honestly never heard of magneto-optical disks before, but apparently they were popular in japan (the "minidisc" is a type of these)

column5:
‥‥‥って、これナビのデー
タだよ！
column6: ...Hey, this is _your_ data, Navi!

column5:
そ、そんなはずないです！\n
社外秘のデータですよ!!
column6: Th-that can't be! That data is a company secret!
column7: NOTE: you might think there's some significance to this and it'll come up later in the plot. you'd be wrong. again.

column5:
ふ〜ん、専門用語が多すぎて
何が書いてあるのか、さっぱり分か
らないけど。
column6: Hmm...There's too much jargon, and I can't understand what it says at all.

column5:
要するに、この書類とディス
クにナビの全てが入ってるんだ？
column6: Basically, these documents and this disk contain you in your entirety, Navi?

column5:
うぅ‥まるで、ヌードを隠し
撮りされた気分ですよ。
column6: Ugh...I feel like I've been secretly filmed nude.

column5:
これは、また。ずいぶん古そ
うな仏像だね。
column6: There's this, too. It looks like a really old Buddha statue.

column5:
仏像ではないですよ。\n
おそらく古い遺跡あたりから、盗掘
されたものだと思います。
column6:
It's not a Buddha statue.\n
I think it's probably been stolen from an archeological site.

column5: 大型の除湿機がありますよ。
column6: There's a large dehumidifier here.

column5:
除湿機って‥そんなの設置す
るなら、もっと乾燥した場所に倉庫
を作った方がいいのに！
column6: A dehumidifier...If they had to install something like that, they should've built the warehouse in a drier place!

column5:
逆に考えると、そうまでして
発見されにくい洞窟に隠したい‥、
って事になります。
column6: Looking at it the other way, going that far means they wanted to hide it in a cave that's hard to find...I'd think.

column5:
銃器、麻薬、盗掘品に企業の
秘密データ‥。\n
要するに\c<$0C>密輸品の倉庫\c<$0F>なんだ‥‥。
column6: Guns, drugs, stolen artifacts, and company data...In short, this is a \c<$0C>warehouse for smuggled goods\c<$0F>...

column5:
つまり‥武藤さんはこの秘密
を知ったために殺された‥‥？
column6: So...Mutou was killed because he learned this secret...?

column5: そんなところだろうね。
column6: That sounds about right.

column5:
‥‥ふぅ。\n
これ以上ここにいても仕方ないね。
戻ろう！
column6:
...Whew.\n
Sticking around here's not going to get us anywhere. Let's head back!

column5:
ずいぶん高いですねぇ。\n
恐くないですか？
column6:
We sure are high up.\n
Aren't you scared?

column5: だ、大丈夫。
column6: I-I'm all right.

column5: それは結構です。
column6: Well, okay then.

column5:
\c<$0B>十字キーの左右\c<$0F>で、視点を動
かすことが出来ます。
column6: You can move the viewpoint with \c<$0B>Left and Right on the D-Pad\c<$0F>.

column5:
ナビが方位を表示しますから\c<$0C>
古寺の位置を確認\c<$0F>して下さいね。
column6: Navi is projecting the bearings, so please \c<$0C>confirm the position of the old temple\c<$0F>.

column5:
木から降りる時は\c<$0B>[II]ボタン\c<$0F>を
押してください。
column6: When you want to get down from the tree, press the \c<$0B>II Button\c<$0F>.

column5:
コンティニュー\n
タイトルに戻る
column6:
Continue\n
Return to title
column7: NOTE: only used if you get a game over in the minigame. otherwise, you're just kicked straight back to the title.

column5: 白の台本
column6: White Script[sp]<$4A>

column5: 赤の台本
column6: Red Script[sp]<$94>

column6: Blue Script[br3]

column6: Green Script[sp]<$4A>
