column5:
お疲れ様です。\n
しかし‥交通課の方がこんな場所に
何の用でしょう？
column6:
Good to see you.\n
But...what's a traffic officer doing around here?

column5:
ぅげ‥これ交通課の制服だっ
たんだ。
column6: Gah...This was a traffic department uniform.

column5:
大瀧署長から現場の刑事さん
に届けるようにと、品物を預かって
いるんです。
column6: Chief Ohtaki gave me something to deliver to the detective at the crime scene.

column5:
そうでしたか、失礼致しまし
た。\n
現場は４号室、一番奥です。
column6:
Did he? Sorry, then.\n
The crime scene is Room 4, the furthest one in.

column5:
しかし‥交通課の方がこんな
場所に、何の用でしょう？
column6: But...what's a traffic officer doing around here?

column5:
とりあえず変装してみたもの
の‥うまく通してもらえるかな‥？
column6: Well, I've tried to disguise myself...Will I be able to get them to let me in?

column5: お疲れ様です。
column6: Good to see you.

column5: 状況はどうです？
column6: What's the situation?

column5:
主任刑事さんが現場を検証し
ている最中です。
column6: The detective in charge is in the middle of inspecting the crime scene.

column5:
遺体を運び出す準備も、じき
に整うでしょう。
column6: Preparations for carrying the body out will probably be complete shortly.

column5:
状況から見て間違いなく自殺
だと思うのですが‥、刑事さんは、
何か気にかけてる様でしたね。
column6: From what I've seen, I think it's unquestionably a suicide...but the detective seemed troubled by something.

column5:
ね、ね、木下ってどんな
人？\n
どうして殺されたのかしら？
column6: Hey, hey, what kind of guy was Kinoshita? I wonder why they killed him?

column5: ねぇ婦警さん。
column6: Hey, Officer.

column5:
本当に自殺なんですか？\n
この辺りに人殺しがいるなんて事は
ないですよね？
column6:
Is it really a suicide?\n
There's not a murderer around here, right?

column5:
そんな事したら、ボクだって
ばれちゃうよ。
column6: If I do that, I'll get caught.

column5:
警察の現場検証は、しばらく
続きそうですね。
column6: It looks like the police's crime scene investigation is going to go on for a while.

column5:
あいたた‥なに、あの態度?!
いくらなんでも、この仕打はヒドイ
よっ！
column6:
Ouuuch...What's the attitude for!?\n
I don't care _what_ happened, that's just mean!

column5:
ここに来てから、ずっとあん
な調子なんですよね。\n
何かイライラしてるみたいでして。
column6: He's been like that ever since he got here. Seems like he's on edge about something.

column5:
今はダメです。\n
せめて立花刑事が引き上げてからに
してくださいよ。
column6:
No, not right now.\n
At least wait until Detective Tachibana leaves.

column5:
野次馬のおばさん達も、いつ
までいるつもりなんでしょう？\n
他にする事ないんでしょうかね。
column6: How long are these ladies planning to stand around gawking? Don't they have anything else to do?

column5: 世間話するのが仕事なんだよ
column6: Gossiping is their job.

column5:
しっかし、立花さんがいると
は思わなかったなぁ。
column6: Man, I never thought Mr. Tachibana would be here.

column5:
公園で慌てていた訳は、この
事件だったんじゃないですか？
column6: Maybe this incident was the reason he was in such a hurry at the park?

column5:
立花刑事もどうしちゃったん
でしょうね？
column6: I wonder what happened with Detective Tachibana?

column5:
現場に来てから、ずっとイラ
イラしてるみたいなんですよ。
column6: Ever since he got to the crime scene, he's seemed like he's on edge.

column5:
ね、ね、さっき近所の人
に聞いたんだけどさ。\n
死んだ木下って人、アヤシイって。
column6: Hey, hey, I just heard something from a neighbor. That Kinoshita guy that died, he was shady.

column5:
１年ぐらい前に引っ越し
てきたらしいんだけどね。
column6: So apparently, he moved in about a year ago, right?

column5:
ほとんど部屋に閉じこも
りっぱなしで、あいさつしても目を
そらして逃げて行くんだって。
column6: They say he spent almost all his time shut up in his room, and even if you said `hi~ to him, he'd drop his gaze and run off.

column5:
あら、いやだ。\n
あなた、本当の婦警さんじゃなかっ
たんですね。
column6:
Oh, dearie me.\n
So you weren't a real policewoman.

column5:
どうして自殺なんかするんで
しょうね？
column6: I wonder why he commited suicide?

column5:
周りの人に迷惑をかけて‥無
責任だと思いません？
column6: It causes trouble for the people around you...Don't you think it's irresponsible?

column5:
死んだのは、この男に間違い
ありませんよ。
column6: There's no mistaking that the man that died was this one.

column5:
身元は、名前が木下哲雄らし
いという事しか判明してませんが。
column6: But as far as his identity, the only thing we've established is that his name was Tetsuo Kinoshita...apparently.

column5: 木下哲雄‥らしい？
column6: Tetuso Kinoshita...`apparently~?

column5:
籍を照会中です。\n
ほら、偽名の可能性だって否定でき
ないじゃないですか。
column6: We're checking the family register. We can't write off the possibility that it's a fake name.

column5:
本当なら、お通しするわけに
はいかないんですが‥。
column6: Honestly, I shouldn't let you through, but...

column5:
立花刑事も去り際に許可され
ましたし、メイさんだけ特別ですか
らね。
column6: Detective Tachibana gave permission as he left, so this is just for you, Miss May.

column5:
他の人達には内緒にしておい
てくださいよ。
column6: Please don't tell the other people about this.

column5:
検証は終ったんでしょうか？
さっきまでの緊迫した雰囲気がなく
なってますね。
column6: Have they finished inspecting? The tense atmosphere from earlier is gone.

column5:
立花刑事も現場から引き払い
ましてね。\n
結局、自殺という結論になりました
column6: Detective Tachibana has left the scene. In the end, he concluded it was a suicide.

column5:
事後処理が完了したら、我々
も退去する予定です。
column6: Once the mop-up work is complete, we're planning to go as well.

column5:
遺体は既に収容しましたけど
死んでいたのは、この男に間違いな
いですよ。
column6: The body's already been taken in, but there's no question that the man that died was this one.

column5:
あれ？\n
そこの喫茶店にいるの‥沢田さんと
笹木さんじゃありません？
column6:
Huh?\n
Aren't those people in the coffee shop there...Sawada and Sasaki?

column5:
ん？よく分かんないけど‥‥
そんな気もするなぁ。
column6: Hm? I'm not really sure, but...I think so, too.

column5:
店の名前は、\n
　　『ＷｏｏｄｓｙＥＬＥｎ』\n
か‥。
column6: So the shop's name is `WoodsyELEn~...

column5:
オーディオ機器の専門店みた
いだけど、コンピュータ関係も扱っ
てるみたいだね。
column6: It looks like a specialty shop for audio equipment, but apparently they sell computer stuff too.

column5:
でも、『静かの海』号の田中
さんが、この店で働いてたなんて、
驚きましたねぇ。
column6: You know, I was surprised to see Ms. Tanaka from the Silent Sea working at this shop.

column5:
やっぱり、沢田さんと笹木さ
んですよ。
column6: Yes, it _is_ Sawada and Sasaki.

column5:
喫茶『ＭＡＧＳＡＸ』ね‥。
二人ともさっきまで働いてたからね
遅い昼食なんだよ。
column6:
The coffee shop `MAGSAX,~ huh...\n
I guess since they were both working until a little while ago, they're having a late lunch.

column5:
今度、仕事じゃなくてこの街
に来たいよね。\n
ショッピングでもしたいよ。
column6: I'd like to come to this town sometime I don't have work. I want to go shopping.

column5:
どうせなら、別売りされてる
ナビ用のオプションでも買ってくれ
ればいいのに‥。
column6: In that case, it'd be nice if you could buy some of Navi's separately-sold peripherals...

column5:
お客さんが入ってるようには
見えませんねぇ。
column6: It doesn't look like there are any customers going in.

column5:
いつでも席が空いてますなん
て、自慢にもなりませんよ。
column6: It's not exactly something to brag about, having your seats empty all the time.

column5:
あれれ。\n
素子達、今度は『ＭＡＧＳＡＸ』に
いますよ。
column6: Oh my[nbsp]-- this time, Motoko and Kanna are at `MAGSAX.~

column5: あの二人、食べ過ぎだよぉ。
column6: Those two eat too much.

column5:
おっどろいたぁ‥予想通りっ
ていうか、一気に事件の核心に迫れ
そうな情報だなぁ。
column6: Oh WOW...Just like we imagined, we've found information that cuts to the heart of the case in the blink of an eye.

column5: ちょっと整理してみます？
column6: Shall we sort through it?

column5:
『園木』の事　　『組織』の事\n
『窪田』の事　　『榊』の事\n
『獣』の事　　　行動を再開

\n

\n

column5:
園木さんが、お父さんの事件
と、『組織』の関係を調べてた事は
分かるんだけど‥。
column6: I get that Sonoki was investigating my father's case and its link with the Syndicate, but...

column5:
園木さんに、調査を依頼した
のが誰なのか？\n
それが分かんないよね。
column6: Who requested the investigation from Sonoki? I don't understand that.

column5:
やっぱり『組織』が絡んでい
たみたいですね。
column6: So it seems the Syndicate was indeed involved.

column5:
警察内部にまで入り込んで、
麻薬や武器の違法売買で私腹を肥し
秘密に近付いた者は容赦なく殺す‥
column6: Penetrating even the police, they fatten their wallets trading drugs and guns, and mercilessly kill any who draw near to their secret...

column5:
立花さんが言ってたとおり‥
お父さんも『組織』に殺されたのか
も‥‥。
column6:
It's like Mr. Tachibana said...\n
My father may have been killed by the Syndicate too...

column5:
園木さんの部屋で検案書のコ
ピーを見つけましたよね。
column6: We found a copy of an autopsy report in Sonoki's room, right?

column5:
その報告者の名前が窪田晃で
したよ。
column6: The examiner's name was Akira Kubota.

column5:
木下哲雄っていう偽名で、さ
つきヶ丘４丁目に住んでる‥‥？
column6: He lives in Satsukigaoka District 4 under the alias of Tetsuo Kinoshita...?

column5:
‥今日、４丁目のアパートで
死んだ、あの写真の人だよ！
column6: ...That man who died in the District 4 apartment today[nbsp]-- the one from the photo!

column5:
偶然にしては出来すぎです。
‥ほんとに自殺でしょうか？
column6: It beggars belief for it to be a coincidence. ...Was it really a suicide?

column5: 『組織の榊』といったら‥
column6: `Sakaki from the Syndicate~ must be...

column5:
児島で捕まえたあの榊でしょ
うね。
column6: The Sakaki we caught on Kojima, right?

column5:
でも、現在は留置場で取り調
べを受けてるはずですが。
column6: But he should be undergoing questioning in jail right now.

column5:
警察内部に組織の人間がいる
んだよ。
column6: There are members of the Syndicate within the police.

column5:
捕まえたって、いつでも釈放
できるんじゃない？
column6: Even though we caught him, couldn't they just set him free anytime?

column5:
この『獣』っていうのが、情
報屋の名前だね。
column6: This `Beast~ thing is the name of an information vendor.

column5: 情報屋？
column6: Information vendor?

column5:
要するに情報を売ってくれる
人だよ。
column6: Basically, a person that sells information.

column5:
ディスクに情報を隠して、園
木さんに協力してたんじゃないかな
column6: Maybe they hid the information on the disk, and were collaborating with Sonoki.

column5: 本当に、もういいんですか？
column6: Is that really enough?

column5:
もうちょっと考えてみる\n
考える必要なんかないよ
column6:
Think about it a little more\n
There's no need to think

column5:
ともかく園木さんが『組織』
に捕まった公算が強くなったね。
column6: In any case, the possibility that Sonoki's been captured by the Syndicate has gotten stronger.

column5:
あとは、窪田氏は本当に自殺
だったのか？\n
『獣』が誰なのか？
column6: What's left is[nbsp]-- did Kubota really commit suicide? And who is `Beast~?

column5:
このあたりを調べれば、事件
の全ぼうが見えてくるんじゃないか
な？
column6: If we investigate along those lines, maybe we'll be able to get a full picture of the case?
column7: CHECK, not sure if このあたり is referring back to the questions she raised in the previous line or literally saying "around this physical area"

column6: [3x]\s<$01>What is _THIS_!?[1x]

column5: これはまた‥ひどい有様です
column6: This is...quite the awful scene.

column5: くぅ、うかつだった‥。
column6: We weren't thinking, damn it...

column5:
『組織』が園木さんを狙って
るなら、当然、葉を人質にとるくら
い考えるか‥‥。
column6: If the Syndicate's after Sonoki, then of course they'd think about taking Yoh as a hostage...

column5:
葉ちゃんと友美さん、無事で
しょうか？
column6: I wonder if Yoh and Tomomi are safe?

column5:
まさか‥葉ちゃん達、捕まっ
ちゃったんでしょうか？
column6: Could it be that...Yoh and Tomomi have been kidnapped?

column5:
とにかく、友美さんの部屋に
手がかりが残されているかどうか‥
調べてみないと。
column6: Whatever happened...we have to try to find out if any clues have been left in Tomomi's room.

column5:
ふぅ、やっぱりこの格好が一
番だよね。\n
制服なんて、窮屈でたまんないよ。
column6: Whew...Yep, this look is the best after all. Uniforms are just unbearably stuffy.

column5:
でも、警官の服装も似合って
たじゃないですか。
column6: But the police outfit suited you too, didn't it?

column5:
それに『秋の交通安全パレー
ド』が始まる前に、また着替えなけ
ればならないんですよ。
column6: And you'll have to change clothes again before the `Autumn Traffic Safety Parade~ starts.

column5:
仕事とはいえねぇ‥。\n
うんざりだよ。
column6: Don't start in about work...I'm fed up with it.

column5:
よぉ！\n
元気にしてたようだな。
column6:
Hey!\n
Looks like you're doing well.

column7: NOTE: this is an unfinished mockup of the game over sequence outside the cafe. backgrounds consist of amusing placeholder art made from in-game sprites, ohtaki's face graphics don't load correctly, and the voice clips that play are random unrelated stuff from elsewhere in the game. for the finished game, this was ultimately integrated directly into the district 2 adv. perhaps they were originally planning on having a slightly more elaborate sequence? the placeholder art here seems to imply they wanted a CG of may surrounded by police.

column5:
ほお、スター署長じきじきの
お出ましとは。\n
ご苦労な事だな。
column6: Hoh, if it isn't a visit from Chief Star herself. How troublesome.

column5:
大瀧署長?!\n
な‥なんで、こんな所に‥‥。
column6:
Chief Ohtaki!?\n
Wh-why...are you...?

column5:
我々の事を、しつこくい杢ま
わるねずみがいたものでね。
column6: There was a rat stubbornly sniffing around in our affairs, you see.
column7: NOTE: this seems to contain a typo or conversion error -- い杢 should be かぎ, which would make this a duplicate of 5347. it seems to be nonsense as it is.

column5:
ちょっと出向いてみたら、な
かなかの獲物が捕まったよ。
column6: When I turned my back for a moment, it snatched up quite the prize.

column5:
君は少々目立ちすぎたのだよ
これに懲りて、今後は自重したまえ
column6: You stood out a little too much. Learn your lesson from this and keep your head down.
column7: NOTE: dupe of 5349 except for comma

column5:
もっとも‥今後の人生があれ
ば、の話だがね。
column6: Ah, but...that's if you have a life after this, that is.
...B-bullets...

column5:
‥‥メモが添えられてます。
窪田さんの手記みたいですが‥。
column6: ...There's a note attached. It seems to be from Kubota...

column5: 大瀧‥‥。
column6: Ohtaki...

column5:
『獣』さんが言っていた事は
本当だったんです。
column6: What Beast told us was true.

column5:
署長である大瀧自身が、『組
織』の人間だったんですよ！
column6: Chief Ohtaki himself is a member of the Syndicate!

column5: 困った人達ですね。
column6: What a troublesome bunch you are.

column5:
コンティニュー\n
タイトルに戻る
column6:
Continue\n
Return to title

column7: NOTE: this seems to be an unused (earlier?) version of the case 2b map message block

column5:
ナビのホログラム装置を使っ
て、地図を映像化してみました。\n
現在地にはメイ人形を表示します。
column6: Navi has digitized the map using her hologram equipment. I am displaying a May doll at our current location.

column5:
今は港しか表示されてません
が、他の地名を書き込む事で、その
場所に移動できるようになります。
ナビ「それじゃ、駐在所を地図に書
き込んでみましょうか。

その地名は、正しい場所に書
き込まれていますよ。
column6: That place name is already filled in in the correct location.

column5:
いくらなんでも、海の上には
行けませんよぉ‥。
column6: No matter how hard you try, we can't go on top of the ocean...

column5:
まず地名を選びましょう。\n
十字キーで羽根を動かして、地名に
合わせます。\n
ナビ「黄色の地名は、まだ地図に書
き込んでいない事を示しています。

ここで１ボタンを押すと、羽
根が地図上に表示されます。

次に地図を区切っている四角
形の中から、地名を書き込みたい場
所を選びます。\n
ナビ「四角形の１辺は５００メート
ルです。\n
\n
ナビ「つまり、今羽根が指している
場所は、港から南に５００メートル
の場所って事になります。\n
ナビ「ここで１ボタンを押すと‥

ほら、これで駐在所が地図に
書き込まれました。
column6: Look: The substation has now been filled in on the map.

column5:
それじゃ、がんばって正しい
地図を完成させて下さいね。
column6: Now then, do your best to complete an accurate map.

column5:
あっれぇ？駐在所の位置が間
違ってたかな？

‥‥メイ。ホテルなんてない
じゃない！

はぁぁ‥‥仕方ないですねぇ
駐在所に戻って場所を確認しましょ
う。

へぇ、ゴミ一つ落ちてないわ
ね。

でも‥教えてもらった場所と
は違うみたいですけど‥。

なに言ってるのよ。ここまで
来て、泳がないなんてバチがあたる
ってものよ！

夜光洞らしき所なんて、ない
ですよ。
column6: This doesn't seem to be any kind of noctilucent cave.

column5:
おっかしいなぁ。場所を聞き
間違えたかな？

天狗岩らしきものは、見えま
せんね。
column6: I don't see anything that looks like a `tengu rock.~

column5: あれ、場所を間違えたかな？
column6: Huh? Did I mishear the location?

column5: 三本岬って‥どれ？
column6: Threewood Cape...Where is it?

column5:
場所が違ってるんじゃないで
しょうか。
ここが山頂‥‥？
column6: Is this the summit...?

column5:
そんなはず、ないじゃないで
すか。場所を間違えてるんですよ！
ふ、古寺は？！

‥‥‥見あたりませんね。\n
この場所ではなさそうですよ。
column6:
...Nowhere to be seen.\n
It doesn't seem to be here.

column5:
あれ？\n
‥このドア、鍵が掛かってるよ。
column6:
Huh?\n
...This door is locked.

column5:
どこかに隠された鍵があるの
かも‥‥。\n
メイ、探してみましょう!!
column6: There may be a hidden key somewhere...May, let's try to find it!

column7: NOTE: option 1 can also be read "Kusanagi", though for obvious reasons I haven't used that for the translation, and uses a very similar kanji to try to trick you. "Moriyama" comes from game director Toyoharu Moriyama.

column7:
NOTE: these are contextual hints for the key "sidequest" -- press button 2 as if opening the "menu" to see them.

the order of events is:
- examine the locked door (accessible through a "secret passage" on the right side of Yoh's room, which is rather hilariously concealed using a scrolling mechanic found nowhere else in the game)
- talk to motoko
- talk to watabe
- answer tachibana's quiz
- talk to watabe again to get the key
- unlock the door
- attempt to enter the room with the receptionist
- talk to tachibana to get a toy gun
- shoot the receptionist
- get the final messages by repeatedly opening and closing the "menu"

column5:
あら、私と勝負しようって言
うのね。いいわよ、かかっていらっ
しゃい[heart]
column6: Dear me, so you're saying you want a showdown? Very well then[nbsp]-- bring it on, if you will.[nbsp][heart]

column5:
メイ!!\n
時間が\c<$0B>０\c<$0F>になる瞬間に、\c<$0B>[I]ボタンを\c<$0F>
押して下さい!!
column6:
May!!\n
The moment the time reaches \c<$0B>zero\c<$0F>, press \c<$0B>the I Button\c<$0F>!!
column7:
NOTE: the actual mechanic is that you can shoot at any time, but if there's more than a second left on the timer, you're shooting her in the back and get the "coward" message.

also, if you watch the timer frame-by-frame, it's actually quite screwed up, jumping between higher and lower values erratically and taking ~75 frames to decrement by 1 second rather than 60

column5:
これはこれは、スターくん。
よくぞここまで来れたものだな。\n
誉めてつかわすぞ。
column6:
Well, well, well, Miss Star.\n
Most skillful of you to make it all the way here. I must commend you indeed.

column5:
さあ、これは私からのささや
かなプレゼントだ。\n
遠慮無く受け取りたまえ。
column6: Now then, this is a trifling little present from me. Don't hesitate to accept it.
